title: Senior IT Firstline Support
description:
We're now looking for a Senior IT Firstline Support to join our IT department in Stockholm!
   

  

 As the IT Firstline Support, you will work with our internal support team to support our staff in our different studio locations.
   

  

**The Position**
 You will be a part of the IT department consisting of our Support and Infrastructure team. In the role you’ll be reporting to our IT Operations Manager.
   

  

 To succeed in this role you will need at least 2 years of relevant work experience, know your way around computers and how to build them but most importantly: Have a true passion for IT and Tech.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Solve incoming support tickets through Jira Service Desk independently and in a professional way while maintaining set SLAs.
* Provide on-site support and troubleshoot Windows & Apple clients, hardware and software.
* Execute the onboarding & offboarding, including setting up PCs and user accounts for new hires.
* Create documentation of your solutions in our internal database.
* Maintain our meeting rooms making sure they’re running as intended and providing a smooth user experience.
* Handle purchases of hardware and software.


**Who You Are**
* 2+ years of IT experience, a plus if it’s prior experience of working in a Game Development Studio.
* Previous experience working with Active Directory & Google Workspace
* Fluent in English, both written and verbal communication.
* A team player and able to work constructively across functions.
* A pragmatic, unpretentious problem solver with strong communication skills


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please not that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: CUSTOMER SUPPORT SPECIALIST
description:
SAS Customer Service handles millions of customer interactions annually across numerous markets with the support of dedicated contact centers. We're on an exciting journey to redefine customer service -focusing on fraud prevention, digitalization, automation, and process development - to meet evolving customer needs while ensuring efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
   

  

 We’re looking for Customer Support Specialists to join our Stockholm office to strengthen our in-house operational team. If you have experience in fraud prevention, the Amadeus reservation system, or loyalty programs, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 As a Customer Support Specialist, You’ll Deliver High-level Support To Our Contact Centers, Corporate Customers, And Internal Teams. You’ll
   

  

* Provide expert vendor support and ensure quality assurance.
* Conduct onsite training, floorwalking, and online quality checks.
* Handle escalated cases and direct interactions with premium customers.
* Support SAS departments in reservations, products, and customer journeys.
* Detect and report fraud while improving work processes and instructions.


**What You Bring**
* Customer Service Expertise: Experience with phone, chat, and email support.
* Technical Knowledge: Proficiency in Amadeus (bookings, fares, reissues) and tools like Salesforce and Power BI.
* Airline Industry Experience: Broad aviation knowledge is a plus!
* Languages: Strong English skills and a good understanding of Nordic languages.


**Who You Are**
* Customer-Centric: Empathetic and service-oriented.
* Proactive personality: Able to take initiative and adapt in a fast-paced environment.
* Team Player: Collaborative and ready to multi-task as needed.


**What We Offer**
 At SAS, you’ll enjoy attractive travel benefits, free gym access, and a solid pension scheme. We offer great opportunities for professional growth in an international environment. Our Frösundavik office provides a gym, restaurant, café, and convenient services, located in a green area near Hagaparken. It’s easily accessible by bus, commuter train, and bike paths.
   

  

**Other Of Importance**
* This position is in Stockholm (SAS Head Office in Solna/Frösundavik).
* We offer a hybrid work model, allowing you to work both from home and the office.
* Some travel to vendor sites and other SAS offices will be required.
* Type of employment: Full-time.
* Desired start date: March 1 or as soon as possible.


**Does this sound like you?**
 Please send us your resume and cover letter before 01 February. If you have questions about the position, you’re welcome to contact Rasmus Alex Thunø (recruiting manager), at rasmus.thuno@sas.dk .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Internal IT and Security Director
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 As our Internal IT and Security Director you will be part of developing a newly created function to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of our internal IT operations. This responsibility has previously been shared between, amongst others, our CTO, CTIO and some other department heads. Those responsibilities will now be transferred into a central role reporting to the CFO. In that central role you’ll be collaborating closely with stakeholders from the entire Mentimeter organization ranging from the legal to department heads. Your goal will be to catalyze and enable the entire organization. You will also have the formal role as the Security Officer for the company.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Maintain and update Mentimeter IT strategy, and management team, company objectives and key stakeholders alignment.
* Manage the annual IT budget
* Team leadership and line management responsibilities, leading a team of 3 direct reports
* Lead the overall Information Security work in collaboration with stakeholders at the company
* Hold the formal role as Security Officer for Mentimeter AB
* Audit and take action when needed and enforce IT policies, procedures, and compliance with regulations and business needs.
* Oversee and manage IT, applications and systems environment and infrastructure (excluding the infrastructure and systems that are delivering our own SaaS product
* Ensure necessary availability, reliability, and security of IT systems
* Ensure information architecture is sound and data integrity is maintained
* Accountable for service desk for IT-related issues, providing guidance and support
* Vendor management for both internal systems with employee data as well as CRM and automation systems with external customer data
* Process owner for new vendor procurement, vendor relationships as well as sunsetting vendors
* Note: You are not the budget owner or decision maker of most systems. that is the department head, but you will own the overall process and enforce e.g. compliance and ensure there is a solid business case for the procurement. You will act as the advisor to owners of systems in the Sales, Marketing, Catalyst, Product and Finance & Legal departments


**Who are you?**
 To thrive in this role, we believe you embrace IT operations as an enabler for organizational success. You are motivated by the commercial value that technology can create and are driven by finding innovative solutions to support such efforts.
   

  

 Additionally, you possess strong leadership skills, project management expertise and a strategic mindset that aligns IT strategy with business goals. Your excellent communication and stakeholder management skills allow you to explain and simplify complex topics to non-technical colleagues and stakeholders, fostering a collaborative environment.
   

  

 You like to work in the cross-section of entrepreneurial approach and doing it by the book. You’re passionate about leading others and helping colleagues reach their highest potential. You also thrive in an environment that highly values building a culture of continuous improvements in the IT department.
   

  

**What experiences will you be expected to bring with you, you may ask?**
* At least 8+ years of proven experience in an IT management role, with 4+ years in senior leadership
* Experience with BYOD environment and best-of-breed vendor strategies
* Strong proficiency in various IT systems and infrastructure, including IT security, network administration, and cloud-based systems.
* Demonstrated success in managing and negotiating with vendors, including software and hardware suppliers.
* Experience with automation tools and scripting skills
* Track record of establishing and managing IT budgets
* Ability to develop and implement IT strategies aligned with company objectives
* Experience with IT compliance and regulatory environments.
* Previous line management and team leader experience empowering your team members and supporting their growth
* Fully proficiency in English, both in written and verbal communication


 Looking To Really Stand Out From The Crowd? Here Are Some Of The Bonus Points That Will Help You Do So
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field
* Certification in IT governance or security, such as CISM, CISSP
* Programming skills
* Ability to conduct technology audits and implement corrective measures
* Experience from working at a listed company
* Experience from working in similar-sized (200-500 people) fast-growing companies


 Still not sure if you’d tick all the boxes? Welcome with your application anyway as we look forward to getting to know your background and success stories.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: IT Samordnare Stockholm Arlanda Airport
description:
**IT Samordnare till Stockholm Arlanda Airport**
 Vi på Swedavia söker nu en IT/Installationssamordnare med erfarenhet av att arbeta i projekt med intressenter från flera verksamhetsområden. Har du erfarenhet och vill komma vidare i karriären, då kanske detta är rollen för dig!
   

  

**Vad innebär rollen?**
 Som IT samordnare är du en del i Swedavia IT`s organisation. En viktig uppgift blir att skapa ett gott och kreativt arbetsklimat och skapa förutsättningar för alla involverade att samverka, kommunicera och stimulera till att projektet uppnår definierade leveranser, inom ramen för tid, kostnad och omfattning, och samtidigt leverera med god kvalitet.
   

  

* Projektplanen styr aktiviteter och funktioner inom projektet, och du koordinerar IT-samordnarens roll därefter.
* Under genomförandefasen leder och övervakar du det dagliga arbetet och projektets aktiviteter.
* Du ansvarar för att uppnå projektets mål gällande tid, kostnad och kvalitet genom användning av tidsplaner, riskanalyser och kontrollplaner.
* Rollen kräver relevant domänkunskap samt breda IT-kunskaper inom områden som nätverk, databaser och brandväggar.
* Du arbetar nära andra intressenter, såsom Service Delivery Managers, Delivery Managers, arkitekter, projektledare, IT-koordinatorer samt externa partners, för att hålla dig uppdaterad kring tekniska och reglerande krav.
* Resor till andra flygplatser kan förekomma.


**Vem är du?**
 Utbildning med generalistkompetens inom verksamhet, IT och byggnadsmetodik. Att kunna förstå projektmetodik tex XLPM eller motsvarande, ex. PPS alternativt IPMA, är en fördel men även att anpassa och följa Swedavias interna processer är ett krav.
   

  

* Du bör ha en hög kompetens inom ditt område och kunna tillämpa planer och följa företagets interna processer.
* Du har arbetat i stora komplexa projekt, inom IT och byggnads, gärna i gränslandet mellan IT, verksamhet och förvaltning.
* Du bör ha arbetat i globala miljöer där flygplats är meriterande.
* Viss självständighet men även samarbetsförmåga är viktig.
* Kandidaten är driven i sitt arbete och ser alltid till kundens bästa, där återkoppling och dokumentation i alla riktningar är en självklarhet.


 Meriterande om utbildning alternativt erfarenhet finns, i entreprenadjuridik inom standardavtalen - Allmänna Bestämmelser för byggnads-, anläggnings- och installationsarbeten avseende entreprenader respektive totalentreprenader (AB, ABT).
   

  

 Utbildning BAS U & P – Byggarbetsmiljösamordnare är också meriterande men ej krav.
   

  

 Vi tror att du har arbetat i komplexa projekt kombinerat med IT och verksamhet. Att du medverkat i projekt med fokus på lagkrav och branschstandard är starkt meriterande. Du bör bidra med erfarenhet inom projekt och inneha en utbildning alternativt erfarenhet inom entreprenad/juridik samt förstå övergripande projektmetodik.
   

  

 Förmåga att leda och koordinera en mindre grupp installatörer givet projektets planering. Kandidaten skall ha goda kommunikativa färdigheter och förmåga att skapa goda relationer med olika intressenter i verksamheten. Miljön är dynamisk och projektet är förändringsbenäget vilket ställer krav på att snabbt kunna ställa om, arbeta efter nya planer med ett positivt mindset och vara en förebild gentemot övriga intressenter.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Du erbjuds ett arbete i en miljö i ständig förändring och utveckling där du får möjlighet att bidra med din kompetens. Flygplatsen präglas av högt engagemang hos medarbetarna där alla hjälps åt inom våra verksamhetsområden. Vi arbetar processorienterat för att bidra till en god leverans till våra kunder och skapa en väl fungerande arbetsplats med god stämning och bra arbetsmiljö.
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Dan Fornes, dan.fornes@swedavia.se.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande. Sista ansökningsdag är den 24 jan och vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Hur är det att arbeta på Swedavia?**
 Vårt fokus är att möjliggöra hållbart resande och uppmuntra nytänkande för att skapa en välkomnande, trygg och inkluderande arbetsgemenskap där du kan växa och göra verklig skillnad – läs mer här! Jobba hos oss | Om Swedavia
   

  

 Då flygplatser är en säkerhetsklassad verksamhet genomgår samtliga kandidater som går vidare i rekryteringsprocessen en bakgrundskontroll. För vissa tjänster även en säkerhetsprövning.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**About This Position**
 We are looking for an ambitious Business Analyst to support our fast-growing businesses in the Nordics with brands such as Schwarzkopf, Got2be, Barnängen, Osis, Pritt and Loctite. In this role you will actively support the organization in driving business development towards the achievement of targets. In addition, you work closely with the controlling organization for Cluster North (Nordics & UK/Ireland) and report to the Head of Controlling located in our office in Sundbyberg. You will also be part of the dynamic global organization with exciting opportunities for career development around the region/world.
   

  

**What You´ll Do**
* Ensure fast, timely and reliable reporting in line with monthly closing and reporting deadlines.
* Proactively provide fast, accurate and reliable financial analysis of business results and costs development
* Support sales organization and business controllers with analyses to monitor business development vs. plan.
* Support the detailed follow up of relevant business targets, offering early warning, advice about risks and opportunities and show potential impacts and provide recommendations.
* Ensure adherence to Henkels Corporate Standards and relevant laws and regulations.


**What Makes You a Good Fit**
* Degree in Finance and Accounting.
* Previous demonstrable experience in a Controlling, Audit or similar role (2-3 years).
* Strong IT skills (Excel, BI tools), SAP knowledge is a plus.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, Finnish is a merit.
* To be successful in this role you need to be engaged and committed to high quality work, possess strong analytical and communication skills and enjoy working in a dynamic international organisation.


**Some perks of joining Henkel**
* Flexible work scheme with flexible hours, hybrid and work from anywhere policies
* Diverse national and international growth opportunities
* Globally wellbeing standards with health and preventive care programs
* Gender-neutral parental leave for a minimum of 8 weeks
* Employee Share Plan with voluntary investment and Henkel matching shares
* Occupational Health Checks & Private Health Insurance
* Sports compensation allowance
* Pension
* Annual Leave: 30 days plus public holidays


 At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different genders, origins, cultures, religions, sexual orientations, disabilities, and generations.

title: Engineering Manager Data Platform
description:
We’re a cutting-edge tech-enabled bank on a mission to revolutionize financing for small businesses across 7 markets in northern Europe. Our innovative solutions aim to simplify access to financing and enable growth for small businesses. As we scale, we are now looking for an Engineering Manager for the Data Platform Team to be part of our journey to transform the financial landscape for entrepreneurs.
   





**About the role** 




 As an Engineering Manager for our Data Platform team, you’ll lead the team consisting of our Data Engineers and Analytics Engineers. The team is responsible for designing, implementing, iterating, and improving our data lake and data warehouse, as well as directly supporting the different analysts/stakeholders that depend on our data platform.
 



 As we see it, an Engineering Manager with us has 3 main focus areas:
 


* The People - You are the responsible line manager of your team, helping them with personal and professional growth by sharing appropriate responsibilities with clear expectations. Also, you are a present and empathic leader, running biweekly 1on1s, and performance reviews.
* Team Deliveries - You nurture autonomy within your team and share responsibilities with your team members in line with their experience and capabilities. You will lead the progress of daily work, resolve blockers, and facilitate decisions and discussions within and outside your team. You actively work to improve the team’s way of working to achieve transparency, efficiency, teamwork, knowledge-sharing, and quality deliveries. Together with the team, the architect, and leadership, you will design the team’s technical roadmap and ensure it aligns with the company’s broader goals, setting clear and achievable targets for future growth.
* The Technical Implementation - You are constantly evaluating your team’s deliveries, identifying technical debts, future roadblocks, and setting a strategy to keep a healthy state.



  

**Here’s what we're looking for:** 



* Proven work experience in data warehousing, ETL processes, building and orchestrating data pipelines.
* Tech skills in:
	+ Coding/Languages: Python, SQL, template languages (json, yaml), Jinja
	+ Infrastructure and Tools: AWS services (Lambda, Glue, Batch, Step Functions) or analogous services with Azure/GCP, dbt, Docker, IaC concepts (CloudFormation/Terraform)
* Hands-on experience with data warehouse providers such as Redshift, Snowflake, Big Query, or similar. As well as basic principles of data lake structuring, including data ingestion, governance, and processing.
* Proven experience in leading a team of data engineers.
* You possess a deep understanding of how data is consumed and utilized within an organization. You recognize its critical role in driving business value and are committed to advancing a culture of data-driven decision-making.



**Why join us?** 




 This is a unique opportunity to be part of the growth journey with a fintech company that is redefining financial services for small businesses in Northern Europe. You’ll work with a passionate and innovative team, participating in creating an environment where employees thrive and contribute to a shared vision of success.
 



**One last thing** 




 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm. Don’t wait to send in your application, we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis. While the start date is flexible, the right candidate can join us immediately.
 



*Qred celebrates diversity and does not discriminate based on ethnicity, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.*

title: (Associate) Data Centre Cloud Solution Architect  – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its
 **Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Infrastructure Services Division (IS), Network & Data Centre Unit (NDC)** 
 at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **(Associate) Data Centre Cloud Solution Architect\*.**
**This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark: (Associate) Engineer IT Technology & Infrastructure


*Panel interviews are anticipated for end of September 2024.*
 Purpose
   

  

 Are you passionate about cloud technology and eager to help shape the future of cloud infrastructure? Join us as an (Associate) Data Centre Cloud Solution Architect and become a key player in our cloud journey! We're looking for someone who thrives on overcoming challenges and is ready to support us through our cloud migration journey.
   

  

 In this role, you'll manage our technology roadmap for comprehensive cloud infrastructure services, leveraging industry-leading platforms such as AWS and Azure. You'll lead architecture design and oversee project delivery while ensuring cost-effective and efficient use of cloud resources. Your work will drive innovation, enhance operational excellence, and optimize performance, directly contributing to the achievement of the EIB Group objectives.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report directly to the Head of the Network and Data Centre Unit. You will work in close collaboration with variety of IT teams in particular with infrastructure and application teams. This dynamic role not only offers the opportunity to impact our digital landscape but also enables you to engage with diverse teams and projects.
   

  

**What Will You Do**
* Lead Cloud migration projects, take charge of end-to-end cloud migration projects, ensuring everything runs smoothly, on time, and within budget, while maintaining top-notch quality
* Regularly connect with stakeholders to gather their needs, make sure they’re accurately translated into technical solutions, and keep everyone in the loop with consistent updates
* Work closely with technical teams to design and implement effective cloud migration strategies
* Oversee the daily operations of our cloud services, ensuring everything runs smoothly, performs optimally, and any issues are quickly resolved
* Keep an eye on cloud service health metrics, and act swiftly to resolve any performance issues or disruptions
* Implement and maintain cloud best practices throughout the organization, ensuring top-tier service resilience, security, and compliance
* Act as the main point of contact for all infrastructure cloud service-related questions, concerns, and issues, ensuring prompt and effective resolutions
* Work closely with vendors and third-party providers to ensure optimal service delivery, support, and enhancements
* Continuously assess, research, and integrate the latest cloud technologies, tools, and services to keep us competitive and ensure operational excellence


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science, information technology or related disciplines
* At least 3 years of experience delivering IT Infrastructure Services with exposure to building, maintaining, and securing cloud technologies, cloud platform operations and cloud governance.
* Experience working with public, hybrid and on-premises private clouds
* Experience in on-premises infrastructure related technologies (compute, storage and backup and recovery)
* Experience of delivering IT cloud infrastructure projects and transformation programs, including rollouts would be considered an advantage
* Experience on troubleshooting cloud infrastructure issues.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

*(\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

**Deadline for applications:** 
 This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open position. The campaign will remain open until the position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

title: Senior Service Desk Agent
description:
Till ett uppdrag hos en kund i Stockholm söker vi en tekniker med stort driv som vill vara med och påverka vår kunds fortsatta tillväxt med ett kreativt och positivt arbetsklimat.
   

  

 Tjänsten börjar som ett konsultuppdrag men tanken är att anställningen senare ska gå över till kunden.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Du kommer att arbeta som Senior Service desk Agent inom IT-support och drift. Kunden har en bred IT-miljö med höga säkerhetskrav på system och funktioner. Servicedesken hanterar både 1:st och 2:nd line ärenden på en mycket bred nivå - allt från lösenordsbyte, hård -och mjukvarusupport, klientsupport och applikationssupport till felsökning och administration av servrar, koordinering och kontakt med 3:e parts leverantörer. Rollen ställer höga krav på service och kundbemötande.
   

  

 Utöver en mycket trevlig arbetsplats med högt i tak och konstruktiva dialoger finns stora möjligheter att visa framfötter och växa i sin roll. Du kommer att arbeta proaktivt för att skapa hög tillgänglighet och förbättra kundens IT-miljö.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 Vi söker dig med minst 5 års erfarenhet inom liknande arbetsuppgifter. Din förmåga att arbeta affärsmässigt och bygga relationer är oerhört viktig. Du finner glädje i att ge råd och stöd och därmed kan bidra till utveckling. Att du brinner för service och "det lilla extra" samt att du alltid har kunden i fokus är ett måste.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Mycket god administrativ kunskap om AD, Azure AD, MS365, ärendehanteringsprocess, dokumentation/uppföljning
* Relevant erfarenhet på minst 5 år och trivs i rollen som en servicedeskmedarbetare
* Mycket goda kunskaper gällande server, nätverk, klient och molnlösningar
* Självgående
* God förmåga att finna vägar till rätt lösning
* God analytisk förmåga och kvalitetsmedveten
* Ha lätt för att lära dig nya saker och processer relaterade till IT och tjänsten
* Kunna flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Microsoft Dynamics Consultant
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Business Consulting and Services, and Outsourcing and Offshoring Consulting
description:
Senior Microsoft Dynamics 365 Consultant - BC/NAV
 



  





 Company:
 



  





 My client is regularly recognised as one of the best to work for in Sweden. Having won numerous awards as both an employer and for their services and results, they offer end-to-end solutions and dedicated teams to work with some of the biggest customers on the most innovative and exciting Dynamics 365 BC/NAV projects in the region.
 



  





 Role:
 



  





 As a Microsoft Dynamics BC/NAV Consultant you will be responsible for engagements such as the deployment, configuration and development of customised solutions. There are requirements for both Technical Consultants to be hands-on with the technical delivery as well as more business or functional Consultant roles. By joining at the beginning of this journey, you will also play an instrumental role in achieving the growth aspirations and firmly establishing the organisation as one of the leading Microsoft ERP Partners in the region.
 



  





 The opportunities are largely based in Stockholm or Malmo with visibility to customers when required.
 



  





 Required skills:
 



  




* Hands on experience of Dynamics 365 BC or NAV with a track record leading and delivering projects.
* Either Consulting experience or strong experience in a Dynamics 365 BC or NAV focused role for a large/enterprise organisation.
* Relevant Dynamics and/or Azure certifications are advantageous.
* Fluent English and Swedish language skills are essential.



  





*Thank you for your interest in this opportunity. If your application is successful we will contact you to discuss the position in more detail within 48 hours of receiving your CV. Please assume your application has been unsuccessful if you do not hear back from us within 48 hours.*

title: Network Growth Manager - Nordics
company_industry: Events Services and Business Consulting and Services
description:
Management Events is the premier platform connecting top-tier business leaders with exclusive networking opportunities, cutting-edge insights, and world-class events. We orchestrate groundbreaking interactions between these influential decision-makers and innovative software and consultancy companies shaping the future.
 



  





**Are you a relationship builder with a passion for driving growth?** 
 Management Events is seeking a Network Growth Manager to join our team. You will play a pivotal role in expanding our network of high-level decision-makers in the Nordics. How do these roles contribute to the company's growth?
 



  





 As a
 **Network Growth Manager** 
 , you will identify and cultivate new relationships with C-suite executives.
 



  





**What will you do?** 




  




* Identify and engage with high-level decision-makers in your target market market
* Initiate contact with C-level Executives by phone and on LinkedIn to excite them about our concept
* Demonstrate the value of our service and convince them to become part of our exclusive business network in personal scheduled videocall meetings
* Learn more about their interests, investments plans and upcoming projects
* Develop and execute strategies to expand our network and build valuable relationships, by knowing your customers key challenges and focus areas
* Contribute to the overall growth and success of Management Events



  





**What do we expect?** 




  




* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Strong business acumen and a results-oriented mindset
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven environment
* Have a passion for connecting with key industry players and driving business growth
* Proactive approach and eagerness towards connecting with new clients and overcoming challenges
* Ideally experience in a commercial and/or client-facing role (e.g. hospitality, sales, customer service, etc.)
* Fluency in Finnish, Swedish, Norwegian or Danish and English



  





**Why Management Events?** 




  




* Possibility to work with a unique business concept and influence your own earning level – commissions and bonuses from both individual contributor and team results
* Thorough training in our international ME Academy and continuous training and self-development opportunities during your employment
* Build your own personal network with (inter)national top decision-makers!
* Hybrid working possibility
* Be part of the culture, where we enjoy spending time together with social events and team-building activities
* 26 days annual leave plus the opportunity to earn up to 12 additional days
* Well-being benefits such as gym and massage discounts
* See the video:
 **What’s it like to work at ME?**



  





**How is the recruitment process?** 




  




* Screening video call with recruitment
* First interview with hiring manager
* Second interview (including role-play) with team manager
* Reference check



  





 Send your CV with your application in English!

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
**About Mindler** 




 Mindler is one of the most exciting mental health start-ups on the market. Founded in 2018 by two psychologists and a doctor, Mindler is empowering the world towards better mental health by redefining the industry through creative thinking and an innovative spirit.
 



  





 Unlike many customer service teams you’ve seen, Mindler’s teams hold a crucial importance for the organization to run smoothly. Our customer team is the beating heart of our entire organization providing both our patients, psychologists and partners with first class service by improving the experience of Mindler.
 



  





 Having successfully expanded into three new markets in four years, you are in a key position to significantly influence how new patients and psychologists view our product in our newest fourth market; Denmark!
 



  





**The role:** 




 As the
 **Customer Service Representative** 
**DK** 
 you will be part of our nordic team based in Stockholm. You will mainly support our patients and psychologists with various inquiries e.g. assisting with appointments to technical support. You will often be the first point of contact, so it’s down to you to be an ambassador for Mindler.
 



  





 Our mission is to deliver first-class service and help our patients and psychologists succeed together with us at Mindler. You will be working set hours with daily tasks such as:
 



  




* Work daily in Zendesk and other channels with customer-related matters.
* Informing our Product team of feedback received from patients and psychologists
* Communicating with stakeholders such as other health care providers, GP’s, and insurance companies.
* Contact our patients in Denmark and Sweden by phone to encourage them to book an appointment or assist them with technical questions
* Assist with CS-related matters in all markets (Nordics, UK & NL) when needed.



  





*This is a part time position with 5-10 hours per week.*




  





**Who are you?** 




 Every patient that we see is different, and we therefore look for people to join Mindler who are passionate about our cause and can empathize with people; whatever their problem we're looking for individuals that live and breathe empathy, understanding and patience. People who can bring heart to their conversations and embody our values at the same time.
 



  





 Our HQ is located in Stockholm, but cultural fit is just as important as technical ability, and so we’re open to receiving applications from people based outside of Sweden if you fit the criteria.
 



  





**You need to:** 



* Thrive on delivering excellent customer service and have a background in customer support, ideally in a similar role.
* Have excellent communication skills
 **(spoken and written English, Danish and Swedish are a must).**
* Have a flexible mindset and be comfortable working in a fast-changing environment where you get the chance to influence how we work together.
* Feel comfortable primarily working with the phone as your main tool to communicate with patients.



  





**It’s a plus if you have:** 



* Start-up experience.
* Previous experience working in Zendesk or other customer service related systems.
* Other language proficiencies.



  





**What can we offer?** 




 If you enjoy collaborating with talented colleagues in a flexible work environment that balances office time with remote work, we could be a perfect match. We offer a dynamic role within a supportive culture that values work-life balance and creativity, complemented by engaging social activities. From team brainstorming sessions and after work to wellness events, our Customer Service team stays inspired and connected.
 



  





 You’ll work alongside innovative teammates in an environment that empowers you to make a meaningful impact on the rapidly growing global digital mental healthcare market. Together, we’re creating solutions that truly make a difference.
 



  





 Interviews will be held on a continuous basis. We are looking forward to hearing from you!
 



  





 --
 



*Mindler is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation or age.*

title: Configuration Specialist
description:
*Benify is an international HR tech company that provides a market-leading global benefit and total rewards platform. With over 550* 
 Benifyers in 6 countries, we're driving success with over 1500 customers and approximately three million users around the world 🌍
 *. We empower people to be the best they can be while fostering a sustainable and engaging work culture where employees feel engaged and included* 
*"Because People Matter"* 
 💙.
   

  

 Are you ready to kick-start your career with us? We’re looking for a dynamic and motivated individual to join our Configuration team. In this role, you’ll work closely with clients to configure their portals, aligning them with their unique needs and goals. Whether you have experience in a similar role or are eager to learn and grow, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 As a Configuration Specialist, you’ll play a key role in optimizing Benify’s platform to meet client needs. Your tasks will be diverse, fast-paced, and stimulating and you will collaborate in an agile and cross-functional project team, bringing together diverse perspectives and skill sets. Together, we innovate and deliver tailored solutions that create value for our Nordic clients.
   

  

 Your main responsibility will be to ensure that client portals reflect their eligibility rules, reporting requirements, and financial processes in an efficient and compliant manner. You’ll work on exciting projects such as onboarding new clients and partners, managing changes within their portals, and improving processes for existing clients and partners.
   

  

**In this position, you will:**
* Configure client portals by setting up and updating company information.
* Ensure compliance and efficiency by optimizing financial workflows and reporting processes to align with local tax regulations.
* Implement Benify features by configuring different tools in the platform.
* Drive improvements by identifying opportunities for process development, automation, and the enhancement of existing configurations.
* Collaborate and provide support by working closely with internal and external stakeholders, offering technical assistance and training.


**Who are you?**
 We are looking for someone with a basic technical understanding or a curiosity to learn more. To thrive in this position, you should enjoy working in a client-facing role, feel comfortable taking on project management responsibilities, and be eager to develop your skills in these areas. In this role, you are also expected to independently identify and improve ways of working. We highly value individuals who are open to learning, enjoy collaborating with others, and are ready to grow within our company.
   

  

**Other Requirements**
* Fluency in both Swedish and English.
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field, or equivalent relevant experience in finance, administration, or a client-facing role.


**It's a Plus If You Have**
* Basic knowledge of Excel
* Basic tax/accounting skills


**Perks** 
**of being a Benifyer**
* Generous wellness allowance or health budget 🏃‍♂️
* 30 days vacation 🌞
* Pension 📈
* Guaranteed work-life balance with a hybrid work model 🥰
* A variety of social events and activities at our offices✌️
* Workation - possibility to work abroad within EU 🌍.


*If you want to know more about what* 
 it's like to work at Benify, please check out our careers page
 *here.*
**Practical Information**
**Start:** 
 From March 2025
   

  

**Extent:** 
 Full-time, 100%
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

 Apply by sending your CV and/or your LinkedIn profile using the application form below. We screen applications continuously and may hire someone before the last application date, so make sure you apply today.
   

  

 Benify started in 2004 in Sweden with a goal to revolutionize the HR industry with a platform that would improve the lives of employees. Today, Benify is an independent, flexible, and agile global HR technology company, offering the market’s leading global benefits and total rewards platform.

title: Formas söker en förvaltningsledare med informationssäkerhetsansvar
company: Formas, a Swedish Research Council for Sustainable Development
description:
**Vill du vara med och utveckla Formas digitala förmåga? Vill du göra det i en tjänst som innehåller både teknisk rådgivning, förvaltningsledning, it-styrning och informationssäkerhet? Då är det dig vi söker!**
**Om Formas och tjänsten**
 Formas är ett forskningsråd för hållbar utveckling. Vi finansierar forskning och innovation och tar fram kunskapsunderlag som ska bidra till att uppfylla FN:s globala hållbarhetsmål och Sveriges miljömål. Vi har stort fokus på samverkan med forskare och olika samhällsaktörer, såväl i Sverige som internationellt.
   

  

 Vi behöver bli vassare på att utveckla och förvalta våra digitala tillgångar. Vi behöver dig som kan vara med och driva utvecklingen och ta ansvar för en god förvaltning av våra stödsystem. Vi är ingen traditionell it-organisation utan fungerar mer som en mindre beställarorganisation.
   

  

 Du kommer att tillhöra avdelningen för digital verksamhetsutveckling och din roll kommer att innebära både teknisk rådgivning och förvaltning. Vi behöver dig som kan fungera som tekniskt bollplank för olika projekt och initiativ och du ska kunna samordna och leda förvaltningen av våra applikationer och relaterade system. Vi har också ett behov av att förbättra vår it-styrning och vill att du ska kunna bidra med att identifiera och implementera best practices för it-styrning, anpassade för en mindre organisation.
   

  

 I rollen ingår även att fortsätta utveckla våra förmågor inom informationssäkerhetsområdet. Det kan till exempel innebära att utveckla och implementera strategier och policys för it-säkerhet inom ramen för Formas LIS eller att leda incidenthantering och kontinuerligt förbättra säkerhetsprocesser.
   

  

 Rollen innebär mycket samarbete med interna och externa parter för att säkerställa att tekniska lösningar möter organisationens behov.
   

  

 Det här är ett område som utvecklas löpande och arbetsuppgifterna kan komma att förändras efter verksamhetens utveckling och behov. Du har själv möjlighet att aktivt påverka din roll.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Minst 3-årig teknisk utbildning på högskolenivå med inriktning mot IT alternativt motsvarande kompetens.
* Minst 3 års aktuell och praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta som förvaltningsledare, produktägare, service delivery manager, verksamhetsutvecklare eller motsvarande.
* Djup förståelse för applikationsförvaltning och applikationsteknik.
* Erfarenhet av att omsätta it-säkerhetspolicys till tekniska lösningar, särskilt inom applikationer.
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med efterlevnad av säkerhetspolicys och ramverk i synnerhet med fokus på applikationsförvaltning och anskaffning.
* God förmåga att kommunicera på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


**Övrigt meriterande:**
* Certifiering eller kunskap om ITIL
* Certifiering eller kunskap och erfarenhet av PM3, SAFE eller dylikt.
* Kännedom om it-säkerhetsstandarder och ramverk (ex. ISO 27001, NIST).
* Erfarenhet och kunskap om agila metoder, exempelvis Scrum
* Erfarenhet av att leda olika digitaliserings- och utvecklingsprojekt.
* Erfarenhet från statlig myndighet och/eller forskningsfinansiär.


 Som person är du målinriktad, strukturerad och har lätt för att samarbeta. Du är kvalitetsmedveten, initiativrik och delar aktivt med dig av ny kunskap och idéer, så att verksamheten kan utvecklas. Du ser till att arbetet slutförs och följer upp resultatet. Du har en stark vilja att hålla dig uppdaterad inom ditt område och har en förmåga att löpande integrera nya lärdomar i arbetet.
   

  

 Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Att jobba på Formas**
 Formas är en statlig myndighet med cirka 110 medarbetare. Våra verksamhetsområden omfattar miljö, areella näringar och samhällsbyggande. Det innebär att vi finansierar forskning och innovation som rör klimat, cirkulär ekonomi, livsmedel, skogs- och jordbruk, hav och vatten, stadsplanering. Därutöver utvecklar vi strategier, gör analyser, sammanställer kunskapsunderlag och kommunicerar om forskning och forskningsresultat. Läs mer på: Så är det att jobba på Formas
   

  

**Om anställningen**
 Du kommer att anställas som förvaltningsledare och tillhöra Avdelningen för digital verksamhetsutveckling. Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning, inledningsvis med 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en attraktiv arbetsplats som utmärks av en strävan att vara fri från diskriminering och ge lika möjligheter till alla. Vi tror på jämlikhet, inkludering, mångfald och värderar olika erfarenheter. Därför ser vi positivt på sökanden med olika bakgrunder.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 9 februari.
   

  

 Låter detta spännande och du vill veta mer så är du välkommen att kontakta Åsa Olsson, avdelningschef Digital verksamhetsutveckling asa.olsson@formas.se eller 08-775 4050, eller HR-specialist Sofia Anderberg, sofia.anderberg@formas.se.
   

  

 Våra fackliga representanter är Emily Dock Åkerman, Saco, 08-775 40 32 och Henrik Pompeius, ST, 08-775 41 45

title: Recruiters, take your expertise beyond hiring!
description:
**Customer Success Manager to Alva Labs** 

**The clock ticks fast in a first impression.** 
 Whether it's a glance at a CV or a handshake at a networking event, people form opinions in mere moments. These snap judgments—though natural—can shape careers, companies, and lives. The stakes are even higher in hiring, where a misstep can mean the difference between discovering a perfect fit or missing out entirely.
 



 Alva’s mission is to create a fair and efficient job market for candidates and recruiters - through our library of assessment tools such as psychometrics, structured interviews and coding assessments. The Customer Success team is central to this mission. We are now looking for a recruiter who will help our customers do so as a Customer Success Manager.
 



 What do existing customers say about our
 **Customer Success** 
 team?
 



 “You always inspire us and help us get better. We think you’re a role model in CS.”
 



 Our
 **Customer Success Managers** 
 are true strategic advisors, working hand-in-hand with our customers to help them unlock the full potential of their hiring strategy. By blending recruitment expertise with a seamless hiring platform, the Customer Success team ensures that every customer achieves measurable success.
 


**The company** 

 If one should summarize what we as a company are doing, it could be something like this:
 



 Alva Labs is a Stockholm-based SaaS company that offers a solution that is helping global companies grow their team in a scientific way. Alva has created a unique candidate assessment platform that helps companies build their organizations with the right people in the right place. Combining state-of-the-art psychometrics, data science, and an obsession with candidate experience, it provides the needed tool for data-driven talent acquisition.
 



 Our main focus as of now is to launch our next big product bet that will revolutionize how the world hires talent. By broadening our product offering we will be able to better serve our customers and solve a larger part of their problem. We have also reworked out commercial focus to work with larger and more complex organizations. We believe that by serving this segment, we neutralise the impact of the economic environment and maximise our impact on how the market views talent.
 



**Candidate perspective** 




 “As a candidate, I love it when people do psychometric assessments through Alva. It’s simple and intuitive.”
 



**Customer perspective** 




 “I believe Alva Labs creates significant value in our recruitment process at our organization by combining data-driven insights with a focus on human potential. Their tools enable fair and objective assessments, helping us identify the right candidates while fostering diversity and inclusion.”
   




**The role** 

 Customer Success is the beating heart at Alva. It is the team that works closest with our customers, that has the richest insights to share with our Product team on how to solve the hiring problem, as well as the team with the most know-how on bridging the gap between science and practice. CSMs currently have a wide array of backgrounds - psychologists, recruiters, account managers, and more.
 



 As the department matures, we are building out meaningful and exciting processes that help us and our customers to work better. You will spend a chunk of your time collaborating with your Alva teammates to drive this change.
 



 If you join our team you will;
 


* Cultivate and develop relationships with our customers' decision-makers and key stakeholders – ensuring Alva is seen as a strategic recruitment partner rather than just a software vendor.
* Comfortably interact with stakeholders at all levels - profoundly understanding your customers’ objectives, challenges, and expectations (which will be easy for you as a recruiter!).
* Drive adoption and usage of Alva to unlock upsell opportunities which you will work closely with your colleagues in sales with.
* Have a diverse portfolio of customers traversing sectors, sizes and markets.


**What to expect from your first months?** 

 Research shows (did we mention we love science?) that it’s crucial to get a good start when changing jobs. During your first months with us, your main focuses will be;
 


* Receiving a full overview of how the product works and how we approach CS at Alva so you can have success in your role.
* Shadowing your colleagues' meetings and picking up customers of your own.
* Upskilling yourself while contributing to key projects both in CS and across our commercial teams.
* Getting to know the team – there'll be no shortage of social occasions!



  




**You** 

 We obviously believe in finding the right person, rather than the right CV. That said, some things would make us really happy;
 


* If you have a background in
 **Recruitment/Talent Acquisition or HR** 
 , where you have worked with stakeholder management within different seniority levels.
* Thrive in an ambitious environment. We have high expectations for our work and try to push ourselves to really make an impact on our customers.
* We are proud to represent eighteen (and counting!) nationalities at Alva and – given our ambitious expansion plans – written and verbal fluency in English is a must. For this position, Swedish is also a requirement.


**Your future colleagues** 

 We are a team of 60+ people, representing a wide selection of professional backgrounds. The common denominator is the excitement for our mission, to create a fair and efficient job market. There is a lot of engagement and eagerness to build something spectacular together with other highly talented individuals.
 



 What about the Customer Success team, you might wonder? Well, let me tell you there was never a more lovely bunch of people to call your colleagues (speaking 100% objectively of course 😉). With deep knowledge and experience, a large cup of service-mindedness, and a pinch of laughter, they are the perfect recipe for both NRR growth and customer satisfaction.
 


**Why join Alva?** 

 The problem we are solving is not just engaging and interesting (the combination of psychological science and statistics, with a large chunk of candidate experience obsession, what’s not to love?), but it is also something that has a tremendous impact on both people and businesses. You will have the opportunity to work with something that truly makes a difference.
 



 What else? We have flexible work hours in a hybrid setup, where you can decide for yourself what works best for you. You will get seven weeks of vacation, an on-market salary, a generous preventive care benefit, and a few other neat perks. You can read all about our benefits → here ← and our company values → here ←.
 


**The hiring process** 

 Given that we claim to be experts in hiring, you probably wonder what we have in store for you.
 


1. Objective screening with Alva’s tests
2. First interview (focusing on who you are)
3. Second interview with hiring manager (focusing on what you know)
4. Case exercise (focusing on how you would do the work)
5. Background & ID check (yes, we take security seriously)
6. Offer & toasts in bubbles!!



  




**Come help us change the world of hiring! Welcome to Alva!**

title: Manager for Service Management
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you a customer focused leader with strong commercial and operational expertise? Would you like to be a part of a highly skilled organization where we, among other things, contribute to great customer satisfaction by delivering Service Management services to Telia´s largest enterprise customers? Then this could be the perfect role for you.
   

  

 My name is Anna Peterson, leading the Customer Management unit within Customer Service and Delivery B2B in Sweden. We are now looking for an experienced manager to lead one of our three Service Management teams.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 As a manager for Service Management, you will be responsible for leading your team in all aspects of Service Management commitments to Telia’s enterprise customers. You will lead a team consisting of Senior- and Executive Service Managers, where you will create a work environment where your team thrives and develop their skills to meet current and future customer needs.
   

  

 In this position you will drive customer satisfaction, employee engagement and contribute to the Key Performance Indicators of the Customer Management unit. You will also optimize the resources and capabilities needed to fulfill the delivery of Service Management according to existing customer agreements.
   

  

 You will be part of the Customer Management leadership team, where you will work closely to peers who have the same responsibilities as yourself. You will also collaborate within areas of Life Cycle Solution and Change Management as well as within Customer and Operational Excellence.
   

  

 We are working closely together, and the team spirit is central, as we together solve and manage our challenges with great commitment and willingness to contribute.
   

  

**Is this you?**
 As a person, you are customer-focused with strong leadership skills who loves to drive improvement and change. You are a good communicator, well-structured and not afraid to speak up. You can break down strategy into action plans and achieve tangible results. You are a team player and are used to working with stakeholders within different parts and levels of an organization as well as representing Telia in, sometimes challenging, customer meetings.
   

  

 Your experience:
   

  

* University degree within business, engineering or equivalent.
* Minimum of 10 years relevant work experience within the IT or telecom industry.
* Extensive leadership experience documented and with good references.
* Experience in leading senior teams working with large enterprise customers.
* Experience in change management, how to build effective organizations, streamlining through synergies, create effective working methods through processes and routines.
* Fluent Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
* Certified within ITIL (merit)


**Apply to join us!**
 If you would love to join our team, don’t hesitate to apply! If you have any questions about this position, please contact our Talent Partner, Felicia Gårdare at felicia.gardare@teliacompany.com
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application and to make sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. Selection will take place on an ongoing basis. Application deadline is
 **2025-02-07.**
 Background checks are a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

**Welcome to Telia – Join us and make better happen!**

title: Customer Care Representative (Stockholm, SE)
description:
Would you want to work as customer care representative in an entrepreneurial and international environment? EasyPark is a rapidly growing tech company on a mission to make cities more liveable. In this role you will be part of the customer care team where the main goal is to offer excellent support to our customers.
   

  

 The Role
   

  

 As a Customer Care Representative, you will be part of a team of friendly colleagues in an international environment. You will be responsible for providing our Swedish customers with excellent support through high availability and flexibility. The aim of the customer care team is to keep down the customer contact ratio to a minimum, through continuous collection of information about the different topics our customers contact us about, in order to take action on it. Together with other stakeholders, such as team managers and process drivers we come up with proposals of how to eliminate the need for customers to contact us at Customer Care, which has a great financial impact for the company.
   

  

 You will contribute & make an impact through
   

  

* Building and maintaining a good relationship with EasyPark customers, primarily within the B2C segment but also B2B
* Answer incoming customer service calls and emails
* Actively work with onboarding of customers, customer loyalty and win-back
* Going the extra mile of leaving our customers with a positive feeling when they have been in contact with us on the phone, through E-mail, through social media channels or any other channel used by the company
* Supporting the collection of information about what customers are contacting us about by logging contacts according to the company policy
* Continuously work to identify ways to improve our internal processes within Customer Care and escalate to team manager and process drivers when needed
* Continuously monitor own performance to ensure alignment with the objectives set up within Customer Care


**About You**
 We are looking for you who has a genuine interest in Customer Service and enjoys working in a fast-paced team environment, while acting without prestige. A social team player with an understanding of what a great Customer Experience means and who can also work independently. You are curious and like to challenge yourself, through stepping out of your comfort zone and try out new things to develop and grow. Feedback is something you welcome with humbleness.
   

  

 Your background
   

  

 We don’t think one size fits all, but a successful candidate might have the following:
   

  

* Have previous work experience within sales and/or Customer Care
* Feel motivated by working with others towards common goals
* Written and oral fluency in Swedish and English


 This role is based at the EasyPark Stockholm office.
   

  

 Life at EasyPark
   

  

 We are a values-driven company with an international culture and a global presence. By providing an environment with space to grow and room for autonomy, we believe in encouraging and supporting our team members to take initiatives and act outside of their comfort zone. To have an open mind and embracing change is a part of our DNA. At EasyPark we are dedicated to maintaining an open culture where the voice of each person is heard, and we play as one team across the globe. Diversity is something we celebrate and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for everyone.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

* Pension, insurances & health reimbursement: A competitive pension, in combination with the basic package of insurances
* Proactive health support: your wellbeing is important to us, which is why we offer proactive medical support, all depending on your need.
* 25 days of vacation per year
* Wellness reimbursement: 5000 SEK/year
* Mental well-being support via Blue Call


 Apply for this job

title: Data Protection & Compliance Officer
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Compliance Function
 

 Trustly Group AB’s second line of defense consists of the Compliance Function, Risk Function and the Chief Information Security Officer. The position is within the Compliance team which consists of three Compliance Officers excluding the position now being hired. The Function is led by the Chief Compliance Officer which gives the function a total of five FTE’s.
 








**About
 **the role
 

 We are looking for a Data Protection Officer / Compliance Officer to join our Compliance team in Trustly Group AB. As a DPO / CO you will report to Trustly’s Chief Compliance Officer and be based in the Stockholm office. Your day-to-day work will include normal DPO and compliance tasks such as advice and support, performing controls, hold training etc as well as a wide area of other tasks in order to ensure the function is executing the annual plan, addressing ad hoc issues etc in the most efficient manner. You will be part of a team of five covering Trustly’s Swedish operations. Trustly’s company language is English.
 





  




**What you’ll do:** 
* Execute on the DPO annual plan which includes e.g. control activities, risk assessment and trainingDrafting of reports, e.g. to the board of directors
* Act as the primary contact with the Swedish Authority for Privacy Protection (Sw:Integritetsskyddsmyndigheten) or another competent authority supervising Trustly, ensuring all communication, reports and responses to regulatory requests are accurate, completed and submitted on time
* Assist in developing and implementing compliance management framework including drafting and revising internal governing documents (policies etc)
* Advice and support internal stakeholders on DPO / compliance related matters
* Stay abreast of changes in legislation, guidelines, and industry best practices related to GDPR and make suggestions with respect to related compliance policy and procedure enhancements



  




**Who you are:** 
* You have an academic degree, preferably in law, with relevant working experience from a regulatory/supervisory financial environment or from a consultancy firm working with Data Protection, compliance or risk related issues towards the financial industry
* Experience in risk management and performing controls is an advantage
* Previous working experience regarding PSD2 or AML/CFT is an advantage
* A team player with high communication skills and the ability to deal with diverse teams of both internal and external stakeholders in a proactive manner
* Can-do attitude and take ownership of given and proactively identified tasks
* Fluent in English and Swedish



  




**What’s In It For You?** 
* **Shape Your Role and Make an Impact** 
 : A role where you can take ownership, drive change, and continuously take on exciting new challenges
* **Fantastic** 
**Benefits** 
 :
* **30 days of holiday** 
 for a healthy work-life balance
* **Monthly team outing allowance** 
 to enjoy social events with your colleagues
* **Parental leave top-up** 
 , supporting you during family milestones
* **Daily breakfast** 
 and other on-site perks to make your day that much easier
* Plus many more benefits designed to support your well-being!






  




  














  






 Kindly submit your CV in English.
 









 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.******

title: Tech Lead | Stockholm | Experis
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Technology, Information and Internet
description: Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och leda utvecklingen av framtidens teknik? Vi söker nu flera erfarna Tech Leads för att stärka kunders IT-organisation i en tid av tillväxt och innovation. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Support Agent Hourly
description:
We have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team of Operation Support Agents.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 FedEx is the largest express transportation company in the world, connecting more than 220 countries and territories. We work every moment to deliver the most important package of someone’s day. Our team of passionate people know their day-to-day work is invaluable in delivering outstanding experience to our customers. 530,000 team members strong, we are as diverse as the world we serve. We love what we do, and we do it well. Our reach is big, and so are our dreams. Join us and let's write our next chapter together.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Ensuring that customers' urgent packages get to the right place, on time
* Answering incoming calls from customers in relation to shipment collection requests and delivery inquiries
* Checking and investigating failed shipments deliveries or collections when needed; prioritising and reallocating any failed deliveries for the next day delivery
* Entering data into our in-house tracking system
* Running clear and effective communication and collaboration with the team, your manager, and other operations stations
* Adhering to FedEx processes, procedures and controls, and regulatory requirements


**What Do You Bring With You**
* Good communication and social skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with strict timelines
* Ability to manage own time effectively with attention to detail


**What Do We Offer**
* Attractive compensation package
* Training to get you started and on-the-job learning opportunities
* Extensive learning resources to further develop your skills and knowledge
* Tuition Assistance Program (\*applicable for FedEx positions with a permanent contract)
* Employee Assistance Program for you and your family in difficult life situations
* Employee reduced-rate shipping
* Great career opportunities
* FedEx is one of the worlds most admired companies and trusted brands year after year


 Bring your ideas, individuality, and dreams to our global community. Feel good about where you work. Choose your career path - we’re ready to invest in your development. Join FedEx.
   

  

 FedEx was built on a philosophy that puts people first, one we take seriously. We are an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce in which we provide growth opportunities for all
   

  

 Our Company
   

  

 FedEx is one of the world's largest express transportation companies and has consistently been selected as one of the top 10 World’s Most Admired Companies by "Fortune" magazine. Every day FedEx delivers for its customers with transportation and business solutions, serving more than 220 countries and territories around the globe. We can serve this global network due to our outstanding team of FedEx team members, who are tasked with making every FedEx experience outstanding.
   

  

 Our Philosophy
   

  

 The People-Service-Profit philosophy (P-S-P) describes the principles that govern every FedEx decision, policy or activity. FedEx takes care of our people; they, in turn, deliver the impeccable service demanded by our customers, who reward us with the profitability necessary to secure our future. The essential element in making the People-Service-Profit philosophy such a positive force for the company is where we close the circle, and return these profits back into the business, and invest back in our people. Our success in the industry is attributed to our people. Through our P-S-P philosophy, we have a work environment that encourages team members to be innovative in delivering the highest possible quality of service to our customers. We care for their well-being, and value their contributions to the company.
   

  

 Our Culture
   

  

 Our culture is important for many reasons, and we intentionally bring it to life through our behaviors, actions and activities in every part of the world. The FedEx culture and values have been a cornerstone of our success and growth since we began in the early 1970’s. While other companies can copy our systems, infrastructure and processes, our culture makes us unique and is often a differentiating factor as we compete and grow in today’s global marketplace.

title: Systems Integrations Engineering Manager
description:
**The role of a Systems Integrations Engineering Manager, Commercial Systems at Canonical**
 This engineering management role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and Ubuntu to build a career with Canonical and drive the success of the business. If you have an affinity for open source development, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 The Commercial Systems unit has several areas of responsibility spread across six engineering teams, closely collaborating with other engineering and business teams at Canonical. Services designed, developed, and operated by the Commercial Systems unit are at the heart of Canonical business and Salesforce plays an integral role in it.
   

  

 The Integrations team aspires to integrate all business systems used at Canonical to ensure data reliably flows at the right time to the right place, and to automate business processes across the company. The systems include popular SaaS solutions such as Salesforce, NetSuite, Greenhouse, GSuite, and a few dozen others. To achieve this goal, we leverage Python and Go in combination with open source tools such as Airbyte and Temporal. Our work helps to make data-driven decisions, and increases the efficiency of business operations.
   

  

 We are looking for an engineering manager with prior software engineering experience, who strives for the highest engineering quality, seeks improvements, continuously develops their skills, and applies them at work. This is an exciting opportunity to work with many popular software systems, integrations technologies, and exciting open source solutions.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

**What your day will look like**
* Lead, mentor, and hire a team of software engineers
* Design and deliver engineering solutions leveraging Go, Python, and open source tools such as Airbyte and Temporal
* Seek improvements to established processes, designs, and engineering solutions
* Partner with business customers to understand their data and integrations needs


**What we are looking for in you**
* Experience as a software developer in Python
* Excellent understanding of integration patterns
* Experience as a hands-on engineering manager or a team lead
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* Ability to collaborate remotely with a diverse set of team members and stakeholders, remain highly motivated, productive, and organized in a fully remote environment
* Ability to travel to international destinations for one week at a time, approximately 2-4 times per year. Locations prior to the global pandemic included New York, Seattle, London, Cape Town, Budapest, Berlin, Montreal, and Brussels


**Additional skills that you might also bring**
* Experience as a software developer in a high-level language - preferably Go
* Experience in a business role such as sales, finance, or operations
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science or a related engineering field
