**What we offer you**
 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Full Stack Developer & Startup Founder (March 2025)
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**Note: This Opportunity Does Not Offer Employment, but rather an opportunity to build your own VC-backed startup!** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly accomplished full-stack software developer with a demonstrated ability to deliver innovative solutions. Your exceptional programming skills and experience in building complex applications position you to tackle significant challenges within the tech industry. You possess a strong problem-solving aptitude and a passion for pioneering cutting-edge technologies. Driven to make a real impact, you're eager to leverage your expertise in building disruptive tech ventures.
 



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is the world's most active venture capital firm, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 27 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**For our March 2025 cohort, we’re looking for someone who:** 



* Having the autonomy to develop sophisticated software solutions to address real-world challenges, merging ingenuity with functionality.
* Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, capable of breaking down complex issues and bringing structure into business cases
* Providing leadership, whether it’s directing a development team or managing comprehensive product delivery.
* You have an idea that you believe can solve a problem you are deeply interested in. You understand that you need co-pilots who share your vision and values.



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Antler Success Stories** 




 Several companies built through the Antler program have received pre-seed investment and have gone on to secure significant funding rounds. Here are just a few examples:
 


* **Wingbits:** 
 A community-driven flight data tracking platform
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating the identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

title: Category Purchaser
description:
**YOUR MISSION AT VOI** 




 As
 **Category Purchaser** 
 you will have the full ownership for sourcing and renegotiations projects of indirect procurements across all markets. In this role you will be accountable for the process end-to-end, driving spend analysis and cost benchmark studies, managing supplier relationships and evaluation, and building negotiation strategies and execution to achieve optimal solutions and minimise total cost of ownership. This will include:
 



  




* Continuously driving cost optimisation and improvement programs in close collaboration with stakeholders across the organisation
* Managing spend analysis and benchmarking to find opportunities to optimise categories and cost
* Driving sourcing projects across all indirect categories, continuously scouting the market for new potential suppliers and opportunities for cost reductions
* Building negotiation strategies and managing negotiations with new and existing suppliers, including the contracting process and administration of renewals
* Maintaining and developing supplier relationship management, continuously evaluating performance and working strategically with key suppliers to ensure successful long-term partnership
* Working proactively to identify supply risks and applying relevant strategies to mitigate them
* Collaborating closely with stakeholders across the organisation as a subject matter expert in the procurement field, assisting with sustainability and supplier code of conduct activities and work continuously to drive the organisation towards best in class cost and performance



  





**WHAT YOU NEED TO EMBARK** 




 We are looking for an energetic and analytical team player, with a strong sense of ownership and the ability to manage multiple projects and stakeholders simultaneously. In addition to being professionally fluent in English, we believe the right person has:
 



  




* Bachelor degree in Engineering, Business, Economics, or similar
* +2 years experience from purchasing or procurement functions
* Experience from managing procurement and purchasing projects end-to-end with short deadlines
* Experience from sourcing for new products and services
* Experience from managing multiple project and stakeholders simultaneously
* Experience from successful negotiations and building strong long-term relationships
* Good knowledge of Excel/Google Sheets
* Professional fluency in English, additional languages is a merit
* Knowledge of IT tools, e.g. Steep or Tableau, is a merit



  





**WHY VOI?** 




 Working at Voi is more than just a job; Our People Promise includes a personal voyage where you will grow as a professional and be a part of a team and culture that builds something meaningful for society. In addition to this you’ll have the opportunity to:
 


* Join Europe’s #1 micromobility company and one of the fastest growing scaleups
* Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program and have a direct impact on cost reductions for the whole company
* Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution



  





**Are you ready to become a Voiager?** 




  





*Since 2018,* 
***Voi***
*has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.* 




  





***Diversity Matters***




*As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.*

title: Cyber Security Architect – Manufacturing & Product
description:
Autoliv's primary goal is to Save More Lives. Our products never get a second chance. This is why we can never compromise on quality. We are working to increase vehicle safety by developing seatbelts, airbags and steering wheels and you can be part of our team as
 **Cyber Security Architect – Manufacturing & Product.**
 Cyber Security must be anchored in Business strategy and objectives. Requires curiosity and ability to grasp what drives the business, to be able to express Cyber Security requirements in a format that is relevant to business stakeholders.
   

  

 It is key to understand the Manufacturing environment, and how that differs from traditional office IT solutions. It is crucial to be able to connect with key stakeholders, such as industrial- and automation engineers, machine builders, and others building and supporting the Operational Technology, Industrial Control Systems, etc.
   

  

**As a Cyber Security Architect – Manufacturing & Product, you will:**
* Establish and improve security architecture concepts and design.
* Support projects with Cyber Security Architecture perspectives, requirements, solutions.
* Reviews of current and future solutions from a Cyber Security perspective.
* Primarily support within Manufacturing- and Product related projects and solutions.
* Contribute to an adequate Cyber Security posture by publishing steering documents and offer guidance to those documents in business projects.


**To Excel In This Role, You Should Have**
****Functional Competencies****
* Communicative in (at least) English, as collaboration with key stakeholders at all levels of the organization is key.


**Personal Characteristics Enabling Success**
* Ability to dive into the details, without losing track of the goal on the horizon, assuring efforts are staying on course.
* Ability to take the audience into account, communicating in their terms, translating complex cyber security topics into something relatable, tangible to them.


**Education**
* Bachelor's in cyber security, Computer Science, or something similar, engineering related.
* Advanced certifications like CISSP, CISM is a differentiator.


**Previous Experience**
* Background in Cyber Security is mandatory.
* Experience from working with Operational Technology (OT), or directly working with those who do, is necessary.
* Experience with standards, such as, ISO21434, IEC62443, NIST CSF and similar is an advantage.
* Informal leadership positions are highly relevant, such as an architecture role.
* Previous experience from product engineering projects and/or working in global companies are considered an advantage.


**Languages**
* English


**Other**
* As an architect, you are not only changing technology, but the environment it operates in, including people and processes. Past history of achieving change in organizations, behavior, people and processes, is a knock-out factor in the selection process.
* Must be able to travel globally for workshops and Gemba walk.


****We will be more than glad to chat with you about your experience and your career goals****
 In our international work setting, you will find a range of opportunities that are designed to enhance your career and personal development. Including new and different perspectives is part of what ensures the team’s success. We are committed to develop people’s skills, knowledge and creative potential. Our training and development programs emphasize technical competency, leadership development and business management skill.
   

  

**Mo** 
**re lives saved – more life lived!**

title: Manager, Business Development-R-237185
company_industry: Financial Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
**Title And Summary**
 Manager, Business Development
   

  

**About The Role**
 Are you passionate about driving growth and building strong partnerships? Join us as a Manager of Business Development for Merchants & Corporates in Northern Europe, where you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of commerce. Your mission: grow Mastercard’s market presence, deepen customer relationships, and deliver innovative payment solutions that enhance the way people pay and get paid.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

**As a Business Development Manager, You’ll**
* Shape Strategy: Develop and execute sales strategies to increase Mastercard’s market share and acceptance across Northern Europe.
* Build Relationships: Manage and nurture relationships with key merchant partners, identifying their needs and delivering tailored solutions.
* Drive Growth: Identify new business opportunities, propose solutions, and close deals that meet customer and market requirements.
* Collaborate: Work with internal teams and external partners to create and execute impactful sales plans, ensuring mutual success.
* Innovate: Bring fresh ideas to the table and champion new products that meet market demands.


 What We’re Looking For
   

  

**We’re Seeking Someone Who**
* Has extensive experience managing sales strategies for complex accounts or industry verticals.
* Can turn technical concepts into clear, compelling sales messages.
* Understands merchant ecosystems and drivers, especially in sectors like retail, travel, and entertainment.
* Thrives on building long-lasting relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.
* Is collaborative, with a proven track record of working effectively with diverse teams and partners.
* Excels in communication, negotiation, and relationship-building at all levels.
* Works well under pressure and meets tight deadlines with grace.


 Why Join Us?
   

  

* Impact: Be at the forefront of transforming how businesses and consumers interact.
* Innovation: Work with cutting-edge products and technologies that are shaping the future of payments.
* Collaboration: Join a team of driven, passionate professionals who thrive on partnership and innovation.
* Growth: Advance your career in a dynamic, inclusive environment that values your expertise and ambition.


 At Mastercard, we embrace diversity, celebrate inclusion, and are committed to providing equal opportunities to all applicants. We encourage individuals of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives to apply.
   

  

 Ready to Shape the Future?
   

  

 Apply now to join our team and make your mark in the ever-evolving world of payments!
   

  

**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

description:

title: DSP Partnerships KAM
description:
****Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture.** 
**Come join us—and let the world feel your work.****
**We are looking for a DSP Key Account Manager to work in the Music department, reporting into the Head of Commercial Music Partnerships. This is a full-time position located at our headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden.**
**Job Summary:**
 The DSP Key Account Manager is responsible for driving sales and growth for our catalog by meeting target KPIs on assigned accounts. The successful candidate will manage both strategy and relationships with DSPs, ensuring operational excellence within the team. This full-time position is located at our headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Cultivate and manage relationships with DSP partners, ensuring that our catalog receives the attention it deserves through playlisting opportunities
* Pitch releases effectively through both direct interactions and platform tools like Spotify for Artists, maximizing revenue and visibility
* Provide release descriptions for selected tags/artists based on templates or artist quotes
* Actively seek out and establish new relationships with DSPs globally, expanding our reach and driving growth
* Timely report performance metrics for assigned accounts
* Leverage data insights to improve streams, visibility, and revenue of the catalog on DSPs
* Maintain a comprehensive understanding of the streaming landscape and communicate information internally
* Contribute to team OKRs to achieve initiatives, processes, and programs
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices
* Work as an internal liaison between relevant stakeholders in order to ensure we deliver according to deal terms and meet set goals
* Support improvement of partnership productivity focused on implementation and reporting standardization


**Requirements:**
* In-depth knowledge of the music industry
* 5+ years industry experience, including 2+ years in a similar position
* Proven track record of increasing revenue through key account management
* Comprehensive understanding of a broad range of musical genres
* In-depth knowledge of leading digital music platforms
* Solid grasp of sales strategy and its application in enhancing DSP performance
* Strong analytical thinking skills, with a proven ability to work with complex analytical tasks to maximize results
* Detail-oriented approach, ensuring information accuracy and completeness


**Preferred Qualifications/ Bonus Skills:**
* Strong organizational, administrative, and structured skills
* High initiative skills, proactively identifying opportunities and issues, and taking action to capitalize or resolve them
* Highly skilled in prioritizing and managing multiple tasks simultaneously


**Equal Opportunity Employer:**
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application**
 Do you want to be a part of our fantastic team? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Global Strategic Sourcing Director
description:
**Company Description**
***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***
 At Sobi, the work we do every day redefines the standards of care and transform the lives of people living with rare diseases.
   

  

 As a diverse team of entrepreneurial people, we are passionate about our growth journey towards becoming a global leader, making a difference for rare disease patients, moving quickly and always challenging the status quo.
   

  

 We are committed to an inclusive, sustainable and flexible workplace that fosters growth and development.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As the
 **Global Strategic Sourcing Director** 
 , you will collaboratively drive Sobi’s global sourcing strategies to ensure efficient, high-quality, and cost-effective procurement across the organization. This is a critical role that requires strategic leadership, stakeholder collaboration, and the ability to adapt to a dynamic and competitive industry landscape.
   

  

 The role reports to the Senior Director, Head of Strategic Sourcing & Direct Procurement and there are currently no direct reports to the role. As the team is nimble, trust and transparency are key words
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and implement comprehensive global sourcing strategy that align with Sobi’s business goals and support key initiatives.
* Cultivate strong relationships with key global suppliers to strategically secure capacity and align on future growth together.
* Partner with internal teams, including supply chain, R&D, finance, quality and regulatory, to integrate sourcing strategies seamlessly into Sobi’s operations.
* Identify opportunities for cost efficiencies while adhering to high-quality standards and compliance requirements.
* Stay ahead of market trends, supplier capabilities, and economic changes to anticipate and manage challenges effectively.
* Drive initiatives that foster innovation in procurement practices and align with Sobi’s commitment to sustainable and ethical sourcing.


**Qualifications**
**How to apply**
 At Sobi, we value work-life balance and due to the holidays, it may take a little bit longer until you hear back from us.
   

  

 We have an ongoing selection process in this recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible. Click apply and include your resume in English.
   

  

**About You**
 We are looking for a strategic thinker who brings creativity and innovation to sourcing strategies and thrives in leading transformational change. You should be self-aware, leveraging both strengths and areas for growth to inspire trust and effective leadership. Excellence in managing complex negotiations, a focus on efficiency and optimized processes, and a willingness to be hands-on when needed are essential traits.
   

  

**Key Qualifications**
* Minimum 7 years of experience in a sourcing/procurement role, preferably within the pharmaceutical/biotech industry working with contract manufacturing services or other relevant experience
* Proven track record in leading global procurement initiatives and managing complex supplier relationships.
* Strong analytical, negotiation, and leadership skills; exceptional project management and strategic thinking abilities.
* University degree in Pharmaceuticals, Engineering, Biochemistry or other relevant degree.


 Here at Sobi we live by our core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership!
   

  

**Additional Information**
**Why Join Us?**
 Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team
   

  

* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Competitive compensation for your work
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


 We are a global company with over 1,800 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
   

  

**Sobi Culture**
 At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.
   

  

 As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

title: Vice President, People and Organization Development
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**
 We're on the hunt for an experienced Vice President, People and Organization Development. A successful candidate will be responsible for developing, leading and supporting a wide range of HR areas, including Talent Management, Learning & Development, Talent Acquisition and Employer Branding. The position is strategically important with the aim to strengthen the people pipeline on a global level to drive successful business results on a short- and long-term basis.
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 We are looking for a People Partner Lead for our People Organization, responsible for driving people initiatives and providing expertise in change management.
   

  

 The Vice President, People and Organization Development responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
   

  

* Support and enable members of the P&OD team to deliver on P&OD strategy.
* Further develop and support the Global Talent Acquisition Manager with expertise and best practice when the team are expanding globally.
* Partner with People Org. and senior management to define and deliver employee retention strategies,e.g. position competency models, onboarding processes, employee engagement, career paths, and performance management.
* Execute and deliver on Elekta’s standardized L&D offer globally and hire a L&D Partner
* Create and execute global trainings and/or workshops for managers focusing on Culture, e.g.,
* DE&I, supporting professional TA and TM practices
* More effective development actions and initiatives connected to high potentials (in collaboration with P&OD colleagues)
* Create, structure and coordinate global Employer Branding activities in order to establish data-led talent engagement
* Ensuring our global HR processes are implemented in accordance with Elekta’s policies, practices, and objectives for the People Org.
* Developing change management plans for projects and/or change initiatives
* Identifying and managing anticipated resistance to change.
* Leading change management work streams with a structured methodology / process.


**The right stuff**
* Excellent consultation and coaching skills, able to influence at senior level.
* Transformational leadership style. Energetic and motivated to drive change and high performance.
* Ability to work flexibly and adapt to changing priorities and demands.
* Mature business acumen and previous experience from business management.


**What You’ll Bring**
* University Degree in Human Resources or equivalent.
* Extensive generalist HR experience gained in dynamic, matrix and change orientated business environments.
* International experience from the HR/Leadership/Talent/Development, Succession and Organizational area and with a special passion for people & organizational development.
* Preferably a background from working in a global context building a strong people pipeline and at the same time addressing cultural diversity issues.
* Possesses a genuine understanding of leadership development and what forms a winning culture and hence a competitive company with strong business results.
* Good understanding of change management principles, techniques & tools.
* Project management and planning skills.
* Ability to manage a busy workload and meet expectations on delivery.
* Effective, clear and concise communication skills both written and spoken English.
* Budget planning and management – Able to develop & manage HR budget.
* Good IT skills, MS Office, HR database / systems management tools.


**What You’ll Get**
 In this role, you will work for a higher purpose; hope for everyone dealing with cancer, and for everyone regardless of where in the world, to have access to the best cancer care.  In addition to this, Elekta offers a range of benefits.
   

  

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays)
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme
* Private Medical Insurance
* Lunch Benefit
* Contribution to wellness activities
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days a week)


**Hiring process**
 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and résumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

**Your Elekta contact**
 For questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner responsible Joanna Kozyra on Joanna.kozyra@elekta.com
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**
 We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

title: Multi-Site Store Leader
job_function: Sales, General Business, and Customer Service
description:
Established in Somerset in 1971, Mulberry has grown to be the largest maker of luxury leather goods in the United Kingdom. With a contemporary take on British heritage and a focus on responsible craft, our ambition is to create progressive luxury.
 



  





 Sustainability has been part of the Mulberry ethos since the brand's inception, in recognition of our purpose-driven approach, in 2024 we proudly achieved B Corp Certification.
 



  





 Today, we are a global brand, but our values remain the same; we are committed to improving our impact on people and the planet. If these are values you share, we would love you to join our team.
 



  





 The Role:
 



  





 As a Multi-Site Store Leader, you will partner with your team to deliver growth, maximise sales and create a stimulating, inspiring and inclusive working environment through supporting, coaching, and developing your team. Your ultimate goal is to ensure truly memorable client and employee experiences for your store and region. Creating an enjoyable and engaged team culture will be at the heart of your success.
 



  





 Based in store, you will epitomise Mulberry by living the values and delivering the highest standards. You are able to spot and react to commercial opportunities for your store and within in your region. You will drive projects, building strong relationships with central functions to help influence and drive the success and the future growth of the business.
 



  





 Experience Focused:
 



  





 · Ensure customer first approach to everything you and your team do, embodying the ‘Mulberry Mindset’.
 



 · Lead the delivery of ‘Mulberry Mindset’ to an exceptional level across your Management and Experience Expert team, using effective leadership and coaching tools to develop your teams.
 



 · Lead and inspire your store team to always deliver an exceptional customer experience driving customer satisfaction and brand loyalty.
 



 · Be an ambassador of the Mulberry Brand always showcasing your passion and knowledge.
 



 · Foster a positive in store experience by ensuring all stores are treating all customers and staff in a fair and consistent manner.
 



 · Develop a strong up to date knowledge of local area, industry news and current affairs to support business decisions.
 



 · Responsible for ensuring all team members engage, develop and maintain relationships in a personalised way with all customers using a variety of clienteling tools.
 



 · Using the clienteling tools provided monitor and evaluate your regions performance, collaborating with your management team to identify opportunities for growth.
 



 · Maintain a good awareness of VIP and core customer base in your stores, partnering with your management team to ensure these relationships are nurtured and developed; always striving to find new and innovative ways to create connections.
 



 · Ensure customer data capture targets are met across the region.
 



  





 Develop the Best:
 



  





 · Motivate, develop and empower your Managers through coaching and training during regular store visits and meetings.
 



 · Hire, retain and develop a high performing team using recruitment and training materials available to you, developing succession plans for future growth.
 



 · Ensure new team members at all levels are inducted into the business adequately.
 



 · Work with your management team to lead, reward and recognise key contributions and achievements of your team.
 



 · Responsible for ensuring effective long-term workforce planning that is aligned to budget and communicated in advance to the team.
 



 · Work with your management team to promote the engagement and completion of all training materials ensuring training compliance expectations are met and knowledge is embedded and shared.
 



 · Nurture a culture that embraces feedback; give praise, share successes, coach and challenge.
 



 · Lead and support your management team to ensure they are managed fairly and consistently, ensuring the use of relevant HR policies and procedure i.e. year-end reviews, discipline, grievance etc.
 



  





 Future focused
 



  





 · Attend and take an active role in meetings; contribute ideas to brand strategy.
 



 · Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of brand events, new products and services.
 



 · Seek and identify opportunities to expand your knowledge, skills and experience though internal and external development opportunities.
 



 · Be open and willing to take on additional responsibilities to support your line Manager and the wider business to drive development.
 



 · Be an expert within your field and a key contributor to the success of Mulberry.
 



  





 Communicate and build relationships
 



  





 · Build an open and inclusive environment which fosters collaboration and teamwork.
 



 · Liaise with internal and external parties as necessary – i.e. Marketing, HR, Recruitment, Retail Operations, Local Associations.
 



 · Use appropriate communication tools to effectively deliver messages, whilst adapting your style and approach to your audience.
 



 · Actively listen and seek to understand and resolve issues, supporting and guiding your management team as needed.
 



 · Work with your Store Leaders to ensure effective prioritisation of all key store activities to ensure they are planned and communicated in advance for their successful delivery.
 



 · Build effective relationships and partner with Host Store/Centre Management to the advantage of Mulberry and the partner store/centre.
 



 Drive Results
 



  





 · Lead the store management teams to take ownership over their business in order to identify and present commercial opportunities to relevant stakeholders.
 



 · Accountable for managing your store budgets; tracking your staffing costs and other overheads which may affect the profitable performance of your store. Whilst supporting your Management with theirs.
 



 · Partner with the management team to plan, forecast, report on sales and business performance and other business KPIs to maximise performance.
 



 · Work with your management team to ensure accurate reporting on all merchandise/stock; for stocktake auditing; identify issues and resolve stock loss issues; adopt best practice procedures with store team to reduce and avoid loss.
 



 · Ensure company VM guidelines are followed and take pride in how product and fixtures are stored and maintained. Ensure the same high standards are implemented across your store and region.
 



 · Accountable for ensuring the accurate completion of checks across the store to ensure the store is a safe environment, reporting any concerns to head office in line with company policy.
 



 · Project Manage any new store openings or store closures when required.
 



 · Use your initiative to make decisions, find solutions and react positively to change.
 



  





 Culture:
 



  





 − Understand and demonstrate the Mulberry employee values and behaviours: Be Bold, Be Imaginative, Be Open, Be Responsible.
 



 − Support Mulberry to deliver an inclusive culture, through behaving in a way that is open-minded and respectful towards others, and understanding that your views, opinions, and experiences may not always be shared by your colleagues.
 



 − Act as an ambassador for Mulberry and communicate positively about the brand.
 



  





 Sustainability:
 



  





 − As a certified B Corp business, it is important to incorporate environmentally responsible practices into your work wherever possible. Support the businesses ‘Five C’s’ strategy in addressing and improving Climate, Cultivation, Craft, Culture and Circularity. Promote a greener, more sustainable future.
 



 − Support to foster an environment where diversity is embraced and all individuals feel valued, respected and included. Promote equity, empathy and understanding and demonstrate this commitment within your internal and external communities.
 



  





 We will need you to be:
 



  





 - Inspiring
 



 - Engaging
 



 - Agile
 



 - Perceptive
 



 - An experienced Leader (preferably within luxury fashion but not essential)
 



 - In love with fashion!
 



  





 What we can do for you:
 



  





 - Competitive basic salary
 



 - Bonus
 



 - Product allowance
 



 - An enviable staff discount and exclusive access to staff sales
 



 - Extra day off for your birthday
 



 - Pension Contributions & Life Assurance
 



 - Training and development opportunities - including full access to LinkedIn Learning
 



 - x2 paid volunteering days per year
 



 - Access to Help@Hand - a wellbeing service featuring remote GP appointments, mental health support, physiotherapy, personal training & retail discounts
 



  





 Mulberry is an equal opportunities employer and we are passionate about hiring and developing the best talent. All hiring decisions are made only on the basis of qualifications, skills or experience and as they relate to the particular role. If you need us to make any adjustments to our application or interview processes to enable you to be at your best, please email us at talent@mulberry.com.

title: Publishing Director
description:
Embark is hiring a Publishing Director to join THE FINALS, our critically-acclaimed innovative online shooter. As a key stakeholder for how we present the game and speak to our audience, you have excellent instincts about what resonates with core gamers and what doesn't. You have the experience in publishing to build our first plan to be as accurate as possible, the awareness and analytical skills to know when things can be improved, and the creativity to come up with fresh ideas for our second, third, and future plans.
   

  

 You will lead a publishing team comprising not only marketing, community management, customer support, release management, QA, and localization, but also product management and other live ops disciplines. To do this, you must know the principles that drive player-facing decision-making, and how we maximize our returns on both effort and spend. You have a deep understanding of the various video game publishing disciplines, but are especially versed in marketing and community-building. Knowing the gaming landscape today is dramatically different from what it was just a few years ago, you have built your toolbox for the sophisticated audience playing games now, not for those of the past.
   

  

 The role reports to the Marketing Director and is embedded in the THE FINALS leads team.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Lead a diverse publishing team comprising not only marketing, community management, customer support, release management, QA, and localization, but also product management and other live ops disciplines
* Sync up publishing beats and development beats, and manage the two-way feedback loop to make optional choices
* Propose creative solutions to development, tech, and commercial teams they wouldn’t have the market context to come up with themselves
* Build strategic relationships with external partners key to our efforts to reach our audience
* Constantly reevaluate the best places to invest our publishing budget, by advocating for and scrutinizing KPIs
* Keep your finger on the pulse of core gamer audience expectations; be able to describe the publishing strategy for competitor titles, hypothesize about their reasoning, and evaluate their success or failure


**We would love if you have**
* 8 years in the game industry, including 5+ in PC/console publishing
* Owned the P&L for a game before, bonus points if free-to-play
* In-depth knowledge of how PC and console distribution platforms work and how to maximize the exposure of our product on them
* A background in ground-level execution of community management, influencer management, product management, or another aspect of player-facing publishing
* Excellent communication skills that allow you to explain complex ideas and motivate teams through mutual understanding
* A proactive, humble, and conscientious attitude, with a high sense of ownership and autonomy
* A lifetime of experience playing videogames!


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!
   

  

*If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "* 
*Open Application.* 
*"*

title: Fastighetstekniker - Muskö
description:
**Fortifikationsverket söker en fastighetstekniker till driftdistriktet Muskö där vi arbetar med tillsyn och skötsel i våra fastigheter i södra Stockholm. Vill du vara en del av vår tillväxt är du välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Vi är en av Sveriges största fastighetsägare och experter inom fortifikation, det vill säga skydds- och anläggningsteknik. Vårt huvuduppdrag är att bidra till ökad försvarsförmåga för ett tryggt och fritt Sverige.
   

  

****Din vardag – arbete med drift, tillsyn & skötsel****
 Region östs verksamhet utförs i Stockholm och Gotlands län och denna tjänst finns i driftdistriktet Muskö och har ett geografiskt område som täcker Muskö. Idag är det 15 drift och fastighetstekniker som har arbetsplats i distriktet. Uppdraget är att säkerställa driften av anläggningen i alla olika situationer och det huvudsakliga arbetet sker dagtid med focus på tillsyn & skötsel och avhjälpande underhåll samt att utföra egenkontroller. Det finns också en jourgrupp på sex personer inom driftteamet som har många års erfarenhet.
   

  

 Flera av våra tekniker har gått vidare i sin utveckling på Fortifikationsverket och vi söker nu en fastighetstekniker. Då vi arbetar med robust hållbarhet behöver vi en fastighetstekniker som är väldigt allround och van att arbeta brett och lösa de uppgifter som dyker upp i rollen som fastighetstekniker. Då våra uppgifter varierar väldigt så behöver du vara en lagspelare som ena dagen jobbar med våra kunder för att i nästa stund arbeta i ett projekt och hantera el- samt vvs underhåll. Du kommer arbeta självständigt och vi söker medarbetar som vill utvecklas i rollen och med oss i gruppen. Vi arbetar i en utvecklande miljö där det finns goda möjligheter till utveckling i interna och externa utbildningar.
   

  

 Du kommer att självständigt och med stöd av hela teamet att arbeta med Beredskapstjänstgöring som kan komma att ingå i tjänsten
 **.** 
 Resor inom distriktet ingår i tjänsten.
   

  

****Kvalifikationer****
 Vi söker dig som har fullgjord gymnasieutbildning och att du har mångårig erfarenhet av att arbetat som fastighetstekniker, drifttekniker eller servicetekniker.
   

  

 Du har goda kunskaper i administrativa IT-stödsystem och du kommunicerar och uttrycker dig väl både muntligt och skriftligt på svenska. Körkort lägst klass B är ett krav. Du är svensk medborgare.
   

  

 Det är meriterande med erfarenhet av att arbetat med fastighetssystemet faciliate. Har du arbetat med förbättringsarbete och har erfarenhet av något av områdena automation, nätverk, PLC, ventilation, vvs eller storkök är även det meriterande. Det är även till din fördel om du har arbetat med fortifikatoriska anläggningar.
   

  

 Har du truckkort och behörighet för motorsåg är det meriterande.
   

  

 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet. Du har lätt för att sätta sig in i andras situation och du är en god lyssnare och du har lätt för att skapa nya relationer.. Då förstår vikten av att samarbeta och hittar lösningar genom att vara prestigelös. Du slutför det som påbörjats och håller deadlines. Du ser utanför boxen och finner nya lösningar på gamla problem. I rollen behöver du våga att agera samtidigt som du är en lagspelare. Du gillar att utvecklas tillsammans med övriga i gruppen.
   

  

****Vad erbjuder vi dig?****
 Tillsammans med ca 1100 kollegor på Fortifikationsverket runt om i landet jobbar du med ett unikt fastighetsbestånd för att stärka totalförsvaret i Sverige. Vi är stolta över det samhällsviktiga uppdrag vi har där vi bygger, förvaltar, driftar och utvecklar avancerad teknologi i samhällsviktiga byggnader. Våra arbetsuppgifter är omväxlande, spännande och utmanande och kräver sin kompetens. Vi arbetar enligt den statliga värdegrunden och dess principer och vi eftersträvar jämn könsfördelning. Lika rättigheter och möjligheter är viktigt för oss.
   

  

 Här får du goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling och ta del av bra förmåner. Vi jobbar också för att du ska kunna ha en bra balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning. Svenskt medborgarskap är ett krav, eftersom anställningar vid Fortifikationsverket är säkerhetsklassade. Det innebär att säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll kommer att genomföras i enlighet med bestämmelser i säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter, har du skyddade personuppgifter kontaktar du den rekryteringsspecialist som finns namngiven så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan. Som tillsvidareanställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov.
   

  

 Välkommen att skicka in din ansökan med CV och personligt brev senast 9 februari 2025. Vi vill ha dina ansökningshandlingar på svenska. Vid ansökan kommer dina personuppgifter behandlas enligt dataskyddsförordningen (GDPR). Genom din ansökan samtycker du till behandlingen. Din ansökan är en allmän handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen. De frågor som du får besvara när du skickar in din ansökan kommer att ligga till grund för det första urvalet vi gör.
   

  

****Frågor kring tjänsten?****
 Välkommen att kontakta driftchef Gert Warnas 010-44 45 463 eller rekryteringsspecialist Fredrik Dyrvik 010-44 45 647. Det går även bra att kontakta våra fackliga representanter: Eric Bergman, Ledarna, Tommy Eriksson, SEKO, Karin Alm, SACO, de nås via vår växel, tfn 010-44 44 000.
   

  

 Samtal från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.
   

  

**Kontaktpersoner**
 Länk till den här sidan http://web103.reachmee.com/ext/I005/1013/main?site=6&validator=61e84dc0c178c1f5fd4ebfb8b7ac37be&lang=SE&rmpage=job&rmjob=1780&rmlang=SE

title: Compliance Officer
company_industry: Manufacturing, International Trade and Development, and Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing
description:
*Are you a professional within Ethics and Compliance? Do you feel passionate about integrity and business ethics, and want to contribute to a global organization making a difference in society and everyday lives? We are looking for our next Compliance Officer to work with business ethics and GDPR compliance at Lantmännen’s Group Functions, where we keep business in mind and people at heart.*
**This Is What You Will Do**
 As a Compliance Officer, you will be part of our Group Compliance team and a larger Compliance community with colleagues from different business areas. Group Compliance is a central function that drives Lantmännen’s Business Ethics (including anti-bribery & corruption, sanctions legislation and competition law compliance) and GDPR compliance programs as well as manages the Lantmännen Code of Conduct. Lantmännen Group consists of five sectors, each including several businesses and companies, and we operate in an international environment, with presence in over 20 countries. In the Compliance Officer role you will work across the entire Group to implement and follow up on our compliance programs and continuously develop processes and routines within the field. The compliance programs are an important part of Lantmännen’s overall sustainability strategy.
   

  

 In the scope for this position, you will prepare reports, KPIs and communication material, conduct trainings, workshops, risk assessments and follow-ups and manage compliance-related projects. You will play an important role in the digitalization of our processes and in increasing the knowledge and use of our digital compliance tools, as well as in monitoring and ensuring the Group is up to date with compliance trends. Another imperative aspect of the role is to perform integrity due diligence of important stakeholders and suppliers. You will also be involved in compliance activities related to sustainability regulation frameworks, such as CSRD and CSDDD, where the Group Compliance collaborates with other Group functions, e.g. Group Sustainability. There will be great opportunities to develop both professionally and on a personal level.
   

  

 You will be part of a team of three and report to Janica Cronedal, Director Group Compliance. Group Compliance is part of the larger function Group Legal Affairs & Compliance which also includes our central legal team. You will have close interaction with all the colleagues within Group Legal Affairs & Compliance, as well as the extended Compliance community. Some traveling to our businesses and offices may occur occasionally. The position is placed at our headquarter in Stadshagen, Stockholm.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**You Have**
**This is what you need to succeed**
* A relevant academic degree in business, law or similar.
* Preferably 2-3 years of work experience within ethics compliance, legal or finance/economics
* Knowledge and understanding of GDPR as well as international Business Ethics Legislation and standards (anti-bribery & corruption, sanctions, competition law)
* Experience in driving projects independently from start to finish
* Skills in interacting with various stakeholders on different levels.
* Interest and knowledge of digital tools and how they can improve efficiency in business.
* Strong communication skills, both written and spoken, in Swedish and English


**You Are**
* A strong relationship builder with skills in stakeholder management
* Business-oriented with high integrity and a strong sense of responsibility
* A team player with excellent communication skills and the ability to adjust to various audiences, both internal and external
* Flexible in your approach and comfortable in adapting to new situations and changes, handling multiple projects at the same time
* Structured and organized in your way of working


 You share our values - Openness, Holistic view, Drive - and our promise of taking responsibility from Field to Fork.
   

  

**What We Can Offer**
 Lantmännen is a large international group and has a unique breadth in our operations. This means that we can offer development opportunities with various focuses for both specialists and generalists within different companies and industries in more than 20 countries. We actively work with internal mobility and want to contribute to employees' development and engagement every day. Together we reimagine the world of grain!
   

  

**Sounds interesting?**
 We hope so! You apply for the position online, preferably as soon as possible but no later than 9/2. In your application, you have the opportunity to add your CV or LinkedIn profile.
   

  

 For a more objective and inclusive recruitment process, we do not accept personal letters but instead ask you to answer selection questions relevant to the position. The recruitment process includes both psychometric tests and competency-based interviews, with the aim of promoting a fair evaluation for all candidates. At Lantmännen, it is important that everyone has equal opportunities for employment and development within the group.
   

  

 As a final candidate, a background check will be conducted through our supplier ToFindOut. If you have any questions about the position or the recruitment process, you are warmly welcome to contact Talent Acquisition Specialist, Julia Labbart at julia.labbart@lantmannen.com. We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Lead Account Executive – Stockholm (Sweden)
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Financial Services
description:
**What does a Lead Account Executive do?**
***Emphasis***
* Key
+ Lead our Swedish Sales Team consisting of both business developers and account executives
+ Achieve predetermined budget
+ Generate ARR/customer growth


* Development
+ Scale your business together with the team in a sustainable way
+ Protect/breath the team-and company culture (cfr. the way we do things)
+ Motivate and inspire your team to achieve and surpass their goals and reach an overall high level of performance (raising the bar)


**Responsibilities**
* Market Leadership
+ Grow the market footprint
+ Ensure that each local customer becomes an ambassador and generates opportunities using all available resources;
+ Actively contribute to the implementation/adjustment of the regional strategy and execute it at fast pace using a mix of sales and marketing levers;
+ Work closely with other teams to deliver market insights, help identify and address business/product priorities and enable BrightAnalytics to stay ahead of the market;
+ Maintain gameplans, playbooks and other content to make winning strategies scalable.


* Revenue generation
+ Reach regional team budget
+ Make sure revenue team members reach their ARR targets
+ Forecast revenue and potential business growth in the region;
+ Responsible for regional pipeline (fuel + follow up)
+ Put sufficient emphasis on the importance of pipeline management (lead by example)


* Lead generation
+ Make sure our Business Development Team generates enough leads via combined business-marketing development actions to fuel our sales pipe;
+ Monitor lead quality and manage our lead pipeeline
+ Maintain- and expand our partner network
+ Detect new market opportunities


***People***
* Recruitment
+ Hire, train, lead and retain a top-performing team


* Onboarding
+ Manage/ support the onboarding process in line with the onboarding plan


* Coaching/training
+ Act as a coach to ensure that our global processes and best practices are being adopted in an efficient way
+ Protect/breath the team-and company culture (cfr. the way we do things)
+ Motivate and inspire your team to achieve and surpass their goals and reach an overall high level of performance (raising the bar)
+ Approach: shadow sessions, roleplays, call/ meeting analysis, recap sessions, pop up quizzes
+ Test/monitor knowledge on a permanent basis
+ Expand knowledge when needed


**Who are you?**
* Masters degree in business
* +/- 5 years experience in a business/people/sales role
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Highly people oriented
* Ambitious, energized and target oriented


**What can you expect from us?**
* You will be part of driven, dynamic and enthusiastic team in a varied job;
* Weekly internal training sessions and on-the-job coaching will teach you unique skills that will serve you well throughout your career;
* We are a financially healthy scale-up with international growth ambitions;
* We have an open business culture with room for personal initiative;
* A competitive salary & motivating bonus system.

title: Sommar- och timvikarie som Varuplanerare till Apotek Hjärtat i samarbete med Deloitte
description:
**Så här jobbar du som Varuplanerare på Hjärtat**
 Vill du utvecklas inom planering, varuflöden och logistik? Vi på Apotek Hjärtat söker drivna sommarvikarier för att förstärka vårt team under sommarmånaderna med möjlighet till timanställning under resten av året. Som Varuplanerare har du en nyckelroll i att optimera varuflöden från leverantörer till vårt centrallager, våra 400 apotek och vår E-handel.
   

  

**Dina Arbetsuppgifter**
* Orderläggning och prognostisering
* Hantering av avvikelser
* Uppföljning av viktiga nyckeltal
* Säkerställa att rätt varor finns på rätt plats vid rätt tidpunkt
* Kommunicera och koordinera information mellan våra leverantörer, kategorichefer, lager och apotek


**Sommarprogram i samarbete med Deloitte**
 Vi vill ge dig möjlighet att bygga erfarenhet och genom vårt samarbete med Deloitte erbjuder vi en unik möjlighet till extra utveckling genom vårt sommarprogram. Programmet innehåller flera utbildningstillfällen, coachning samt möjlighet att arbeta med olika analysuppdrag och logistikprojekt parallellt med din roll som Varuplanerare. Målsättningen är att ge dig inblick i logistikens värld hos Sveriges ledande apotekskedja och i managementkonsultens roll hos ett av Sveriges största konsultbolag.
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 Du är resultatorienterad, självgående och har en god affärsförståelse. Du är nyfiken, har en stark analytisk förmåga och kan lätt bygga goda relationer tack vare din kommunikativa skicklighet. Rollen kräver att du talar och skriver obehindrat på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Vidare är du i början av din utbildning och studerar på högskola eller universitet inom logistik, ekonomi eller motsvarande. Du kan arbeta på plats på kontoret i Solna under juni-augusti och vill jobba som timanställd efter behov under resterade del av året, då med möjlighet att arbeta på distans.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av varuflöden och kunskap om IT-system som RELEX eller SAP samt tidigare erfarenhet från detaljhandeln, arbete på lager eller i butik/på apotek är det meriterande.
   

  

**Hitta hem hos oss**
 På Hjärtat har vi ett fantastiskt uppdrag: vi hjälper människor att må bättre. Vi finns för alla i Sverige – för de sjuka och för de friska, genom livets alla faser. Med 400 apotek i hela landet och en e-handel som aldrig stänger, finns vi alltid nära. Vi är över 4000 kollegor som tillsammans möter våra kunder med omtanke, var de än befinner sig. Tillsammans bygger vi en kultur där vi är ett lag som litar på varandra, ser varandras förmågor och där alla kan bidra och påverka. Där vi alltid utgår från vårt samhällsuppdrag och där det finns plats för nya idéer och innovation. För oss är det viktigt att ta vara på våra medarbetares kunskap och tankar och vår hemvist i ICA Gruppen ger stora möjligheter till både personlig och yrkesmässig utveckling. Här finns en plats för dig med hjärtat på rätt ställe.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 På Hjärtat strävar vi efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka. Vi välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund! Sista ansökningsdag är den 31 januari. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå arbetspsykologiskatester och bakgrundskontroller innan anställning. All extern hjälp med rekrytering undanbedes.
   

  

 Tjänsten är ett semestervikariat på heltid mellan mitten av juni till mitten av augusti, anställningen övergår till en timanställning vid behov under terminerna där du har möjlighet att arbeta på distans. Tillträde till tjänsten sker enligt överenskommelse. Har du frågor om tjänsten kontakta anna.ek@apotekhjartat.se, för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta Talent Acquisition Partner Sara Ehrenfeldt sara.ehrenfeldt@apotekhjartat.se
   

  

**Välkommen till oss - ett apotek med hjärtat på rätt ställe!**

title: Business Controller (vikariat) till Kronans Apotek
description:
Välkommen till vår värld! 👑 Vår vision är en värld som mår bra, och du kan hjälpa oss att göra den visionen verklig. Vi tror att meningsfulla arbetsuppgifter, starka teamrelationer och en generös dos skratt skapar en arbetsmiljö som inspirerar och stärker oss och alla våra kunder. Med fokus på både här och nu, samt på framtiden - bidrar vi tillsammans till en värld som mår bra! 🌍🧡🚀
   

  

 Då vår kollega ska på föräldraledighet söker vi nu dig som kan ta dig an uppdraget som Business Controller hos oss
 **från 1 mars fram till sista september 2025.**
**Din roll**
 I rollen som Business Controller kommer dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter innefatta att proaktivt arbeta med att förbättra vår lönsamhet tillsammans med organisationen. Ditt främsta fokus kommer ligga på att stödja och ge rådgivning till vår Sales and Operations-avdelning vad gäller lönsamhet, förbättring av processer samt affären. I ett tätt samarbete med vår försäljningsdirektör kommer du att fungera likt en Business Partner. Detta genom att vara ett stöd i ekonomiska frågor, bidra med analysarbete och delta aktivt i strategiarbete.
   

  

 I rollen ingår även följande arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområden:
   

  

  

* Upprätta olika typer av lönsamhetsanalyser samt regelbundna resultatuppföljningar.
* Upptäcka trendbrott i resultat-och försäljningsdata och analysera dessa.
* Samordna, utveckla och rapportera operativa KPI:er och komma med konkreta förslag till åtgärder och förändringar.
* Övergripande ansvar för budget och prognosarbete.
* Kalkyler & business case t ex vid nyetableringar.
* Bygga rapporter i proaktivt syfte för att stötta affären.
* Självständigt driva olika förändringsprocesser samt vara en del av projekt både inom teamet och organisationen.
* Aktivt delta i ledningsgruppen för Sales and Operations.


 Du kommer att ingå i ett team bestående av fem Business Controllers och rapporterar till Head of Business Control. Du välkomnas till vårt nya fina kontor i Stadshagen och vi tillämpar hybridarbete.
   

  

 ,
   

  

 Då detta är ett konsultuppdrag söker vi dig som kan komma in och leverera snabbt! Med andra ord söker vi dig som är erfaren och trygg i din kompetens. Det är ett krav att du har arbetat med dessa frågor inom retail eller FMCG på större bolag. Har du tidigare arbetat som Business Controller inom apoteksbranschen är det starkt meriterande.
   

  

 Vi söker mer specifikt dig som har:
   

  

  

* Flera års erfarenhet inom affärsnära controlling samt deltagit i ledningsgrupp.
* En utmärkt analytisk & kommunikativ förmåga.
* Behärskar svenska & engelska i tal och skrift.
* Tidigare erfarenhet från försäljning mot konsumenter, gärna försäljning i fysiska butiker
* God IT/systemvana, erfarenhet att arbeta med BI verktyg (te x Power BI), god kompetens inom Excel & PowerPoint.


**Din ansökan**
 Om detta låter som rätt uppdrag för dig tveka inte att skicka din ansökan till oss, i din ansökan vill vi ha ditt CV eller din LinkedInprofil. Personligt brev? Det kan du skippa! Vi är intresserade av din kompetens, lära känna dig gör vi vid en eventuell intervju.
   

  

 I slutet av rekryteringsprocessen tillämpar vi en bakgrundskontroll på samtliga personer vi vill anställa, oavsett roll eller funktion. Då vi enbart tillämpar detta på slutkandidat informerar vi mer om det längre fram.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! 😊
   

  

 Kärnan inom Kronans Apotek handlar om att vi ska må bra tillsammans. När vi har meningsfulla uppgifter, omfamnar varandras olikheter och delar många skrattar kan vi göra stor skillnad tillsammans. Strävan om att må bra är något vi delar med våra fackliga parter och tillsammans arbetar vi för en värld som mår bra. För att komma i kontakt med facklig representant Stephanie Nielsen från Unionen, maila Stephanie.nielsen@kronansapotek.se och facklig representant Aisha Karimi från Sveriges Farmaceuter, maila af.kronan@sverigesfarmaceuter.se .

title: Max Vasagaan söker Vik.restaurangchef
description:
**Har du en naturlig fallenhet för att leda och inspirera andra? Då kan tjänsten som Restaurangchef passa dig!**
**Vad kommer du att göra om dagarna som Restaurangchef på MAX?**
 Som restaurangchef arbetar du strategiskt med stöttning, uppföljning och utveckling av medarbetare och verksamhet. En lika viktig del är att du själv jobbar operativt i driften på din restaurang. Hos oss visar chefen vägen vilket innebär att du sätter dig in i alla delar av restaurangens drift och tycker det är kul att själv delta i produktionen. Du leder genom exempel och arbetar operativt i driften ca 60% av arbetstiden.
   

  

 Du som restaurangchef har det övergripande ansvaret för din restaurang vilket inkluderar såväl drift som ekonomi och personal. Du ser till att restaurangen når fastslagna månadsprognoser och budget samtidigt som dina medarbetare trivs och mår bra på jobbet. Förutom att du ansvarar för din egen restaurang vill vi också att du verkar som ett föredöme i företaget och bidrar med energi och resurser till hela ditt distrikt.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter innebär att:
   

  

 Säkerställa att restaurangen levererar på uppsatta mål i styrkort och affärsplan genom att omvandla dessa till lokala mål och handlingsplaner.
   

  

 Du arbetar för att restaurangen når upp till satta mål inom våra sex fokusområden kvalitet, bemötande/service, snabbhet, renlighet, säljfrämjande åtgärder samt kostnadskontroll/lönsamhet.
   

  

 Du arbetar med entreprenörsmässig planering av personal och schema, försäljning / lokal marknadsföring, renovering och underhåll. Du tar fram prognoser för försäljning och arbetade timmar samt upprätta handlingsplan för att nå dessa målsättningar.
   

  

 Med engagemang bygger du ett team genom att rekrytera, utbilda, coacha och motivera dina medarbetare, så att restaurangen tillgodoser och överträffar gästernas förväntningar. Du arbetar med daglig uppföljning och kontroll av varor beträffande svinn, lager/inköp och hantering.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du är en person som förstår vikten av att vara en god förebild och tycker om att se dina medarbetare utvecklas.
   

  

 Du har arbetat några år inom ett serviceyrke eller i någon annan snarlik bransch. Har du dessutom jobbat inom restaurang är det positivt, men det är inget krav. Däremot vill vi att du har minst två års erfarenhet från en ledarroll med personalansvar. Du har grundläggande IT-kunskaper och goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Du motiveras av att se andra växa samtidigt som du behåller fokus på mål och resultat. Du har en självklar känsla för service, är prestigelös och duktig på att kommunicera och samarbeta med såväl dina medarbetare som chefskollegor. Dina personliga egenskaper är otroligt viktiga för oss och vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dem i den här rekryteringen.
   

  

 Våra värderingar Mod, Passion och Gemenskap genomsyrar vårat dagliga arbete och vi söker därför dig som delar våra värderingar.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 Vi erbjuder dig ett roligt och varierat jobb där du driver restaurangen som din egen, med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter internt.
   

  

 Du kommer att få en gedigen skräddarsydd introduktion till vår verksamhet och du får också ta del av våra praktiska och teoretiska ledarskapsutbildningar utifrån ditt individuella behov.
   

  

 Vi gör ett löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Vill du läsa om hur vi hanterar dina personuppgifter? Gå in på www.max.se/dataskydd

title: IT/Network Support Specialist
description:
We are looking for an ONSITE IT & Desktop Support Engineer/Technician to support Casual Freelancing type tasks in your area. Would you be interested in contractual tasks? you will be paid either on an hourly or daily/half-day basis. Tickets will be dispatched with respect to your area & you may support them as per your availability (weekdays, weekends).
 



  





 Tasks will be L1 & L2 IT/Networking related like desktop support, Server/Rack part (Hard disk drives, etc.) hardware installation & replacement. Provide on-site assistance (console access Router/Switch/Firewall etc.) to remote support.
 



  





 Base Skill Set:
 



  





 Expertise in System Desktop Administration, Customer Service, Incident/Change/Release management, and Support for various third-party applications on Windows Platforms
 



  





 Professionally trained & certified in IT Infrastructure Library & Windows Server Administration and also has a sharp focus on utilizing the programming techniques for various initiative activities
 



  





 Basic understanding of DHCP, DNS, IP addressing, fixing wireless Lan, Ethernet desktop configuration issues, and subnetting.
 



  





 Technical troubleshooting and hands-on experience with different OS such as iOS, Android, Windows, and Blackberry devices

title: Fraud Analyst
description:
**Job Description**
 As a Fraud Analyst at Wolt, you will play a key role in detecting, analyzing, and preventing various types of fraud. Working closely with Fraud Operations, Marketing, Product, and Data teams, you will create and refine fraud prevention processes, ensure preparedness for new campaigns, proactively mitigate risks tied to upcoming product launches and platform changes and find new opportunities within the Fraud-prevention domain to be a factor in Wolt’s growth.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Trend Identification and Mitigation: Analyze customer, courier, and merchant behavior to detect and address patterns of different fraud types.
* Rule Management: Develop, implement, and optimize fraud prevention rules and models to respond to evolving fraud tactics while balancing user experience.
* Product Launch Preparedness: Work closely with the Product team to anticipate potential fraud risks for upcoming features or product launches, and design mitigation strategies tailored to these initiatives.
* Campaign Preparedness: Collaborate with the Marketing team to identify fraud risks tied to large-scale promotions and campaigns, ensuring proper safeguards are in place before launch.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Serve as a fraud expert to the Data, Product, and Customer Support teams, ensuring a cohesive approach to risk mitigation across the platform.
* Incident Investigation and Resolution: Resolve escalated fraud cases with speed and precision, ensuring learnings inform future strategies.
* Monitoring and Reporting: Define and own dashboards and reports to track fraud KPIs, evaluate the effectiveness of fraud prevention measures, and communicate insights to key stakeholders.
* Proactive Innovation: Stay ahead of industry trends and fraud tactics to propose and implement innovative anti-fraud solutions for Wolt’s ever-evolving ecosystem - being an important factor in Wolt’s growth.


**Our humble expectations**
**Requirements:**
* Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Finance, Computer Science, Data Science, or related disciplines).
* 3+ years of experience in fraud detection, prevention, or risk management, preferably in the delivery, e-commerce, or fintech industries.
* Analytical skills with experience using tools for data analysis.
* Proven expertise in addressing and managing multiple fraud types
* Ability to anticipate and mitigate fraud risks associated with product launches or new business initiatives.
* Experience in fraud rule creation and management in high-transaction environments.
* Familiarity with fraud prevention vendors
* Effective communicator with a proven ability to collaborate across departments like operations, marketing, and product.


 Preferred Our humble expectations:
   

  

* Experience with fraud prevention in food delivery, retail, or marketplace industries.
* Proficiency in using visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI) for reporting and insights.


**Next Steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so feel free to apply as soon as you feel like hearing more about the position and potentially joining Wolt! Please kindly make sure to include your portfolio with your application.
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and equity. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you'll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

**About Wolt**
 Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to home or to the office. Our local commerce platform makes it easy for customers to order whatever they need on one app, for merchants to make additional sales, and for couriers to make meaningful earnings flexibly. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local commerce platform to retail software and financial solutions, as well as operates its own grocery stores under the brand Wolt Market. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 27 countries today, 23 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.
   

  

*Wolt not only offers great apps to customers and partners, but is also developing a broad range of technologies and solutions. Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry’s highest reviews, largely because of our customer-centric approach to how we build our products and operations. For example, our customer service team responds in a matter of minutes, in the customer’s own language.*
***So, why work at Wolt?***
**At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.**
*You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself and being around friendly, humble and ambitious people. We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.*
*The behind the scenes of Wolt is run by an awesome bunch of over 700+ planners, builders, designers and data crunchers. We call ourselves Product+, as we’re the very core of Wolt’s products, tools and platforms. To build our products, we work in over 60 cross-functional, independent and autonomous teams.
