title: Engineering Operations Technician , Data Center
description:
• High school or equivalent diploma 
• 1 to 4 years of Knowledge of key electrical competencies and theory; generic mechanical room infrastructure such as chillers, cooler units, and fan controls; backup generator systems
• Valid EU driving license;
  

AWS Infrastructure Services owns the design, planning, delivery, and operation of all AWS global infrastructure. In other words, we’re the people who keep the cloud running. We support all AWS data centers and all of the servers, storage, networking, power, and cooling equipment that ensure our customers have continual access to the innovation they rely on. We work on the most challenging problems, with thousands of variables impacting the supply chain — and we’re looking for talented people who want to help. 
You’ll join a diverse team of software, hardware, and network engineers, supply chain specialists, security experts, operations managers, and other vital roles. You’ll collaborate with people across AWS to help us deliver the highest standards for safety and security while providing seemingly infinite capacity at the lowest possible cost for our customers. And you’ll experience an inclusive culture that welcomes bold ideas and empowers you to own them to completion. (AIS tagline)
We are looking for a Data Center Engineering Operations Technician to join our expanding Infrastructure Operations team. Data Center Engineering Operations Technician is a hands-on electrical and mechanical equipment troubleshooting and operation responder. If you like to use apply your electrical and mechanical skills to solve problems, we’d like to meet you. Your work will help to maintain one of the world's largest information system infrastructures.
We are currently hiring Data Center Engineering Operations Technicians in our mission-critical data centers in multiple locations across Sweden: Eskilstuna, Västerås, and Katrineholm.
A valid driver's license is required for this role.
Key job responsibilities
SAFETY
Follow and maintain the highest safety standards and diligently encourage a world-class safety culture. As a facility owner team, ensure remediation of safety risks/issues in conjunction with other teams. Own the safety initiatives and projects to foster strong safety culture.
ENGINEERING & FACILITY OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE
Operational experience and familiarity with electrical and mechanical equipment, including Uninterruptable Power Supplies (UPS’s), Switchgear, Circuit Breakers, Automatic Transfer Switches (ATS's), Diesel Generators, Chillers, Heating Ventilation Air Conditioning (HVAC), Exhaust Fans, Variable Frequency Drives (VFD's), and Transformers.
o Troubleshoot events within internal Service Level Agreements (SLA’s)
o Take daily operational readings of all mechanical and electrical equipment through routine rounds/log-taking (temperatures, voltages, currents, etc.)
o Supervise contractors who perform servicing or preventive maintenance
Physical requirements
• Manual handling and lifting of equipment may be required (weight limits in accordance with regulations).
• Ability to work shifts (morning, late and night) 
• On-call rotation reaction to off-duty emergency calls (if applicable)
• Work at heights and from ladders; in a noisy environment with ear protection
• Perform physical tasks during the shift
A day in the life
Your day-to-day activities will include:
Monitoring alarms and systems that manage power, cooling, and fire suppression in the data center.
Coordinating vendor work on-site to ensure equipment is maintained and uptime is preserved.
Supporting other teams and sites during events and planned works.
Handling rack installations and powering up equipment.
Monitoring and facilitating the handover of new equipment.
Sharing knowledge and supporting new team members.
Participating in event response drills.
About the team
At AWS, we value diverse experiences. Even if you don’t meet all of the qualifications, we encourage you to apply. We welcome candidates from all career paths, regardless of your professional journey.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and widely adopted cloud platform. Our innovation in cloud computing continues, which is why customers ranging from startups to Global 500 companies rely on AWS to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
At AWS, we embrace inclusion and diversity. Our employee-led affinity groups promote a welcoming environment that celebrates differences. Through ongoing events and learning opportunities like Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and our AmazeCon conferences, we strive to continuously foster a culture of inclusion.
Mentorship and Career Growth
AWS is committed to raising the bar in performance and employee development. We provide extensive knowledge-sharing, mentorship, and career-advancing resources to help you grow professionally.
Work-Life Balance
We believe in a healthy work-life balance and flexible working environments. AWS supports your well-being both at work and at home, allowing you to thrive in both areas.
  

* Degree in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or relevant discipline + Professional Certification in Electrical, Mechanical or Controls engineering.
* Experience in operations of critical facilities (Heavy Industry or Data Centers) which require in-depth knowledge in electrical, mechanical, and control systems and Data Center engineering experience

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: Qualification Engineer for Smartoptics
description:
We are looking for a Qualification Engineer who loves working in the lab. Are you the one we are looking for?



**Introduction**
----------------



Smartoptics provides innovative optical network solutions and devices for the new era of open networks, with a customer base including enterprises and public authorities, cloud providers, internet exchanges, as well as cable and telecom operators. Now, we are looking for a Qualification Engineer who loves working in the lab. Are you the one we are looking for?


**About the Role**
------------------



As a Qualification Engineer, you will work with the products in our portfolio that we don’t develop in-house. Together with leading suppliers in the field, we specify the products, often optical filters or transceivers. This role involves participating in setting requirements, specifying, and qualifying prototypes in the lab, which includes direct contact with suppliers. The role involves one or two trips per year worldwide, each lasting about a week.



You will work both in the office and in a lab environment. A qualification process involves working with various instruments, temperature chambers, evaluation boards, our hardware platform Smartboard, and other hardware commonly found in the lab. This is a role focused on quality assurance, which includes investigations, documentation, and report writing.


**About You**
-------------



To take on the role of Qualification Engineer, you need to have a few years of experience so you can work independently. As a person, you should have good communication skills, an eye for both detail and the bigger picture, strong self-motivation, and a genuine interest in learning more.



You should have a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering Physics, Optics, or another hardware-oriented engineering field.


**You should have experience in the following areas:**


* Working in a lab environment with instruments
* Python programming


**Merits:**


* Experience with telecom/networking products
* Experience with optical systems and optical instruments


To succeed in this role, you need self-drive and engagement. You should be curious and fearless. Proficiency in English is required, and since we speak Swedish in the office, a willingness to learn Swedish is necessary if you don’t already speak it.


**What We Offer**
-----------------



At the Stockholm office, Smartoptics is gathered in one place. We have a culture of openness and involvement. If you thrive on a dynamic environment and love being involved in problem-solving, there’s a great chance you’ll enjoy working with us! We have an ambitious roadmap ahead and offer strong development opportunities for our employees.



We work together at the office a few days a week but are flexible with remote work. We value being attentive, reliable, and innovative.


**About Smartoptics**
---------------------



Smartoptics is a Scandinavian company offering innovative fiber-optic network solutions and components for the new era of open networks. We solve technical challenges in networks to enhance our customers’ competitiveness. Smartoptics’ customer base today includes hundreds of companies, such as government clients, cloud providers, and cable and telecom operators. Smartoptics was founded in 2006 and has its headquarters in Oslo. The Stockholm office houses about 70 great colleagues, characterized by a culture of innovation and drive. Across the company, there are currently 120 employees. Our modern office is just a stone’s throw from the Kista subway station and the Helenelund commuter train station.

title: SAFe Product Owner
description:
The role of the SAFe Product Owner is to be responsible for defining user stories and prioritizing the team backlog in collaboration with Product Manager and Business Owners. This streamlines the execution of program priorities while maintaining the conceptual and technical integrity of the features or components.



**Introduction**
----------------



Smartoptics provides innovative optical networking solutions for a new era of open networking. We focus on solving network challenges and increasing the competitiveness of our customers. Our customer base includes cable and telecom operators, cloud providers, Internet exchanges, governments and thousands of enterprises.



The candidate will be part of the R&D team. The R&D team develops complete systems including both hardware and software.


**Position summary**
--------------------



In our successful Dynamic Connectivity Platform (DCP) there is a wide product line of transponders and muxponders, to enable high flexibility in a cost-efficient way - learn more about our transponders and muxponders here. Several new products are in the roadmap for 2025 and further on, and therefore we need a senior Product Owner. We work in a SAFe agile process and the Product Owner works in a team with software and hardware developers, system verification engineers and business owner.


**Requirements**
----------------


* Based in the Stockholm area
* Exam within relevant field, e.g. MSc in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science
* Good communication skills in English, preferably also in Swedish, with interest and experience to do documentation
* Experience from fiber optical industry, telecommunication or data communication
* Experience with agile development, leading development teams and/or product requirements specification processes
* People handling skills – e.g. mentoring, building relationships, problem-solving, empathy, planning

**Considered beneficial**
-------------------------


* Experience of the SAFe Framework
* Experience with Atlassian product suite for product development (Jira)
* Programming skills in e.g Modern C++ or Rust, on e.g. Embedded Linux
* Experience with network technologies (IP, Ethernet, DWDM)
* Experience with SDN (software-defined network) architectures and related protocols (e.g. RESTCONF, NETCONF and gNMI)


Smartoptics R&D team is located in Kista with head office in Oslo, Norway. Benefits include pension, health insurance, bonus scheme, 6 weeks’ vacation and flexible working hours. For more information about Smartoptics, please see **smartoptics.com/about**.



Furthermore, note that you must have a Swedish/EU work permit. No relocation assistance or visa support provided. No recruiters or agencies, please.


**About Smartoptics**
---------------------



Smartoptics is a Scandinavian company founded in 2006. We provide innovative optical networking solutions for the new era of open networking. Our focus is on solving network challenges and enhancing the competitiveness of our customers. Our clientele includes cable and telecom operators, cloud providers, Internet exchanges, governments, and thousands of enterprises.



At Smartoptics, we value inclusivity and prioritize the well-being of our employees. We foster a positive company culture and provide a supportive work environment.

title: Legal Counsel within Tech \u007C SEB, Solna
description:
We are looking for a Legal Counsel to Tech Legal, a team of currently 4 experienced legal professionals, within SEB’s group function Technology which consists of over 3000 employees. Does that sound like a fit for you?  

SEB is a leading financial services group and at the same time one of the largest Tech employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. **About the role**
You will be part of SEB’s Tech Legal team which is responsible for providing legal support in a wide range of tech/IT related matters across the bank. One of the team’s major responsibilities is to provide support in strategic sourcing initiatives involving and relating to, for example, cloud services, software licensing, outsourcing, AI and cyber security, where you will:* provide tailored advice to internal stakeholders on legal and contractual risks and risk mitigation.
* draft and negotiate agreements, including cloud, outsourcing, SaaS and software license agreements.
* stay up to date with technology-related regulatory developments.
* develop and contribute to Tech Legal’s processes and tools, including updating and maintaining internal documents and contract templates.
* collaborate and align with stakeholders including other legal functions within the SEB Group.

 **To thrive in this role, we believe you are**
A high performing, socially skilled person, with a solid commercial background. To succeed in this role, we see that you are also:* an experienced legal professional with excellent legal skills, who has an interest in and understanding of business in a broad and dynamic context.
* a confident and ambitious team player with high integrity and excellent social skills.
* a proactive and solution-oriented “doer” who has the confidence and knowledge to work independently.
* interested in regulations impacting tech services in the financial industry, relating to outsourcing arrangements for financial institutions, cloud, cyber security, data privacy, AI, DORA etc.

 **Qualifications*** Swedish Master of Laws (LLM) degree.
* Minimum 5-7 years of legal experience, preferably within a large corporation or law firm.
* Expertise in tech- and cloud-related legal matters, including contract negotiations.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, both verbally and in writing.
* A genuine interest in and understanding of technology is meriting.

 **What we offer*** Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* Work-life balance with a flexible and healthy work culture, including remote work possibilities.
* Friendly and welcoming culture.
* International opportunities and working environment.
* Competitive compensation and benefits such as gym access, attractive interest rates and possibilities to rent vacation homes through the SEB Group.

  

Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2025-02-09. If you have questions about the position, please contact Manager Erik Victor Ragnå at erik.victorragna@seb.se or Talent Acquisition Partner, Karl Saeter at karl.saeter@seb.se.  

Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers  

It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: SAP Reporting & Analytics Workstream Lead
description:
We are seeking an experienced SAP Reporting and Analytics Workstream Lead to our direct client in Stockholm / Solna.

Main location is Solna Office, but we has operations spread out in mainly Sweden, Finland and the US.

Some travel will be part of the role.

The Workstream Lead will play a critical role in the successful implementation of SAP S/4 HANA as part of Project Atlas, a multi-year, multi-site ERP transformation initiative. This individual will be responsible for defining, designing, and delivering robust reporting and analytics solutions that align with the strategic goals of the organization, in accordance with the project timelines.

Leveraging tools such as SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud, the Workstream Lead will ensure timely and accurate insights to support decision-making across global business operations.

The workstream lead will work closely with the project resources and with IT Business Intelligence leadership to ensure a smooth transition from project to steady state support.

**Required Skills and Qualifications:**

o Fluent in Swedish and English

* Educational Background:

o College or University degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field. Advanced degree preferred.

**Professional Experience:**

o Minimum 8 years of experience in reporting and analytics, including 5+ years of leadership experience in ERP implementation projects

o Expertise with SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP S/4 HANA

o Experience with ETL data migration concepts

o Strong understanding of data modeling, visualization, and integration techniques

o Proven track record in delivering analytics solutions in a global, multi-site environment

**• Soft Skills:**

o Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills

o Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

o Strong analytical, communication, and project management skills

o Excellent collaboration skills with ability to lead effective group sessions both in person and remotely

o Strong written and spoken language skills in English

o Attention to Detail and Process-Oriented mindset

o Adaptability and willingness to evolve the approach over time

o Adaptability and flexibility to changing situations and business conditions

**Key responsibilities of this role:**

**1. Workstream Leadership**:

a. Lead the Reporting and Analytics workstream, ensuring alignment with the overall project objectives, timeline, and budget.

b. Engage closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, business stakeholders, and external consultants, to deliver high-quality analytics solutions.

**2. Solution Design and Delivery:**

a. Assist with maintaining the Reporting and Analytics strategy for the project, ensuring alignment with enterprise standards and business requirements.

b. Utilize SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and other relevant tools to design, prototype, and implement reporting solutions.

c. Ensure integration of analytics solutions with SAP S/4 HANA and other relevant systems.

**3. Stakeholder Engagement:**

a. Collaborate with business leaders and process owners to gather requirements, and establish reporting needs.

b. Provide regular updates to stakeholders on workstream progress, risks, and mitigation strategies.

**4. Data Governance and Quality:**

a. Partner with the Data Management team to ensure data quality, consistency, and compliance with organizational standards.

b. Partner with IT Business Intelligence team to establish best practices for reporting and analytics governance.

5. Change Management and Training:

a. Develop training materials and provide end-user training to ensure effective adoption of reporting and analytics tools.

b. Support change management efforts by demonstrating the value of analytics in enhancing business processes.

6. Performance Monitoring:

a. Monitor and report on workstream performance metrics, ensuring continuous improvement and alignment with project milestones.

**ETL**

**Project Management**

**Data Visualization**

**Leadership**

**Collaboration**

**Data Modeling**

**Adaptability**

**SAP S/4 HANA**

**SAP Analytics**

**Cloud** **SAP Datasphere**

Jobbtyp: Heltid

Lön: 1,00kr - 1 000,00kr per timma

Förväntad arbetstid: 40 per vecka

Arbetsort: Delvis på distans i Stockholm

title: Security Engineer
description:
As a Security Engineer at Northvolt, your primary responsibility is to build and maintain the systems relating to the Cyber Defence Centre as well as safeguarding the organization's digital assets, infrastructure against cyber threats. You will play a key role in the operational security as well as continuously enhancing the capabilities of the organization by e.g. Automation, Procedures, Onboarding and understanding data sources among other things.  

  



**Key responsibilities**

**Overall areas of responsibility and activities.**

* Perform Security Engineering tasks (build, maintain and further develop) in Azure (Sentinel), Microsoft 365, AWS and any other solutions managed by Northvolt.
* Proactively work towards continual improvements of security processes, tools and routines.
* Configure, troubleshoot, and maintain security infrastructure software and hardware.
* Monitor systems for irregular behaviour, set up preventive measures and use-cases.
* Develop, execute, and track the performance of security measures to protect information and network infrastructure, devices, and systems.
* Define and continuously improve the way of working based on the cybersecurity architecture and the needs of the organization.
* Support the different disciplines within the Cyber Defence Centre (and extended Security team) in creating/enhancing capabilities and workflows.

Apply with CV in English or your complete LinkedIn profile.


Full time employment, fixed salary.
  

Planned starting date is asap.


*Please note that candidates considered for employment with NV may be subject to a mandatory background check process.*


*Please note that any applications submitted via email or direct messaging will not be considered.*


Skills & Requirements


**We believe that you have** **:**


* +5 years or more years’ work experience as a Security Engineer or related position.
* Experience in Security monitoring and incident response handling, cyber threat mitigation using SIEM tools and Cloud Security Engineering.
* Experience in threat intelligence, threat hunting, vulnerability scanning, and support for internal investigations.
* Proven experience developing, operating and maintaining cyber security systems preferably within the aforementioned Cloud Services.


**Specific skills:**


* Experience regarding identity and access management principles.
* Experience of security systems including anti-virus applications, content filtering, firewalls, authentication systems and intrusion detection and notification systems is a plus.
* Proven problem-solving and critical thinking skills.
* Experience and interest in OT-security and in manufacturing industry is a plus.
* Relevant security certifications like CCNP, GIAC, SCA, CISSP is a plus.Relevant security certifications like CCNP, GIAC, SCA, CISSP is a plus.


**Personal success factors:**

* Curious with a strong sense of right and wrong. Always objective, unbiased and ethical
* Excellent communication skills with fluency in written and verbal English, Swedish is a plus.
* Appreciate and see a strength in collaborating with colleagues from different areas of expertise and experience.
* Proudly share knowledge and happily guide and support colleagues.
* Ability to work under high pressure and meet tight deadlines, with excellent time management.
* Excellent Problem-solving skills
* Passionate & purpose drive
Great Place to Work


Top specialists as team peers


International environment


Fast paced & entrepreneurial culture


Wellness grant


4 semaines de vacances / 4 weeks of vacation


Journées maladie illimitées / Unlimited sick days
company_description: Northvolt is a supplier of sustainable, high-quality batteries. The mission is to build the world’s greenest battery, with minimal carbon footprint and the highest ambitions for recycling

title: Global Head Of Customer Support
description:
**Company Description**  

We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive, and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high-value work they live for.  



  

  

**Job Description**  

The Global Head of Customer Support is a strategic executive role responsible for defining and executing a comprehensive support strategy that spans reactive and proactive service, self-service optimization, and continuous customer experience enhancement. This individual will lead the global support team to consistently meet and exceed service expectations, delivering an exceptional customer experience that aligns with our brand values.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Strategic Leadership:** Define and implement a global customer support strategy that ensures world-class service and aligns with business objectives.
* **Proactive Support Initiatives:** Develop and lead proactive support practices that anticipate customer needs, reduce issues, and improve overall satisfaction.
* **Self-Service Optimization:** Drive initiatives to expand and enhance self-service capabilities, including the development of knowledge bases, AI-driven support solutions, and online resources to empower customers.
* **Customer Experience Excellence:** Ensure high standards for customer interactions across all support channels, embedding a customer-centric approach within the team.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Work with Product, Engineering, and Customer Success teams to align support initiatives with product updates, improving the overall customer journey.
* **Team Development & Performance:** Build and lead a high-performing global support team, instilling a culture of accountability, customer-centricity, and continuous improvement.

**Key Accountabilities**

* **Customer Satisfaction (CSAT):** Achieve and maintain high CSAT scores by optimizing support responsiveness, issue resolution, and customer communication.
* **First Contact Resolution (FCR) Rate:** Improve the rate of first contact resolutions, reducing time-to-solve and increasing customer satisfaction.
* **Self-Service Utilization:** Increase adoption of self-service resources, tracking usage metrics to ensure effectiveness and accessibility.
* **Response & Resolution Times:** Consistently meet or exceed service level targets for response and resolution times across all support channels.
* **Operational Efficiency:** Optimize support operations through technology and best practices, focusing on reducing overall support costs while enhancing service quality.

**Key Metrics for Success**

* **Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) Score:** Target of 4.5 / 5 or higher for all customer interactions.
* **First Contact Resolution (FCR):** Minimum 20% FCR rate, with improvements over time.
* **Self-Service Deflection Rate:** Target 5% annual increase in self-service use, reducing inbound support requests.
* **Average Response Time (ART) & Average Resolution Time (ART):** Meet or exceed predefined benchmarks to improve customer experience
* **Net Promoter Score (NPS):** Track improvements in NPS due to enhanced support experiences and proactive engagement

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree preferred.
* 10+ years of experience in customer support leadership roles, with a focus on global operations, ideally in a SaaS or technology environment.
* Proven track record of building and leading a high-performing, customer-centric support organization.
* Strong strategic and operational skills, with experience in self-service and AI-driven support solutions.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with experience working cross-functionally to align support with company-wide objectives.
* Data-driven approach with experience in tracking and analyzing key performance metrics to inform decision-making and continuous improvement.

  

**Additional Information**  

Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience,  

and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us  

At Unit4, we offer:

* a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful,
* balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being,
* talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry,
* a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,
* a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.
company_description: We're in business for people. Our enterprise solutions help service organizations empower their people to make an impact on the world.

title: Azure Integration Architect - Lead, Innovate, and Grow with Epical
description:
We’re redefining what a data consultancy can be and achieve
  
At Epical, we’re not just another consultancy firm; we’re on a mission to redefine what a data consultancy can be and achirve. Everything we do begins and ends with trust. For us, trust isn’t just a value—it’s the foundation of every successful partnership. As consultants, our role goes beyond providing advice and services. It’s about taking responsibility and seizing opportunities to help create a fairer world through expertise in integration, data and analytics, applications, and digital trust.
  
If you’re a customer-focused Azure Integration Architect who thrives on delivering high-quality integration solutions to enterprise clients across diverse industries, backed by a team of top-tier integration experts, keep reading—we’d love to meet you!
  
Your role as an Azure integration architect
  
As an Azure Integration Architect at Epical, you’ll play a pivotal role in:
  
**Consulting on integration architecture:** Partner with clients to craft and implement integration and API architectures that align with their unique needs and ambitions.
  
**Leading technical delivery:** Steer your team from planning and requirement analysis through design and implementation, ensuring seamless and impactful solutions.
  
**Presales activities:** Showcase Epical’s integration expertise to inspire confidence and excitement in potential clients.
  
**Team collaboration:** Lead workgroups and nurture a culture of learning and shared success within a team-based delivery model.
  
  

We’re proud to deliver high-quality integration solutions on various cloud platforms, and our growth means we’re tackling more complex projects in dynamic environments. Whether you prefer a technical, hands-on role, a strategic advisory focus, or a blend of both, we’ll tailor your position to suit your strengths and ambitions.
  
Why join Epical?
  
At Epical, trust and collaboration are at the heart of everything we do. Here’s what you can expect as part of our team:
  
**An environment that prioritizes people:** Work-life balance and flexible remote working options are part of our DNA.
  
**Stimulating assignments:** Collaborate with top-tier experts on exciting projects for enterprise clients in complex environments.
  
**Career growth opportunities:** Shape your role and grow with us as we solidify our position as the Nordics’ leading integration consultancy.
  
**Comprehensive benefits:** Enjoy a competitive compensation package, leadership and technical training, certifications, and more.
  
**A mission-driven organization:** Join a company that’s dedicated to building a fairer world through the responsible use of data and technology.
  
  

What you bring to the table
  
  

**To thrive at Epical, you should have:**  

A solid track record as a senior integration developer or integration architect with expertise in Azure integration architecture.
  
The ability to see both the big picture and the finer details of client requirements.
  
Leadership skills and experience guiding technical delivery teams.
  
A technical background that allows you to understand development processes, even if you no longer code day-to-day.
  
  

Practical details
  
All roles at Epical are permanent, with the flexibility to work from home or any of our offices across Sweden (Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö, Västerås, Örebro, and Skövde). To qualify, you must reside in Sweden and have a valid work permit.
  
Ready to join something epic?
  
If this sounds like the opportunity you’ve been looking for, we’d love to hear from you. We’ll be taking a well-deserved break during the festive season to recharge and gear up for an exciting new year. So, don’t worry if you don’t hear from us right away—we’ll get back to you with updates at the start of January, refreshed and ready to connect!
  
About Epical
  
Epical is a Nordic data consultancy driven to create a world built on trust. With approximately 400 experts, we go beyond the expected in integration, data and analytics, applications, and digital trust. By responsibly leveraging cloud technologies, we strive to deliver solutions that make the world a fairer place for everyone.
  
Data-driven business beyond the expected.

title: Receptionist - sökes till Iver
description:
Vi söker nu en receptionist till vårt kontor i Malmö. Är du vår nya kollega? Sök till oss om du trivs i en central roll, att vara ansiktet utåt och vill vara med på en spännande resa.Vi på Iver ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till våra kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara ”beside you”, ”behind you” och ”before you”. Vi kallar det för ”The Iver way”.
  
**Om Iver:** Iver är en ledande nordisk helhetsleverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster med spetskompetens inom drift, cybersäkerhet, cloud och innovation. Våra tjänster är kritiska inte bara för våra kunder – utan för digitaliseringen av samhället i stort. Med huvudkontor i Stockholm verkar Iver främst i Norden med en agenda att fortsätta expandera. Iver omsätter drygt 3 miljarder SEK och har cirka 1 500 anställda som arbetar på ett av våra 25 kontor i Norden. Din roll på Iver?Som receptionist är du vårt ansikte och även röst ut till våra kunder. För att lyckas i din roll som receptionist hos oss på Iver har du en god samarbetsförmåga, flexibilitetoch ett genuint intresse för service!Vidare är det viktigt att du är noggrann och har en god förmågaatt kommunicera både muntligt och skriftligt. Du trivs medatt skapa ett brett kontaktnät med bådekunder, leverantörer ochvåra medarbetare.I rollen som receptionistingår:
  
Besökshantering
  
Växel
  
Post- och pakethantering
  
Inköp av kontorsmaterial
  
Ansvar för kök och fikarum
  
Administrering av ärenden och vår tjänsteportfölj
  
Övriga administrativa arbetsuppgifter
  
  

Du arbetar i vårt team med medarbetare som finns på flera av våra kontorsom tillsammansutvecklasframåt inom Iver. Teamet är relativt nybildat och arbetar utifrån en central funktion. Dina kollegor är väldigt drivande och vi månar om varandras välmående, där vi uppmuntrar till utveckling och stöttar upp vid större arbetsuppgifter eller projekt. Vad erbjuder vi dig?
  
Iver - We empower our Nordic society. På Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Vi är inkluderande och strävar efter ett genuint samarbete mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi finns här för att inspirera dig till att nå dina yrkesmässiga mål. Vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden. Hos Iver är du en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas. Vem söker vi?Vi söker dig som har en gymnasieutbildning inom administration eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet. Det är viktigt att du är noggrann och trivs med att arbeta med återkommande administrativa uppgifter, samt att du har endrivkraft och vilja tillutveckling. Hos oss får du möjlighet att ingå i ett sammansvetsat team där kamratskap, kontinuerlig utbildning och stimulerande arbetsuppgifter är en självklar del av vardagen. Iver är ett företag i stark tillväxt och vi erbjuder goda möjligheter för rätt person att växa vidare inom företagets olika ekonomi- och administrativa roller.
  
  

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**  

Arbetat med service och administration vilket inkluderar arbete medOfficepaketet,särskilt Excel och Outlook.
  
Meriterande att ha arbetat medDstny växelsystem.
  
Allmän teknisk förståelse.
  
  

**Placeringsort:** Iver finns på 25 platser i Norden. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från vårt kontor i Malmö.Övrig information: Vi har kunder inom alla branscher och sektorer inklusive säkerhetsklassad verksamhet därför genomför vi bakgrundskontroller i samtliga av våra rekryteringsprocesser. Sök till oss!
  
Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-02-17. Du är välkommen att kontakta Magdalena Lundgren (magdalena.lundgren@iver.se) vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
  
Välkommen till Iver!

**To thrive at Epical, you should have:**  

A solid track record as a senior integration developer or integration architect with expertise in Azure integration architecture.
  
The ability to see both the big picture and the finer details of client requirements.
  
Leadership skills and experience guiding technical delivery teams.
  
A technical background that allows you to understand development processes, even if you no longer code day-to-day.
  
  

Practical details
  
All roles at Epical are permanent, with the flexibility to work from home or any of our offices across Sweden (Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö, Västerås, Örebro, and Skövde). To qualify, you must reside in Sweden and have a valid work permit.
  
Ready to join something epic?
  
If this sounds like the opportunity you’ve been looking for, we’d love to hear from you. We’ll be taking a well-deserved break during the festive season to recharge and gear up for an exciting new year. So, don’t worry if you don’t hear from us right away—we’ll get back to you with updates at the start of January, refreshed and ready to connect!
  
About Epical
  
Epical is a Nordic data consultancy driven to create a world built on trust. With approximately 400 experts, we go beyond the expected in integration, data and analytics, applications, and digital trust. By responsibly leveraging cloud technologies, we strive to deliver solutions that make the world a fairer place for everyone.
  
Data-driven business beyond the expected.

title: Senior Test Development Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Senior Test Development Engineer to join our team. In this role, you will design and implement cutting-edge test automation solutions to ensure high-quality software delivery. You will lead the development of test strategies using the Tricentis Ecosystem and collaborate with key stakeholders to optimize testing processes, enhance automation efficiency, and deliver exceptional results.
  
  

**Your Tasks:**  

**Analyze Project and Product Requirements:** Prepare test plans, test executions, test reports, and summary documents based on project and product specifications.
  
**Test Architecture Design:** Design the test architecture, providing technological guidance and recommendations to improve automation efficiency.
  
**Design and Supervise Test Automation:** Lead the design and implementation of modern test automation solutions for high-quality software delivery.
  
**Interface with Stakeholders:** Communicate effectively with key stakeholders, applying technical proficiency across various stages of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
  
**Create and Maintain Test Scenarios:** Develop, configure, deploy, and maintain test scenarios using TOSCA for automated testing.
  
**Analyze Test Results and Report Defects:** Review test results and promptly report appropriate defects or tasks to developers for resolution.
  
**Adhere to Standard Testing Procedures:** Apply industry-standard techniques and procedures while ensuring compliance with the company’s development and testing processes.
  
**Establish Test Design Standards:** Develop and enforce best practices and standards for test design and implementation within the organization.
  
**Support Project Teams:** Collaborate with project teams to achieve goals, ensuring the timely and successful delivery of high-quality software.
  
**Estimate Testing Efforts and Conduct Risk Analyses:** Provide accurate test effort estimates and conduct risk analyses to ensure high-quality project delivery.
  
**Identify New Sales Opportunities:** As a consultant, actively seek and identify new sales opportunities by engaging with different clients, understanding their needs, and providing tailored test automation solutions that drive business value.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

8+ years of experience in software testing, with 6+ years of experience in building and managing test portfolios using the Tricentis Ecosystem.
  
Proven expertise in designing test automation strategies to enhance software quality and efficiency.
  
Solid experience in Tosca automation, including Tosca API processes.
  
Hands-on experience in setting up and managing testing infrastructure involving Tosca Server, Distributed Execution, TDS (Tosca Distribution Service), and OSV (Optimized Service Virtualization).
  
Skilled in integrating Tosca with other Tricentis and external products to ensure seamless automation workflows.
  
Expertise in designing and implementing test automation frameworks using Tosca for various technologies.
  
Strong understanding of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and experience working with Agile methodologies.
  
Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools like Jenkins for continuous integration and deployment of automated tests.
  
Solid knowledge of various testing concepts, including functional, regression, performance, and integration testing.
  
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and deliver successful results.
  
Proficient in both spoken and written English, with the ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and effectively.
  
  

**Preferred:**  

Must be certified Tricentis TOSCA product architect and Tricentis Product consultant.
  
Experience in working with Other Tricentis Products such as Testim, Qtest and Tosca Cloud.
  
**Experience in product testing:** SAP, Web UI, Mainframe, Database and other desktop systems
  
  

**Nice to Have:**  

Experience with other test automation tools like Selenium, JUnit, or TestNG. and basic Knowledge in any one of the programming languages such as Java, Python, or C#.
  
Experience in mobile testing or cloud-based testing environments.
  
ISTQB or other relevant testing certifications.
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Spent 10,000 hours on TikTok? You might be the content...
description:
We're on the lookout for a passionate content producer with a deep interest in social media and pop culture. The role of a content producer is dynamic and versatile, involving everything from developing ideas and formats to being responsible for producing and editing content, with a strong focus on mobile content for social channels.


We believe you're passionate about pop culture in some form—whether it's gaming, cats, cooking, or something else entirely. You understand online communities and how people communicate on social platforms, and you're eager to help us explore new, creative ways to drive engagement and conversions.


Maybe you today already run one or more successful social media accounts of your own, and you're now ready to take your skills to the next level at one of the Nordics' top advertising agencies.

  

NORD DDB is a Nordic full-service agency and a micro-network that is a part of the international network DDB. We are 350 specialists in four countries, all sharing the same goal – breaking brands into pop culture.


We get there by being open – open to fresh perspectives, different personalities, collaboration, cultural change, new tech and new thinking.


With creativity as our fuel we offer brands a 360 journey within areas such as strategy, production, design, digital, media strategy, brand activation, social media, PR and advertising.


NORD DDB’s headquarters are located at Bonniers Konsthall in Stockholm. Leading accounts include McDonald’s, Volkswagen, Vattenfall, Telenor and Systembolaget.

**ABOUT THE ROLE**


To succeed in this role, you’ll need a keen eye for visuals, creativity, and a passion for storytelling through social media. The role requires that you are able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.You will take ownership of the production and editing process in close collaboration with the team of project managers, creatives and social media strategists.

 **REQUIRED COMPETENCES & LIFE EXPERIENCES**

* Knowledge of how social media algorithms work and how to optimize content for organic reach and engagement.
* Proven experience in video production, including shooting, editing, and post-production.
* Strong creative vision and attention to detail.
* Experience with motion graphics and sound design is a plus.
* Knowledge of Adobe Creative Cloud.
* You are fluent in Swedish and English in speech and writing


The employment is fulltime, and we are flexible with start date.  

Interviews will be held ongoing with the final application date on 12th of February.


Apply now by sending a short CV/ personal letter together with a video application to susanne.johansson@se.nordddb.com.  

For question regarding the role, contact Susanne.

*We embrace difference and a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our clients.*

title: Hardware Design Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about cutting-edge hardware design and want to work with the latest FPGA and optical technologies? Join our innovative team at Net Insight as a **Hardware Design Engineer** and help shape the future of networking products!

 *Want to learn more about our products and get to know our people? Make sure to check us out on* ***LinkedIn*** *and* ***Youtube****!*

**About your role**


As a **Hardware Design Engineer**, you will design advanced electronic circuit boards for a range of networking products based on the latest FPGA technologies. You will play a key role in the entire product lifecycle, from initial concept to production and maintenance, ensuring our product portfolio stays innovative and market-leading.


Your responsibilities

* Develop and design advanced electronic circuit boards with signaling rates up to 400 Gbit/s. Typical designs include high-performance FPGA devices, DC-DC converters, embedded computer modules, high-speed memories, and optical modules.
* Participate in the complete process of releasing new products and maintaining the existing portfolio to ensure quality and manufacturability.
* Collaborate closely within a small, focused team and interact with cross-functional teams including Software, Firmware, Applications, Mechanical, Layout, and Test developers.

 **About the Team**


You will be part of a team of eight skilled professionals who are passionate about developing innovative FPGA and optical solutions. You'll work with the latest technologies, be involved in the entire product journey from concept to delivery, and collaborate in a creative, team-oriented environment that values innovation and growth.

 **Your Profile**

  

We believe you'll fit right in if you consider yourself to be focused on achieving team success, has a structured way of thinking with strong prioritization skills. You approaches challenges with a humble and non-prestigious attitude and have a willingness to learn and continuously improve.


Skills and experience:


* 10+ years of experience as a Hardware Design Engineer.
* BSc or MSc degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent.
* Hands-on experience designing with FPGA devices.
* Proven experience designing products in the telecommunications sector.


Bonus skills:


* Experience with RF design.
* Expertise in designing with optical modules.
* Experience designing products manufactured in high volumes.
* Proficiency with Cadence HDL schematic system.
* Experience with PDM systems and component selection

 **Our culture and beliefs:**


At Net Insight, **innovation**, **collaboration**, and **trust** are the cornerstones of our success. As one team, we are committed to delivering value to our customers, contributing to the growth and success of our company.


Together we create a dynamic and positive workplace where everyone is valued, engaged and empowered to make an impact

**How to apply and information about the process**


It's super-easy!


Upload you CV or use your LinkedIn profile, fill in the choice questions (no data entry) and upload relevant documentation of you choice - That's it.


Note: We do not offer relocation support at this time.


Note 2: Background check will be part of our recruitment process.

 **This is NET INSIGHT**

*Net Insight (Nasdaq: NETI B) provides the highest performing, most open video transport and media cloud technology for content providers as the industry standard for flexibility and service across live contribution, distribution and remote production media workflows.*

*For over 25 years, the world’s leading content owners, broadcasters, production companies, service providers and enterprises have trusted Net Insight’s Emmy Award winning Nimbra technology to guarantee media delivery. Today, Net InsiEmmy Awardght partners with hundreds of customers in over 70 countries to ensure media flows across managed and unmanaged IP networks, and the cloud – from anywhere, to everywhere. It enables customers to get the best from any mix of virtualized, cloud and IP technology and is the only platform to support all the major industry standards, protocols and clouds.*

  

For more information, please visit *www.**netinsight.net*

title: Sektionschef till CCIS Core
description:
*Vi tror att framsteg och möjligheter skapas bäst tillsammans. Välkommen till en plats där samarbete gör skillnad.*


Din roll


Som sektionschef hos oss sätter du personalens välbefinnande främst. Du samarbetar med ledningsgruppen för att utveckla kompetens, strategi för produkter och andra viktiga områden, både stora och små. Sektionen CCIS Core, med 15 medarbetare, består av systemingenjörer, mjukvaruutvecklare, systemintegratörer och GIS-utvecklare (Geografiska Informations System), som fokuserar på att utveckla system inom Command & Control Information System (CCIS), men bidrar även till andra system.


Vårt mål för sektionen är att skapa en gemensam grund för CCIS-komponenter som kan ingå i CCIS-system för olika svenska försvarsdomäner och exportprojekt. Detta innefattar egenutvecklad mjukvara, systemarkitektur, hårdvarulösningar baserade på COTS-produkter och integrationslösningar med tredjepartsprodukter, med stor vikt på IT-säkerhet i helhetslösningen.


En viktig del av ditt arbete är att se till att projekten har rätt kompetens och resurser samtidigt som du främjar personalens utveckling och trivsel. Du har ansvar för kostnadsställeekonomi, arbetsmiljö och lönesättning, samtidigt som du arbetar systematiskt med den personliga utvecklingen av din personal. Som chef har du en central roll i att driva verksamheten framåt och skapa förutsättningar för fortsatt tillväxt. Vad ditt specifika bidrag blir beror på din kompetens och bakgrund – mer om det berättar vi gärna vid ett möte.


Resor förekommer i tjänsten.


Din profil


I den här rollen söker vi dig som vill utveckla både människor och teknik. Du trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i grupp, och känner dig trygg med att stötta och inspirera andra. Vi ser gärna att du har en god samarbetsförmåga och analytisk skicklighet.


Vi söker dig med:

* Teknisk utbildning på högskole- eller universitetsnivå, eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Tidigare dokumenterad ledarerfarenhet.
* Erfarenhet från tekniskt arbete, t.ex. som systemingenjör eller i en liknande roll.
* Goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


Meriterande kvalifikationer:

* Erfarenhet av komplexa system och liknande produkter.
* Kunskap om FMN, Cloud systems, storage/orchestration och säkerhetslösningar.
* Erfarenhet av NATO eller tekniska system inom NATO.
* Förståelse för militär högre ledning.


Vi värdesätter inte bara din kompetens och erfarenhet, utan lägger också stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. För oss är det viktigt att du bidrar till en positiv arbetsmiljö, trivs med att samarbeta och har en inställning som främjar både teamets och verksamhetens utveckling.

*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*


Vad du blir en del av


Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.


Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.


Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 23 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.


Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här


Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut. Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Security & Compliance Lead
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


We are seeking a highly skilled Security and Compliance Lead to join our team. As the Security and Compliance Lead for Product Area (PA) Employee Experience, your role is to ensure the security and compliance of IT products throughout their entire lifecycle - where built-in security and compliance capabilities are prioritized over bolt-on. As part of this role, you will lead the integration of security practices, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and foster a security-aware culture.

  

The Security and Compliance Lead position is reporting to the Head of PA Employee Experience and is part of the PA Employee Experience Leadership Team. Security clearance is required for this role.

 **Product Area Employee Experience - a part of Enterprise IT**  

PA Employee Experience is end-to-end accountable for delivery and development of Enterprise IT capabilities for Employee Experience at Ericsson - including IT capabilities for functional domains People/Human Resources and Real Estate as well as company-wide employee IT capabilities for Productivity & Collaboration, Unified Communications, Computer & Mobile, and Digital Experience.

 **What you will do:**

* **Integration of Security Practices:** Lead the integration of security practices into the Product Area (PA) workflow, ensuring security is embedded at every stage of the development process. Collaborate with development, operations, and security teams to implement security controls, automate security testing, and establish security checkpoints within the CI/CD pipeline.
* **Built-in Security Features:** Work closely with product development teams to design and implement built-in security features and controls. Conduct threat modeling exercises and integrate security controls directly into the product architecture and design.
* **Security Automation and Orchestration:** Utilize automation and orchestration tools to streamline security processes and workflows. Automate security scans, vulnerability assessments, and compliance checks, while orchestrating security tasks and responses to security incidents.
* **Security Training and Awareness:** Collaborate with the IT Security & Compliance team to provide tailored security training and awareness programs. Educate developers, operators, and other stakeholders about secure coding practices, cloud security fundamentals, and DevSecOps principles.
* **Security Governance and Compliance Reporting:** Adhere to governance frameworks for IT security practices and develop compliance reporting mechanisms to ensure alignment with industry standards and regulatory requirements.

 **The skills you bring:**

* Analytical skills with proficiency in understanding information flows and strong analytical abilities
* In-depth knowledge of security standards such as ISO 27000, NIST SP 800-53,
* NIST 800-171, GDPR, NIS 2, SSDF.
* Leadership experience leading global teams with high integrity and collaboration skills
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
* Deep understanding of the operational interface between business and IT
* Solid understanding of business and financial management
* Ability to prioritize and collaborate with various stakeholders to align IT-Security Solution delivery with organizational strategy.

 **Preferred Certifications:**

* CISA, CISM, CISSP, ISO Lead Auditor, SAP Certification.

 **Valuable Experience:**

* Several years of experience in implementing IT Security Architecture standards.
* Experience in a similar role within a large, complex organization.
 **Application**  

We look forward to your application with CV/Resume in English.  

Last day to apply: 24th of January 2025  

Location: Stockholm, Sweden  

Flexibility of work: We target 60% attendance at office.

  

Please note that we do not accept, progress, or respond to applications sent via e-mail.

  

If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Nina Juthage, Sr. Recruiter, at nina.a.juthage@ericsson.com

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

  



If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com

  

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.

title: Senior RU SW Test Manager
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------



Business Area Network’s goal is strengthening end-to-end development of our market leading products, simplify the development flows and processes, empower our developer community, and ensure our sustainable long-term competitiveness by aligning technology and strategy. Hardware Engineering is one of the three new Engineering Units in Business Area Networks, responsible for the end-to-end development for our Hardware products such as Radios and Transport products, including ASIC and FPGA development, as well as optimization of integrated software development flows.

  

Product Engineering Unit RU Software is a unit with the exciting role to put SW on the HW map. We are a distributed team, dedicated to lead SW development for the Radio portfolio with clear interfaces towards Integrated RAN and Cloud RAN. We are in the process of forming the organization, built on key competences, innovation and collaboration for business and technology leadership. Product Engineering Unit RU Software’s role is to bridge Radio, ASIC and RAN development, evolving the RU SW architecture closely with DU SW architecture while supporting MS-RBS and Cloud-RAN needs.

 **About this opportunity**


We are looking for a Senior Test Manager at System and Test Management team, who is eager to work with developing testing strategies, evolving test setup for future for state of art Radio products supporting all mobile technology generations. You will belong to System and Test Management team responsible for developing, implementing & supporting XFT teams with Radio software Test strategy.

  

You have experience from testing software and eager to understand how it all testing aspects fits together to ensure that requirements are tested & fulfilled before delivering a product. You know how to take complex problems and explain/describe in simple way so that more people can understand and break them down such that solving them becomes straightforward. You are organized and determined and able to turn ideas into concrete solutions.

  

Join us in crafting the future!

 **What you will do**

* Developing, evolving, implementing, and maintaining Radio Software test strategies specifically focusing on CI/CD on Radio product level as well as on RAN solution level.
* Assures that the flow unit ‘a feature' goes through its life cycle ' CA- PD - maintenance' with the most efficient test coverage focusing on flow and quality of the unit and the product.
* Defining and maintaining test scope for Radio Software Conformation and Node level testing.
* Aligning Radio software way of working with other stakeholders.
* Build, align, deploy, and enforce test strategy.
* Evolve test WoW (propose, drive, support improvements)
* Ensure early test and development tool strategy and build tool requirements.
**The skills you bring**
------------------------


* Education: M.Sc. or equivalent.
* Min years of experience: 5 years for software testing experience.
* Testing, troubleshooting, problem solving, E2E & system thinking.
* Experience with HW & SW integration methodologies.
* Leadership (previous OPO, team lead, or customer engagement experience is a plus)
* Lean and Agile knowledge and skills, value driven development attitude, testability and test-driven development
* Working with people, networking, facilitation, negotiation skills. Teamwork and collaboration skills
* Excellent technical communication skills, both written and oral
* Fluent in English

 **To be successful in the role one must have**

* Knowledge of Radio (HW, SW) portfolio and functions, JCAT & test automation, CI/CD.
* Knowledge of eNodeB / gNodeB, transport network protocols & interfaces, NSV QA’s.
* Product development processes and methods, anatomy-based planning, product lifecycle management knowledge
* Ability to perform test analysis, evaluate test results, and produce a verdict. Define test strategies based on best test methodologies/concepts.

  

We are looking forward to your application in English where you describe the value of your experience and skills in the above technical area.

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. title: Global Head Of Customer Support
description:
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We’ve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive, and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high-value work they live for.
   

  

  

  

  




**Job Description**

 The Global Head of Customer Support is a strategic executive role responsible for defining and executing a comprehensive support strategy that spans reactive and proactive service, self-service optimization, and continuous customer experience enhancement. This individual will lead the global support team to consistently meet and exceed service expectations, delivering an exceptional customer experience that aligns with our brand values.
   

  





**Key Responsibilities**



* **Strategic Leadership:** 
 Define and implement a global customer support strategy that ensures world-class service and aligns with business objectives.
* **Proactive Support Initiatives:** 
 Develop and lead proactive support practices that anticipate customer needs, reduce issues, and improve overall satisfaction.
* **Self-Service Optimization:** 
 Drive initiatives to expand and enhance self-service capabilities, including the development of knowledge bases, AI-driven support solutions, and online resources to empower customers.
* **Customer Experience Excellence:** 
 Ensure high standards for customer interactions across all support channels, embedding a customer-centric approach within the team.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** 
 Work with Product, Engineering, and Customer Success teams to align support initiatives with product updates, improving the overall customer journey.
* **Team Development & Performance:** 
 Build and lead a high-performing global support team, instilling a culture of accountability, customer-centricity, and continuous improvement.



**Key Accountabilities**



* **Customer Satisfaction (CSAT):** 
 Achieve and maintain high CSAT scores by optimizing support responsiveness, issue resolution, and customer communication.
* **First Contact Resolution (FCR) Rate:** 
 Improve the rate of first contact resolutions, reducing time-to-solve and increasing customer satisfaction.
* **Self-Service Utilization:** 
 Increase adoption of self-service resources, tracking usage metrics to ensure effectiveness and accessibility.
* **Response & Resolution Times:** 
 Consistently meet or exceed service level targets for response and resolution times across all support channels.
* **Operational Efficiency:** 
 Optimize support operations through technology and best practices, focusing on reducing overall support costs while enhancing service quality.



**Key Metrics for Success**



* **Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) Score:** 
 Target of 4.5 / 5 or higher for all customer interactions.
* **First Contact Resolution (FCR):** 
 Minimum 20% FCR rate, with improvements over time.
* **Self-Service Deflection Rate:** 
 Target 5% annual increase in self-service use, reducing inbound support requests.
* **Average Response Time (ART) & Average Resolution Time (ART):** 
 Meet or exceed predefined benchmarks to improve customer experience
* **Net Promoter Score (NPS):** 
 Track improvements in NPS due to enhanced support experiences and proactive engagement


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree preferred.
* 10+ years of experience in customer support leadership roles, with a focus on global operations, ideally in a SaaS or technology environment.
* Proven track record of building and leading a high-performing, customer-centric support organization.
* Strong strategic and operational skills, with experience in self-service and AI-driven support solutions.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with experience working cross-functionally to align support with company-wide objectives.
* Data-driven approach with experience in tracking and analyzing key performance metrics to inform decision-making and continuous improvement.


**Additional Information**

 Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We’re a fast-paced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience,
   

 and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us
   

 At Unit4, we offer:
   

  




* a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful,
* balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being,
* talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry,
* a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet,
* a safe and inclusive working environment – supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4.

title: Technical Support Manager (On-site)
description:
**About Kisi**
 We are Kisi, a physical security tech company revolutionizing how businesses access and secure their spaces.
   

  

 Founded in 2012, with headquarters in Brooklyn, an office in Stockholm, and a global team, we create innovative, award-winning hardware and compliance-certified software that enable seamless, cloud-based access to offices, facilities, and buildings. Our mission is to ensure ease of access and remote space management, fostering a future where spaces are securely connected and accessible without boundaries.
   

  

 At Kisi, you’ll join a creative and innovative team with a flat hierarchy, work closely with our co-founders, and enjoy the freedom to work your way with a strong sense of ownership.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are seeking a Technical Support Team Manager to lead our growing customer support operations. In this role, you will be responsible for implementing and executing our support strategy, managing our support portal, maintaining technical product documentation, and overseeing a dedicated team of support specialists.
   

  

 We’re looking for a candidate with at least three years of technical support experience, strong leadership skills, an ability to quickly master new products, and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving. If you’re passionate about delivering exceptional customer support and driving process improvements, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Strategic planning and execution of support operations: develop and implement our support strategy across different customer segments, ensuring alignment with service-level objectives and broader organizational goals.
* Excellence in execution: continuously elevate support quality by benchmarking against industry best practices in terms of cost, budget, and response times, then exceeding these standards.
* Help customers help themselves: create, update, and optimize support content and troubleshooting guides so customers can independently resolve common questions and issues.
* Manage a growing support team: lead and supervise an expanding team of support specialists, ensuring adherence to best practices and competitive performance benchmarks.
* Keep customers, partners, and colleagues informed: maintain up-to-date product guides and documentation, providing clear self-service resources. Gather feedback from customers to refine our offerings, and keep teams across the organization informed of changes or updates.


**Qualifications**
* 3+ years of experience managing support operations.
* Experience with driving a team based on clearly defined and attainable objectives and key results. We put emphasis on execution for this role.
* Relevant and solid technical support experience, preferably in a B2B or SaaS environment, with a proven track record of leading team members.
* Well-rounded leadership, coaching, and team management skills, including the ability to learn new products quickly and explain complex technical concepts clearly.
* Good communication and cross-functional collaboration skills, supported by a history of implementing process improvements to streamline workflows.
* Familiarity with ticketing systems (e.g., Zendesk, HubSpot) and maintaining technical documentation or knowledge bases.
* Basic understanding of circuitry (plus/minus, AC/DC); we’re not looking for engineers, but an openness to learn is encouraged.
* Please note that this is an on-site role, requiring full-time attendance five days a week at our Stockholm office, located on Södermalm.


****Your process with us****
 Application > CV screening > Intro call (let’s get to know each other!) > Recruitment task > Hiring Manager Interview > On-site Interview > Offer.
   

  

 After successful interviews and the job offer is signed, we will conduct a background check.

title: Business Support Lead
description:
Kodiak Hub is looking for a new team member who is organized and versatile, with a focus on financial administration, to provide crucial support to our leadership team and line managers, ensuring smooth operations across a variety of tasks.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 At Kodiak Hub, we’re revolutionizing Supplier Relationship Management (SRM) with our cloud-based platform that empowers businesses to build stronger supplier relationships and drive sustainable growth.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As our Business Support Lead, you will be responsible for business administrative support and be an essential contributor to our business’s financial and operational efficiency. This position is perfect for someone that truly enjoys juggling a very wide range of tasks and has the ability to switch between high level planning and fast paced execution.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Oversee the creation, tracking, and reconciliation of invoices for our global customer base, and collaborate closely with our customer and finance team to ensure compliance.
* Monitor accounts receivable and follow up on overdue payments, and communicate with customers when questions arise.
* Manage and streamline internal administrative processes, ensuring efficiency and accuracy.
* Office & Facility Management
* Meetings & Events Management
* Assisting in preparing reports, presentations, and documentation for the leadership team.


**What We’re Looking For**
* Proven experience in an administrative role (e.g., Executive Assistant, Operations Coordinator, or similar).
* Strong understanding of invoicing, financial documentation, and administrative processes.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills with keen attention to both detail and quality.
* Outstanding communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Fluency in English, additional languages is a plus.
* Proficiency in MS Office tools like Excel and PPT.
* A solution mindset with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.


**Why Join Kodiak Hub?**
* Be part of a fast-growing SaaS company making an impact on global supply chains.
* Enjoy a collaborative and supportive culture driven by our core values.
* Grow your career through professional development opportunities.
* Experience a truly diverse and international workplace.


**Ready to Join?** 
**🚀**
 If you’re ready to bring your expertise to a cutting-edge SaaS company and make a real impact, we’d love to hear from you! Apply today and help us build the future of Supplier Relationship Management.
