title: Head of Frontend Development & Design
description:
Here at Predictable Hiring we are partnered with an exciting AI company who is looking for a Head of Frontend Design to bring their product to life. This role is ideal for someone with a keen eye for design and a deep understanding of frontend engineering, combined with full stack experience. As an early hire, you’ll have significant freedom and responsibility to shape the core product and culture alongside the founders.
 



  





**About:** 




  





 The company is building the software that builds other software. As an early member of the team you will have a great impact on the company and working closely with the founders.
 



  




* Work in close-knit team of IOI gold medalists, CTOs and founders.
* Work on a problem that has the potential to create a historical shift in how they think about software.



  





**Responsibilities:** 




  




* Transform product ideas into beautiful, functional interfaces without having to rely on detailed Figma files or designer handoffs, creating high-quality, end-to-end implementations directly from concepts or minimal guidance.
* Collaborate with the founding team to define, design, and ship new features.
* Take ownership of our frontend, while at the same time being able to execute on full stack tasks. (They are happy to coach you in backend tasks!)
* Contribute to the technical architecture, exploring and integrating the latest AI research and design principles.
* Participate in all phases of the development lifecycle, including design, deployment, and maintenance.



  





**Qualifications:** 




  




* Strong frontend development expertise, with an exceptional eye for detail and taste in design.
* Proven experience across both frontend and backend development; comfortable with full stack work.
* Familiarity with various programming languages and frameworks, specifically in a design-heavy context.
* Experience working on scalable, high-quality applications.
* A hands-on, problem-solving attitude with a commitment to high standards.
* Comfortable with iterative development processes and working within a fast-paced environment.



  





**Tech stack:** 




  




* Frontend: React
* Backend: (Typed) Python
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google's Cloud Run, Sentry



  





 A great tech stack is important: They are set on combining open source frameworks that AI can build with, and that human devs love to maintain.
 



  





**Who should apply...** 




  





 If you're passionate about product building, making a significant impact and shaping the future of software development alongside a team of ambitious previous founders, IOI gold medalists, CTOs, and product design we want to hear from you.

title: Data Engineer
description:
My client is a leading European IT services provider, offering innovative and high-quality technology solutions to businesses across various industries.
 



  





 With over 9000 employees, this organisation has a strong focus on digital transformation, delivering end-to-end services ranging from cloud computing, data analytics, and IT infrastructure management to software development and system integration.
 



  





 The company prides itself on its family feel and customer-centric approach, working closely with clients to understand their unique needs and provide tailored solutions that drive efficiency and business growth.
 



  





 This organisation have offices across Europe – including significant operations in the Benelux and Nordic regions.
 



  





 As a result of growth they are looking for talented Data Engineers and Consultants to join the growing practice in Sweden which currently employs around 60 people.
 



  





**What You'll Do:** 




  




* Design and build robust data pipelines using Microsoft Azure technologies.
* Develop and optimize data storage solutions using SQL Server, Azure SQL, or Cosmos DB.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate data from various sources.

* Proficiency in Microsoft Azure (Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics).
* Strong SQL programming skills and experience with relational databases.

**Why Join Us:** 




  




* Opportunity to work on innovative projects using cutting-edge Microsoft Technologies.
* Collaborative and inclusive work culture that values creativity and growth.
* Competitive compensation package with excellent benefits (including wellness allowance, insurances and 30 days vacation).

title: Säkerhetsarkitekt med gedigen erfarenhet
description:
Vi söker en säkerhetsarkitekt med gedigen erfarenhet inom IT infrastruktur och tekniska säkerhetslösningar med fokus på arkitektur samt design. I din roll kommer du vara en nyckelperson i att hjälpa våra kunder med säkerhetsstrategier och säkerhetsgranskningar.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden**
 – Utveckla och implementera robusta IT-säkerhetslösningar med arkitektur som är anpassade efter kundens specifika behov
   

  

 – Genomföra risk- och säkerhetskgranskningar tillsammans med förslag på förbättringar
   

  

 – Vara delaktig i projekt och upphandlingar som säkerhetsarkitekt och designa helhetslösningar
   

  

 – Samarbeta med kunder och hjälpa dem i deras arbete med efterlevnad till gällande säkerhetsstandard och regulatoriska krav
   

  

**Din erfarenhet**
 – Gedigen erfarenhet som IT-Säkerhetsarkitekt med fokus på tekniska lösningar
   

  

 – Bakgrund inom IT-infrastruktur, inklusive server, storage och nätverk
   

  

 – Kompetens inom Cloud Säkerhet och förmågan att implementera säkerhetskontroller i cloud miljöer
   

  

 – Erfarenhet av informationssäkerhet och IT-säkerhet på operationell, taktisk och strategisk nivå
   

  

 – Kompetens av regulatoriska krav som NIS Direktivet, GDPR, MSBFS, Dora m fl
   

  

**Kvalifikationer för rollen**
 – Bachelor’s Degree i IT eller relaterat område
   

  

 – Relevanta certifieringar som CISSP, CISM, CEH, OCP, CCSP
   

  

 – Gedigen erfarenhet inom IT-säkerhetsarkitektur, IT-Infrastruktur och Cloud Security kompetens
   

  

 – Erfarenhet av ramverk och metoder som NIST CSF, CIS18, ISO 2700x, ITIL v3, STRIDE och MITRE ATT&CK
   

  

 – Erfarenhet av administration och projektarbete som kravanalys, Disaster Recovery och kontinuitetsplanering
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 – Analytiskt tänkande och problemlösningsförmånga
   

  

 – Noggrann och fokus på detaljer
   

  

 – Förmåga att arbeta bra på egen hand men även med grupp
   

  

 – Utmärk förmåga till samarbete och kommunikation
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi på Softronic jobbar ständigt med att förﬂytta våra kunder mot morgondagens teknik. Vare sig det handlar om att utveckla AI, automatisera processer eller modernisera en äldre lösning med bibehållen tillgänglighet. En annan sida av det vi gör är att vi hjälper våra kunder att utveckla innovativa och driftsäkra tjänster som skapar samhällsnytta genom att förenkla människors liv och jobb. På så sätt blir vi och vår teknik en positiv kraft i samhället och en del i att göra världen lite mer hållbar. Det är det vi kallar GoodTech.
   

  

 Vi ser arbetet och arbetsplatsen som en av flera energigivande delar i människans liv. Därför odlar vi aktivt en kultur av gemenskap och lust, där brädspelskvällar, löprundor med kollegorna längs vattnet eller en ﬁka på terrassen är viktigt och ska få lov att ta plats. Genom gemenskap och samhörighet blir det också enklare att tillsammans vidareutveckla våra förmågor, för att i förlängningen kunna vässa vårt erbjudande mot våra kunder.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Varmt välkommen att kontakta Linda Nyberg på linda.nyberg@softronic.se för mer information.
   

  

 Vi har valt media, säljsamtal undanbedes.
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroll kommer utföras vid rekryteringen.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the Data domain
 

 The Data domain is part of the Product and Tech function with the mission of transforming Trustly into a truly data-driven organization. We are responsible for every aspect of the data journey, from collection & modeling to analysis and visualization. We provide the whole organization with data and analytics artifacts aiming to improve our decisions, operations and the customer’s experience.
 








**About the role
 

 We are seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join our Machine Learning team. As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will work on building and deploying machine learning models that will help drive and automate critical business decisions within our product services. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge ML applications, collaborate with a multidisciplinary team, and take ownership of end-to-end machine learning lifecycles. If you're passionate about ML and AI, problem-solving, and building scalable solutions, we’d love to have you on board.
 





  




**What you’ll do** 
* **Model Development & Optimization:** 
 Develop end-to-end pipelines to deploy machine learning models into production environments and continuously improve model performance through feature selection, hyperparameter tuning and model lifecycle management
* **Data Pipeline Design & Management:** 
 Build and maintain efficient data pipelines for data collection, preprocessing, and feature transformation to ensure high-quality near real-time input for ML models
* **Performance Monitoring:** 
 Monitor and evaluate feature drift and the performance of deployed models, ensuring they meet business requirements and adjusting as necessary to maintain a high level of model performance over time
* **Collaborate Across Teams:** 
 Work closely with data scientists, software engineers, architects and product managers to understand the business needs and translate them into scalable machine learning products
* **Stay Ahead of Trends:** 
 Keep up with the latest advancements in machine learning and AI technologies, applying new methodologies and tools to enhance the effectiveness of your work



  




**Who you are** 
* **Experience:** 
 You have 5+ years of hands-on experience developing and deploying machine learning models in a production environment with near real-time latency
* **Education:** 
 You have a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field


**Technical Skills:** 
* Proficient in programming languages like Python, Java, or C++
* Experience with ML frameworks such as Sagemaker, MLFlow, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch and similar frameworks
* Strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistics, and optimization techniques
* Experience working with ML Operations, model lifecycle, infrastructure as code and CI/CD pipelines for model deployment
* Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, and deploying ML models at scale in said platforms
* Experience with big data tools and distributed computing (e.g., Spark, Apache Beam/Flink)
* Experience working with streaming data pipelines in Kafka (or similar)
* Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker)
* Experience within open banking is a plus but not required






  




  



 Kindly submit your CV in English.
 









 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, please apply now.****

title: Change & Delivery Manager to Speeron!
description:
*Do you have experience driving organizational change and leading teams through digital transformation? Are you ready to make a strategic impact on a growing business? Apply today for the role of Change & Delivery Manager at Speeron!*
**Your workday**
 As a Change & Delivery Manager at Speeron, you will lead the operations team responsible for specifying, installing, and configuring hardware and software within the client environment. The team comprises nine co-workers in Sweden, including technicians and project managers.
   

  

 Speeron is undergoing a digital transformation, evolving into a SaaS company that delivers its platform through partners on the global market. You will play a central role in driving this journey. With support from senior leadership, you will help shape and implement new systems and processes, ensuring their smooth integration into daily operations. This is a unique opportunity to influence how Speeron adapts to new technologies and to lead the change in how projects are managed within the organization.
   

  

 Your focus will be both operational and strategic. You will oversee ongoing client projects, ensuring they are delivered on time, while supporting the team in prioritizing tasks and coordinating efforts between clients and third-party subcontractors.
   

  

 While project management is important, the key focus of this role is change management. You will lead your team through a transformation, ensuring that the team remains aligned, motivated, and clear on what needs to be done. The person in this role will act as a strong people leader, guiding the team to deliver results, especially in a time of significant change with systems and processes evolving. Speeron is on the way to transforming into a SaaS company that delivers its platform through partners on the global market.
   

  

 As Speeron continues to grow, this role will evolve into a more senior position with increasing strategic influence.
   

  

 Speeron operates internationally, with offices in Sweden, Finland, Spain, Poland, and Norway, and clients in 17 countries. This role will involve some travel.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 To succeed in this role, we believe you have:
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience in leading teams and driving digital transformation in technical projects or operations.
* Proven expertise in change management, with a track record of leading teams through complex transformations.
* Strong experience in prioritizing tasks, managing project timelines, and ensuring timely deliveries.
* A background in project management, with the ability to transition into a strategic, change-driven role.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.
* Good skills in Office 365.


 It’s a bonus if you have experience in the hospitality sector. You should thrive in a fast-paced, evolving environment, be adaptable to new ways of working, and have a collaborative approach. You are a communicative, strong leader with the ability to inspire and motivate your team through change.
   

  

**Are we a good fit**
 Speeron is the leading integration and technology partner for the hospitality industry in the Nordic Region. We help create the Digital Guest Journey by streamlining hotel guest flows and adding sales opportunities throughout the guest experience – from arrival to check out. All parts of the Digital Guest Journey are fully integrated with the Speeron NEXT Platform. With contactless solutions and support for any PMS, Payment and Locking system, our solution will help any hotel to serve their guests more securely and fast. Speeron provides all infotainment and communication needs for hospitality, including networks, wireless HSIA and back office solutions, IPTV, digital signage, head ends and 24/7 support. https://speeron.com/

title: Är du vår nästa lösningsarkitekt inom Infor M3?
description:
*Har du gedigen erfarenhet inom Infor CloudSuite och framförallt M3, och är sugen på att göra något nytt? Drivs du av att jobba nära kund, och designa lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad? Har du redan gjort resan upp i "molnet", och är sugen på att fortsätta den resan med oss? Då låter du precis som den vi söker som vår nya kollega.* 
 ⭐️
   

  

 Om rollen som lösningsarkitekt
   

  

 Som lösningsarkitekt på Columbus är du tillsammans med ett projektteam ansvarig för att implementera lösningar inom Infor CloudSuite hos våra kunder, där ditt övergripande ansvar är att ta fram lösningsförslag och utforma arkitekturen. Dina uppgifter är varierande, och du är delaktig i projektets alla faser. Störst fokus är i leverans, men det finns också möjlighet att stötta i pre-sales. Du utför behovsanalys för att förstå kundens verksamhet, är med i design och presentation av lösningen samt projektgenomförande. Med andra ord, inte en tråkig stund! 😊
   

  

 På Columbus strävar vi efter att vara våra kunders
 **Trusted Advisors** 
 och guida dem genom hela deras digitala transformation. Därför är det viktigt att du trivs med att jobba nära kund, och du drivs av att skapa en förståelse för våra kunders verksamhet och deras specifika behov. Detta för att du och ditt projektteam tillsammans ska kunna forma lösningar ämnade för att underlätta och optimera våra kunders processer och verksamheter!
   

  

**Din framtida kollega Felipe, har en roll som Business Consultant inom Infor OS. Så här sammanfattar han sitt första intryck av Columbus:**
*"Det jag insåg direkt när jag började på Columbus är att det finns otroligt mycket verktyg, resurser och kompetens som man inte är rädd för att nyttja. Istället för att gå med den tekniska lösning som man redan kan, så vågar man prova sig fram och nyttja verktyg som i slutändan gör stor skillnad för kunden och deras processer. Infor OS är mitt intresseområde, och jag har märkt att det finns djup kompetens inom det på Columbus. Jag känner att mycket handlar om att det finns en otrolig nyfikenhet, och en otrolig tro på sina anställda att våga prova - vilket jag inte känt tidigare på något annat bolag.* 
 🧡
 *"*
 Vem är du?
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du är bra på att kommunicera, då du är bryggan mellan verksamhet och det tekniska. Du är skicklig på att anpassa din kommunikation på ett sätt som gör att både kund och kollegor förstår syftet och värdet av lösningen. Du har förmågan att se helheten i lösningen, men kan också grotta ned dig i detaljer när det behövs. Den erfarenhet vi ser att du har med dig är:
   

  

* Erfarenhet och en djup förståelse inom Infor M3
* Van att arbeta i stora projekt
* Vana att hålla i presentationer för kund


 Då du har löpande kontakt med kunder och kollegor på olika platser är det viktigt att du är flytande i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift. 🌏 Om vi får önska har du även erfarenhet av att jobba inom någon av våra fokusindustrier.
   

  

 Vad vi kan erbjuda
   

  

 Vi är världens största oberoende partner till Infor M3 och du kommer få möjlighet att arbeta i spännande projekt hos kunder - både nationellt och internationellt. Våra kunder är ofta tillverkande- och distribuerande företag, inom industrier som bland annat Manufacturing, Food & Beverage, Equipment, Rental & Lease och Fashion & Retail. Du kommer arbeta i projektform tillsammans med kompetenta och hjälpsamma kollegor som gärna delar med sig av sin kunskap.
   

  

 På samma sätt som du är engagerad i ditt arbete vill vi göra det vi kan för att skapa förutsättningar för en god balans i det välkända livspusslet. För vissa handlar det om förmåner som generösa friskvårdsbidrag, föräldralön, privat pensionsförsäkring eller extra ersättning vid sjukdom för att underlätta livets olika stadier. För andra handlar det om flexibla arbetstider eller en flexibilitet kring var du arbetar.
   

  

 Ansökan och nästa steg
   

  

 Intervjuer sker löpande och du kan ansöka med ditt CV eller LinkedIn. Rekryteringsprocessen kommer bestå av en telefonintervju, ett personlighet- och logiktest samt en bakgrundskontroll. Några frågetecken? Varmt välkommen att kontakta Daniel Sparrow.
   

  

 Om Columbus
   

  

 Vi har i över 30 år erbjudit kunder digitala lösningar, och för att skryta lite – har vi gjort det väldigt framgångsrikt. På Columbus har vi en omfattande branschkunskap som kombineras med ett stort utbud av digitala lösningar och en rejäl dos kundförståelse. Vår strävan är att bli kundens
 **Trusted Advisor** 
 och vi hjälper och vägleder kunden i alla delar av processen. Vi bygger, implementerar och förvaltar affärslösningar, lägger strategi och inspirerar! Summa summarum, så hjälper vi våra kunder att forma lösningar i toppklass efter branschspecifika behov så att de kan nå sin fulla digitala potential.
   

  

 Columbus är ett värdestyrt bolag med
 **engagerade medarbetare som stöttar varandra i både framgång som motgång** 
 . Att ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid är en självklarhet. Det kan vara allt från hämtning och lämning på förskola till väntan av det där paketet som ska levereras hem ”någon gång mellan 10-19”. Vi lämnar utrymme för återhämtning och ser till att arbeta proaktivt med blicken på horisonten. Dessutom så är vi riktigt bra på att fira framgångar och det är inte ovanligt med fika, lyxfrukost och AW på kontoret. 🥳
   

  

 Vi lever efter våra värdeord –
 **Stay Curious, Build Trust, Collaborate och Deliver Customer Success 🏆️**
 Jobba på Columbus
   

  

 Spana in vårt Insta-flöde för att få en bild av
 **hur det är att jobba hos oss** 
 genom våra kollegor. Klicka på bilden eller länken för att komma till Instagram-kontot.
   

  

**Helt ofiltrerat** 
 har vi samlat in omdömen från nuvarande och tidigare kollegor. Klicka nedan för att läsa mer.

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
**Om oss**
 Vi lever genom att effektivisera och förenkla affärsverksamheten hos svenska, nordiska och internationella företag. Vi kallar det Simplifying Business. Amesto-koncernen består av flera företag i Norge, Sverige och Danmark som erbjuder lösningar baserade på teknik, programvara, outsourcing, konsulttjänster och personal till företag av alla storlekar.
   

  

**People Planet Profit**
 Amesto är en plats där människor trivs och arbetar tillsammans mot samma mål. En arbetsplats där man är familjär, social och djupt engagerad i våra kundsamarbeten. På Amesto har vi de skarpaste huvuden och de varmaste hjärtan. Vi arbetar enligt vår trippla värdegrund People Planet Profit för då blir det som vi gör hållbart för oss, våra kunder och vår omvärld.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 Arbetsmiljön är professionell, med en social, öppen och varm kommunikation. Du kommer regelbundet att möta ditt teamet såväl på kontoret som på nätet. På så sätt får du goda möjligheter till support, stöd och samarbete i vardagen samtidigt som du kan stötta och förenkla för dina kollegor.
   

  

 Vi har en stark företagskultur och vi drar stor nytta av att vara en del av en nordisk koncern, där vi kontinuerligt jobbar med att väva in ny teknologi för att göra vardagen mer effektiv för våra kunder och medarbetare.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Marketing Specialist hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att designa, implementera och optimera digitala marknadsföringskampanjer med fokus på att attrahera nya kunder och driva tillväxt. Du kommer att arbeta med team internt samt externa byråer och rapportera direkt till CMO. Som en del i vårt team kommer du att arbeta i en fantastisk miljö där frihet, flexibilitet, glädje och ansvarstagande präglar kulturen.
   

  

 Vi tror att din utvecklingskurva hos oss blir brant. Arbetstimmarna kommer att vara flexibla, idag tillämpar vi en hybridlösning, så länge det fungerar med ditt team såklart! Hos oss är alla arbetsdagar olika och vi strävar efter individuella lösningar som är hållbara.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
* Planera och genomföra effektiva digitala kampanjer över flera plattformar. Identifiera de bästa kanalerna och teknikerna för att öka leadsgenerering.
* Experimentera med nya marknadsföringsstrategier och kanaler för att nå ut till nya målgrupper.
* Utveckla och förbättra SEO för att maximera synlighet och driva relevant trafik till våra digitala kanaler.
* Jobba nära CMO och externa byråer för att säkerställa att marknadsföringsinsatser är samordnade och effektivt genomförda.


**Vi söker dig som**
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta operativt inom marknad eller kommunikation
* Älskar att skapa innehåll som engagerar rätt målgrupp
* Är trygg i att använda HubSpot
* Är kreativ, ansvarstagande och vet hur du skall lösa utmaningar
* Är angelägen om att förbättra all kommunikation för bättre användar-och kundupplevelse.


**Kvalifikationer**
* En relevant utbildning eller motsvarande
* Erfarenhet av digital marknadsföring minst 2 år
* Färdigheter i HubSpot
* Färdigheter i copy & textbearbetning
* Färdigheter SEO både on & off page
* Grundläggande kunskap i Creative Cloud, främst photoshop.
* Van att hantera flera projekt parallellt.


 Vi söker en kandidat som kan stärka vårt team och bidra med nya perspektiv. Tjänsten kräver en viss erfarenhet och kompetens som vi bedömer passar den aktuella rollen och teamdynamiken. Vi välkomnar ansökningar från alla kvalificerade individer, oavsett kön, men ser gärna en mångfald i vårt team där olika erfarenheter och perspektiv kan komplettera varandra.
   

  

 Vi sitter i nya fina lokaler centralt på Vasagatan i Stockholm.
   

  

 Tillträde omgående eller enligt överenskommelse, och du är hjärtligt välkommen att kontakta oss för ytterligare information. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig.
   

  

 Tjänstens omfattning är heltid.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med löpande urval och intervjuer så varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.

title: Data Analyst, Commercial
description:
Insurance is all about life. And these days more than ever, it’s all about data. At If, we are developing technical solutions that have the power to turn misfortunes into possibilities and dreams into reality. We are now looking for an analyst with a passion for data to help us accelerate our pace within analytics.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be working in a cross-functional agile team, generating insights, and improving our digital B2B customer journeys. To succeed in your work, you will utilize flexible and robust data platforms, like Google Cloud and Databricks for data transformations and Power BI for analysis and visualization. This role blends data analysis, stakeholder collaboration, and actionable insights to elevate customer engagement and satisfaction. Changing market trends and influx of data in the largest insurance company in the Nordics offer you a great opportunity to develop yourself and contribute to If’s success in commercial insurances.
   

  

 Responsibilities of the role include:
   

  

* Design, develop and maintain operational reports to follow up and optimize performance (i.e., digital sales, CRM activities, etc.).
* Deep dive analysis to understand drivers of business performance and customer satisfaction.
* Develop analytical data assets/data products to be used in CRM-activities.
* Identify and specify needs for new data and take part in implementing new data pipelines.
* Provide strategic insights to improve our customer journey.
* Supporting users in their understanding of data and analytics, including evaluation of business results and communication with business stakeholders.


**About The Team**
 We strive to be an organization where you as an analyst can develop and be challenged, both personally and within analytics. Even though the work is autonomous, you won’t be left alone. We are team players with a strong drive and ambition to always deliver the best results - and we take pride in having fun along the way. Together we are a large Nordic community of technology and data professionals – over 200 colleagues supporting and pushing each other forward. To learn more how we work and think around technology, data, and analytics, please visit our Tech blog: If Technology – Medium
   

  

 We offer
   

  

 In the same way that we place high expectations on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
   

  

* An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits


 Who are you?
   

  

 We think that you have a strong interest for digital business and customer experience, but what gets you up in the morning is your interest in data and analytics. You want to work cross functionally to improve customer journeys and to help us understand new and existing customers even better. You have previously worked with analytics within CRM or sales and are comfortable with transforming large amount of data into actionable insights. And you are comfortable with talking to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
   

  

 We believe in hiring talented candidates and giving them room to grow, but we hope you’ll recognize yourself from the following characterizations:
   

  

* You have experience from a similar role.
* You possess good data transformation and programming skills (e.g., SQL, Python).
* You have data visualization experience from BI tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
* You have gained some experience in using cloud platforms like Databricks and BigQuery
* It would be great if you also have experience with web analytics tools like Google’s stack (incl GA, BigQuery and GTM), understanding of web technology (i.e., HTML or JavaScript), technical CRM understanding (for example with Salesforce) or experience working with CX data and its metrics like NPS.
* You have a relevant university degree.
* You are fluent in English, and in at least one Nordic language.


 Additional information and recruitment process
   

  

 Applying: Please apply through our recruitment system and attach your CV and answer in the questions on the application form. Please notice that we are not able to process any applications via email.
   

  

 Application deadline: Last day to apply is 9th of February 2025.
   

  

 Location: Turku, Espoo, Stockholm, Oslo, or Copenhagen
   

  

 Employment type: Permanent and full-time
   

  

 Traveling: Requires some occasional traveling in the Nordics
   

  

 Background check: Final candidates will undergo a background check before a job offer can be presented.
   

  

 Questions about the position or the process can be directed to Chapter Lead, Analytics Chapter, Business Area Commercial, Jani Lindén (jani.linden@if.fi).
   

  

 We are eager to hear from you!
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Network specialist with a passion for scripting | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB, a leading northern European financial services group and one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics, is seeking an innovative and driven Network Specialist with a strong interest in scripting and automation. As we navigate the rapidly changing landscape of banking, we pride ourselves on our entrepreneurial spirit and ability to adapt. Our exceptional engineers are dedicated to future-proofing SEB's digital architecture and customer products, making a tangible difference for both customers and colleagues. If this sounds like the right environment for you, read on!
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role you will be a part of a group of enthusiastic, empathetic, driven, and responsible professionals with a passion for technology and innovation. Our technicians are members of either the Secure Access or Core team, but we aim to function as a cohesive unit. We are currently seeking a Network Specialist, with a focus on scripting, automationand in the longer run, Cloud Network.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Collaborate with a team of 20 to maintain and develop SEB's Global Network including Network Security, and automations
* Balance the needs of our existing environment with our transition to the Cloud
* Work primarily within the Core team on Cisco routing/switching, firewalls, and network management appliances, while also being flexible to collaborate across virtual teams
* Continuously strive for process improvements, standardization, and automation for speed and precision


**What we expect:**
* A team player with excellent collaboration skills and the ability to work independently and confidently
* Strong programming/scripting skills, or a keen interest in developing them
* A commitment to sharing knowledge, ensuring secure and efficient solutions, and minimizing overlapping functionality


**We believe that you have experience in working with:**
* Scripting (Python, Bash, Shell or similar)
* Cloud (Preferrably Azure but AWS and GCP is also meritorious)
* IaC (Terraform, Ansible or similar)
* SD-WAN
* Cisco routing/switching
* Juniper firewalls


**What we offer:**
* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* International opportunities and working environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Availability Requirements**
 Willingness to work on-call during nights and weekends, as well as participate in 11 Service Windows and two Contingency tests scheduled each year.
   

  

**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 20th January 2025. Please be aware that the recruitment process and response time might take a bit longer than usual due to the Christmas holiday. If you have questions about the position, please contact Natalia Carreno Vera at natalia.vera@seb.se
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here:** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Python Architect
description:

 Dabster excels in matching top talent with leading global companies. Our goal is to be the premier recruitment specialist for securing top talent for various global clients
 



  
 



**Job Description:**

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
description:
**Juni who? 👋**
 At Juni, we’re busy building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.
   

  

**How & Why We Do It 🚀**
 We give our people the same thing we’re building for our customers: freedom. Freedom to be 100% yourself. Freedom to explore your potential and what’s more – make the most of it. We truly believe we’re making the world a better place for online businesses, and we want you to be a part of that mission.
   

  

**Your role at a glance 🤸‍♀️**
 As a Senior Product Marketing Manager at Juni, you will be a pivotal leader in driving product and customer insights. Your role is essential in ensuring that our product positioning, value propositions, competitor insights, market trends, product launches, and sales enablement are strategically aligned and impactful. You will collaborate closely with the Product, Commercial, and Communications teams, requiring a blend of creative, strategic, and tactical skills.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities 👏**
 In this role, you’ll:
   

  

 Lead and coordinate with a wide range of stakeholders within Product, Commercial, and Communications. As the marketing leader, you will own end-to-end launches of new products and key features, defining a tailored messaging strategy and delivering it to the team at Juni and our customers.
   

  

**Within 1 Month You'll**
* Successfully onboard and gain a comprehensive understanding of Juni’s product suite, positioning, and messaging.
* Establish strong relationships with product managers and marketing team stakeholders.


**Within 3 Months You'll**
* Develop advanced competitive positioning and feature-level comparisons for established and emerging competitors in the market.
* Collaborate with the marketing and brand teams to create assets and deliver integrated product marketing campaigns across owned, earned, and paid channels.
* Extract insights from our community of customers and apply them to Product Marketing practices.
* Lead your first major product launch.


**Within 6 Months You'll**
* Deliver best-in-class product marketing for product releases and demonstrate the successful impact they have had.
* Conduct your first internal training session for stakeholders.
* Drive optimization and automation in marketing with the Marketing and RevOps teams.


**Tooling ⚙️**
* Slack
* G-suite
* Miro
* Asana
* Linear
* Intercom
* Figma


**Qualifications 👑**
 What we need to see
   

  

* Minimum 3-5 years of experience within a B2B role (sales, marketing, product).
* Strong stakeholder management and prioritization skills.
* Proven experience working cross-functionally between teams.
* A strong inclination towards data-driven decisions.
* Native or Business-level fluency in both Swedish and English


 What we’d love to see
   

  

* Extensive experience in owning the end-to-end product launch and retrospective process, leveraging learnings to improve efficiencies.
* Expertise in navigating market product positioning and messaging nuances.


**Your people 👥**
 Our team is as ambitious as our amazing customers. We aim high and we move with speed to make our vision a reality. We care deeply about building a better future for our customers and each other. Here, you can work with people at the top of their game and who didn’t get there by playing games. You can help us create a whole new category in financial services.
   

  

**Your Benefits 😍**
 We’re freedom-first. Transparent. Caring. Empowering. So our benefits are too.
   

  

* We work hybrid. We'll see you in one of our offices in Stockholm or Gothenburg at least two days per week.
* Swap 2D for 3D. Meet all Junis IRL at the company onsite each year.
* Diversity is at our core. We're part Swedish. Part Canadian. Part French. Part Indian. Part Italian. Part British. Part Portuguese. You get the idea.
* Great players can stay great players. Progress your career whether you choose to manage people or not.
* Stock options. We can’t promise you’ll make a fortune. But we’ll give it our very best shot.
* Vacation days. 30 days contractually. Unlimited in policy. Awesome.
* Private Health insurance. You know. Just in case
* Beautiful offices in central Gothenburg and Stockholm, front row sea view!


 At Juni, we’re building the future of banking. We want to help businesses do more with less and get access to the financial tools they need to operate, grow, and win globally.

title: Data Engineer
description:
At Kivra, we are building services that connect 6 million people, by providing a safe and accessible digital infrastructure that everyone in Sweden can trust and use. At the same time, we are saving trees - reducing the paper that is printed and transported - by providing a better digital alternative to physical paper communication.
 



  





**Why are we looking for a Data Engineer?** 




 We have a modern, cloud-based data platform, which you will build upon and improve with other engineers in the team. As part of the vision of the Data Platform Team at Kivra, we are developing an internal platform for analysts and engineers to improve the ease and experience of working with data across the organization.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 



* Build and maintain an internal development platform for data tools, services, and workflows
* Standardize configurations and workflows
* Automate redundant tasks
* Ensure compliance (e.g. GDPR) and security across all golden paths
* Adopt a “platform as a product” approach, treating analysts and engineers as our customers; aim to improve the analyst and engineering experience working with data tools and services, and remove complexity and cognitive load of our customers
* Use your knowledge and expertise to work with data stakeholders to make data easily accessible and available to product and functional teams in Kivra (this data is used for, amongst others, business intelligence, analytics, reporting and billing). We are responsible for a number of data products and services which we provide to the rest of the organization (e.g. APIs and data integrations)
* Build, improve and maintain a resilient and scalable data infrastructure
* As a team, we have full ownership and autonomy over what and how we build our solutions - from idea and design, to implementation and operations. We are responsible for our solutions end-to-end.



  





**Who you are** 




 You want to join a fun, diverse and friendly team. You are a team player who wants to build good relationships with your colleagues to understand their problems and challenges. You embrace “platform thinking” in your work - and strive to enable and support your colleagues, not block them. You are proactive, entrepreneurial and want to shape this role based on the opportunities you discover. You are curious, collaborative and like solving problems.
 



  





**Furthermore we think that you:** 



* Are easy-going, open and bring positive energy to your work and colleagues
* Have at least 4 years of full-time software engineering experience, and an interest in data engineering and platform engineering
* Have experience working with automation, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), version control, containerization, and CI/CD (we use Terraform, GitHub, Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions)
* Have experience working in a cloud platform - GCP, Azure, or AWS (we use GCP)
* Are comfortable with Python and SQL
* Are already familiar with, or want to work in the data engineering space (and associated tooling, e.g. Airflow and dbt)



  





**And it would be a bonus if you:** 



* Are familiar with Google Cloud Platform and the tooling there
* Have experience with data engineering and data tooling - e.g. Airflow, dbt, cloud data warehouses



  





**Additional information** 




 This role is full-time and our offices are based in Stockholm. You will be part of the Data Platform Team and report to the manager of the Data Platform Team.
 



 The Data Platform Team has a hybrid work location policy - in practice this means most of the team is in the office 1-2 days a week, and come into the office as required for certain workshops or important meetings/discussions. Fluency in English is required and fluency in Swedish is a plus but not required. Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor new work permits, but are able to sponsor/renew existing work permits!
 



  





**We offer** 




 Kivra offers a role in a caring and committed team, in a company that is growing and continuously innovating. You’ll join a warm and friendly culture that thrives on collaboration and teamwork. You will be involved in shaping and influencing a product currently used by more than half of Sweden’s population.
 



 We offer competitive remuneration and great benefits. We offer a hybrid way of working where working from home is of course accepted, however you are always welcome to join us in our vibrant office located in central Stockholm.
 



  





**Recruitment process** 



1. **Submit your application.** 
 Real humans review all applications, and we carefully consider each application.
2. **Hear from us.** 
 If your profile is a good match, we’ll set up a 30 minute video call screening with a member of our Talent Acquisition Team.
3. **Hiring manager interview.** 
 This is a 60 minute video call with the hiring manager.
4. **Take-home assignment and technical interview.** 
 You will be sent a take-home assignment, which should take you no longer than 2 hours to complete. You will then present this take-home assignment in a 60 minute technical interview.
5. **Ways of working, behaviors and values interview.** 
 This is a 60 minute interview where we discuss ways of working, behaviors and Kivra values.
6. **Reference and background check.** 
 At the end of the recruitment process we will ask you for references, whom we will contact.
7. **Offer.** 
 If you are the final candidate and you also choose to join us, we will provide you with a contract including our offer and benefits package.



  





**How to apply** 




 The application deadline is February 2nd, but we will review applications on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait – submit your application today! If you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact Sarah Ohlsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at sarah.ohlsson@kivra.com.

title: Senior Data Engineer, Data and Analytics Solutions
description:
Insurance is all about life. And it’s all about IT. There are over 1000 techies in the IT community at If. Most of our tech teams are working in an agile setup consisting of tribes and cross-functional squads to enable an optimal environment to reach our shared objectives and key results. In our team, you will work with technical solutions that have the power to turn misfortunes into possibilities and dreams into reality. We use modern technologies to create front-running insurance experiences for our customers. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new business, and live their lives. Read more about the important work that we do here: https://medium.com/if-tech
   

  

**About The Squad**
 The Data and Analytics unit’s main responsibility is to enable the use of data in If. We build data products, develop data & analytics platforms for the Private, Commercial, and Claims business areas. We are responsible for data lake, data warehouse, analytics, and business intelligence solutions. Our overall data platform is a cornerstone in If’s data strategy, and we work according to agile development principles with product owners and scrum teams. You will be joining a unit with more than 60 enthusiastic developers, engineers, architects, and managers. Our squads are mostly located at the If offices in Turku, Espoo, Stockholm, Oslo, and Riga. You will be working in a data squad inside the Data and Analytics unit.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Senior Data Engineer, you build, maintain, and monitor state-of-the-art cloud-based analytics solutions. You collaborate with data engineers and data scientists on building production-ready solutions and defining best practices. You also contribute to defining data & analytics target architecture and roadmap. You secure good relations with internal customers and other stakeholders.
   

  

 We offer
   

  

 In the same way that we place high expectations on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
   

  

* An inclusive work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits


 Who are you?
   

  

 We are looking for someone with extensive SQL knowledge and experience. Experience with dbt is essential. You should be fluent in English and proficiency in one of the Nordic languages is considered beneficial. You also possess good communication skills.
   

  

 Additionally, it is beneficial if you have experience with other programming languages like Python or .Net (C#). Familiarity with modern cloud-based data and analytics solutions, preferably on Microsoft Azure and/or Databricks, is also beneficial.
   

  

 It is a plus if you have previous experience in developing, deploying, and owning batch and real-time data pipelines, preferably using Databricks, Data Factory, and dbt. Experience with CI/CD and ADO pipelines is appreciated. If you have previous experience with resource deployment using Terraform, PowerShell, Bash, or experience in implementing processes supporting data transformations, metadata, and data governance – you are of extra interest to us!
   

  

 You will be a great fit for the role if you enjoy working as part of a team, but you're also happy to design and develop solutions on your own. You push your team forward on best practices and ways of working and you enjoy working with people from different backgrounds.
   

  

 Additional information and recruitment process
   

  

 Applying: Please apply through our recruitment system and attach your CV and answer in the questions on the application form. We will start screening and interviewing candidates already during the application period.Please notice that we are not able to handle any applications outside our recruitment system (Workday).
   

  

 Deadline: Last day to apply is 9th of February 2025.
   

  

 Location: Turku, Espoo, Stockholm or Oslo
   

  

 Employment type: Permanent and full-time
   

  

 Traveling: Requires some occasional traveling in the Nordics and Baltics
   

  

 Background check: Final candidates will undergo a background check before a job offer can be presented. Background checks will be done in accordance with the law in the country of employment
   

  

 If have any questions about the position, please contact Data and Analytics Manager Mikko Mansikkamäki via phone (+358 40-777-5470) during 23.1.2025 8:30-10:00 EET or 28.1.2025 8:30-10:00 EET. You can also contact Mikko via email: mikko.mansikkamaki@if.fi. Please notice that we are not able to process any applications via email.
   

  

 We are eager to hear from you!
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Data Engineer med erfarenhet till kund inom bank och försäkring
description:
**Har du ett par års erfarenhet inom tech och vill ta nästa steg i din karriär?** 
**Vi söker nu en erfaren Data Engineer med intresse för modern teknologi. Rollen erbjuder spännande möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och bidra till innovativa projekt i en dynamisk agil miljö.**
**Att jobba som Data Engineer hos kund**
 Som Data Engineer hos kund kommer du att få utvecklas inom bank och finans. Du kommer att få arbeta i ett kompetent team som har en blandning mellan juniora och seniora medarbetare. Teamet jobbar agilt.
   

  

 I din roll kommer du få arbeta design, skapande och underhåll av infrastrukturer och pipelines för att hantera stora mängder data. Målet är att säkerställa att data är tillgänglig, tillförlitlig och optimerad för analys. Du kommer att få jobba med tekniker plattformar och verktyg som Azure Databricks, Data Vault och SQL.
   

  

 Rollen är placerad i Stockholm.
   

  

**Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**
 Som konsult hos Nexer Tech Talent får du möjlighet att fortsätta utvecklas i din karriär genom spännande uppdrag och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent och arbeta hos vår kund i Stockholm med start enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Under din tid som konsult får du stöd av en mentor hos kund och en konsultchef från Nexer Tech Talent. Du blir också en del av ett starkt nätverk av konsulter och bjuds in till regelbundna aktiviteter såsom föreläsningar, nätverksträffar och AW. Målet är att du efter avslutat uppdrag på tolv månader erbjuds en fast anställning hos kund.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har 2-3 års erfarenhet av arbete inom data och en teknisk universitetsexamen inom data, teknik eller mjukvaruutveckling.
* Har ett stort intresse för Azure Databricks, Data Vault och SQL.
* Som person är analytisk, samarbetsorienterad eller initiativtagande.


**Ansökan**
 Låter detta som nästa steg i din karriär? Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan snarast. Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Olivia Holm på olivia.holm@nexergroup.com.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Account Executive (New Business Sales) – Manufacturing, Logistics, Automotive, E&U + Retail, Consumer Goods and T&H Sectors – Sweden
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Cognizant**
 At Cognizant (Nasdaq: CTSH), we engineer modern businesses to improve everyday life because we're dedicated to making a lasting impact. We help our clients modernize technology, reimagine processes and transform experiences so they can stay ahead in our fast-changing world. Together, we're improving everyday life. See how at www.cognizant.com or @cognizant.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Reporting to the EMEA Chief Commercial Officer and aligned to Cognizant’s Products & Resources (MLEU + RCGTH) Business Unit, Cognizant is looking for an experienced “Account Executive” to join their new business sales team.
   

  

 As a new business Account Executive, you are an enterprise sales professional experienced in selling to and opening new logo accounts.
   

  

 Selling the full suite of Cognizant’s services and solutions, including market leading capabilities in Digital, Data, AI, and Cloud, etc, you know how to create value and drive business outcomes. This role will have responsibility for pursuing 10-15 targeted Accounts. Accounts will typically be oriented geographically to location but may include marquee accounts outside of Sweden. The Account Executive will work with a Client Partner and team that will support all sales pursuits and an offshore team will provide targeted marketing into designated accounts.
   

  

**Your Background**
* Demonstrable track record in new business / net new logo sales for a large Tier 1 or Tier 2 Global Systems Integrator
* Experience of working alongside and building relationships within major Manufacturing, Logistics, E&U + Retail, Consumer Goods and Travel & Hospitality organizations
* Experience of working for a Global Services Firm with onshore, nearshore and offshore capabilities.
* Knowledge and experience selling similar Services including Digital, Data, Cloud, Consulting and application modernization
* Demonstrable success selling multi million, multi-year deals.
* Demonstrable consecutive quarterly and yearly quota achievement in complex selling environments utilizing a solution selling model.


**Top Reasons To Join Our Team**
* Excellent compensation/benefits. A strong financial incentive package that includes a solid base salary with a highly attractive commissions plan. Further incentives include award programs, club trips, and excellent benefits package.
* Wide exposure to industry, product and functional best practices; as well as world-class teams supporting your sales pursuits.
* Supportive management team that rewards initiative & success.
* Exciting, industry leading practice where you can truly build a long-term career.
* Congenial, collaborative, and success-oriented culture; the opportunity to work with and learn from a diverse, highly experienced team of business professionals. Tremendous opportunities for growth with a real career path promoting career advancement.


**A Good Fit For The Cognizant Culture**
 A person who possesses a true passion for changing organizations for the better, and desires to do so within a success-oriented, yet professional atmosphere filled with business professionals who all manifest a belief in partnership, innovation, and excellence. Our “Cultural Value Drivers” are well-known and clearly communicated within the organization: Open, Transparent, Driven, Empowered, Opportunity-Filled, Flexible & Collaborative.

title: Global Account Manager (GAM) - EU
description:
**Job Description**
**Company** 
 :
   

  

 Cogent Communications is a multinational, Tier 1 facilities-based ISP, consistently ranked as one of the top five networks in the world and is publicly traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market under the ticker symbol CCOI. Cogent specializes in providing businesses with high speed Internet access, Ethernet transport services and is one of the only US providers who own and operate their own fibre infrastructure spanning the US for diverse Wave connectivity. Cogent's facilities-based, all-optical IP network backbone provides IP services in over 235 markets globally. Since its inception, Cogent has unleashed the benefits of IP technology, building one of the largest and highest capacity IP networks in the world. This network enables Cogent to offer large bandwidth connections at highly competitive prices. Cogent also offers superior customer support by virtue of its end-to-end control of service delivery and network monitoring.
   

  

**Position Overview:**
 The Global Account Manager is responsible for identifying and securing new business opportunities globally. By employing consultative selling techniques and relationship-building strategies, you will work directly with the nation’s leading IT Decision Makers to position Cogent's connectivity solutions. This role involves proactive outreach through direct calling, email, and onsite meetings, with a strong focus on understanding clients' current and future connectivity needs. Success in this position will be measured by meeting or exceeding monthly revenue goals and establishing Cogent as a trusted partner across commercial and retail buildings, carrier-neutral hotels, data centers, and colocation facilities.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Identify, qualify, and secure new business opportunities within a global sales territory, focusing on market segments who require IP transit, Wave connectivity, Ethernet, Colocation and IPv4 services.
* Use direct calling, email outreach, and customer meetings to connect with Key Decision Makers and generate new business opportunities.
* Employ consultative and relationship-driven sales approaches to identify prospective clients’ current and future connectivity needs.
* Position Cogent’s services as the preferred choice by leveraging our extensive global network footprint, which spans commercial and retail buildings, carrier-neutral hotels, data centers, and colocation facilities.
* Collaborate with internal teams to ensure customer needs are met and expectations exceeded.
* Maintain and update detailed records of sales activities in CRM systems, tracking progress, and managing customer relationships.


**Qualifications** 
 :
   

  

* Telesales experience in any industry, with B2B sales experience being an advantage
* Proven ability to identify, qualify, and generate new business opportunities through proactive prospecting and research.
* Strong communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to engage effectively with Key Decision Makers.
* Self-motivated, positive, and proactive, with a passion for adding value to clients and excelling in a competitive, revenue-driven environment.
* Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, team-oriented and competitive environment with revenue-driven goals and rewards.
* Familiarity with CRM systems and basic proficiency in Microsoft Office are beneficial.
* Telecommunications experience or knowledge of connectivity solutions is advantageous but not essential.
* Cogent operates a global sales model so foreign language skills are an advantage


**Work Environment:**
 This is an in-office position, five days a week, designed to support your success through focused mentorship, training, and personal coaching.
   

  

 To apply for the Global Account Manager position, please submit your resume and cover letter to careers@cogentco.com .
   

  

 Cogent Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Billing System Engineering Manager
description:
**The role of a Billing System Engineering Manager, Commercial Systems at Canonical**
 This engineering management role is an opportunity for a technologist with a passion for Linux and Ubuntu to build a career with Canonical and drive the success of the business. If you have an affinity for open source development, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 The Commercial Systems unit has several areas of responsibility spread across six engineering teams, closely collaborating with other engineering and business teams at Canonical. Services designed, developed, and operated by the Commercial Systems unit are at the heart of Canonical business and Salesforce plays an integral role in it.
   

  

 The Billing team's mission is to develop an internal billing system, delivering a consistent billing experience to all Canonical customers across all products and services, and across all service delivery methods. This challenging assignment requires close cooperation with business departments to ensure our customers are billed accurately and reliably, while achieving the highest engineering standards expected of any engineering team at Canonical.
   

  

 We are looking for an engineering manager with prior engineering experience in a high-level programming language, who strives for the highest engineering quality, seeks improvements, continuously develops their skills, and applies them at work. This is an exciting opportunity to work on a fairly unique solution and build expertise in billing and finance.
   

  

**Location** 
 : This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
   

  

**What your day will look like**
* Lead, mentor, and hire a team of software engineers
* Seek improvements to established processes, designs, and engineering solutions
* Partner with business customers to understand business needs
* Collaborate on business analysis and technical designs
* Deliver engineering solutions


**What we are looking for in you**
* Experience as a software developer in a high-level language - preferably Go or Python
* Experience as a hands-on engineering manager or a team lead
* Experience designing or implementing billing systems
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
* Ability to collaborate remotely with a diverse set of team members and stakeholders, remain highly motivated, productive, and organized in a fully remote environment
* Ability to travel to international destinations for one week at a time, approximately 2-4 times per year. Locations prior to the global pandemic included New York, Seattle, London, Cape Town, Budapest, Berlin, Montreal, and Brussels


**Additional skills that you might also bring**
* Experience with Salesforce or NetSuite
* Experience in a business role such as sales, finance, or operations
* Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science or a related engineering field


**What we offer you**
 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
   

  

* Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: BMS System Verification Engineer - Modeling Focused
description:
**Work with the latest technologies to shape tomorrow´s society**  

Imagine yourself working with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in the transport and infrastructure industry, developing cutting-edge technologies and sustainable transport solutions that will change the future of society.

  

Volvo Group Electromobility is transforming the automotive industry, and we are looking for talented individuals who want to be part of this exciting evolution! Our Electromobility organization is at the forefront of the development lifecycle for electric powertrains—covering everything from advanced engineering and product development to the maintenance phase. Together, we are leading the transition from conventional powertrains to electromobility, leveraging cutting-edge engineering, innovative research, and proven technologies within Volvo Group. By joining us, you’ll collaborate with a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who are driven by passion, mutual trust, and a commitment to embracing change.

  

Are you a Verification Engineer with a thirst for both practical and theoretical challenges connected to battery management testing? - Then join us and embark on an extraordinary adventure.  

  

**Introducing our team!**  

Today our team consists of passionate colleagues dedicated to verification and testing. We are located in CampX, the building consists of labs, collaboration areas and work areas, is a building where collaboration comes naturally. The mission of our work is to ensure that the Battery Management System (BMS) is functioning correctly in regards of safety, performance, and functional requirements. The day-to-day work is primarily conducted in a Hardware in the Loop (HIL) environment where we define and perform tests. Additionally, we're constantly develop new test environments and rigs to meet the current and future testing demands.

 **The Role**  

In this job, your main responsibility will be to develop models to be used in battery software testing in our HIL rigs. You will take lead in SW model development (FPGA) for HIL test environment for new battery products. You will also work with developing SW models for in-house circuit boards including commissioning and test of these.

  

To take on these responsibilities you need to be a person who thrives in taking responsibility, challenging yourself and others while delivering to different projects. Since we are working closely with software development teams, suppliers and other functions, we envision you as a good collaborator. Someone who enjoys coming up with the best solutions together with others, if you have a great idea, we want to hear about it!

 **Qualifications**


You need to have a Bachelor or Masters in power electronics, electrical and electronics or similar. Since the role requires a deeper understanding of developing and testing the Battery Management System, you will need to have around five years of experience within relevant fields and be proficient in English.  

  

**Highly meriting is experience in:**  

* Experience in Matlab/simulink
* FPGA modelling experience
* Vitis model composer, Vivado and Xilinx
* Good knowledge of SPI protocols and ISO/SPI
* Knowledge from different cell supervision circuit suppliers
* Very skilled in dSPace tools and HIL rigs.
* Fault tracing – CAN log analysis
* Experience in software development or testing of battery management systems
 **Why Volvo Group Electromobility?**  

Our electromobility organization is a fascinating and dynamic area for creative individuals who like to push boundaries and exploring new ideas. Here there is always room for creativity in solving complex issues and challenging the status quo. By joining us you’ll get passionate colleagues committed to making a positive impact on the world and you as a person get to contributing with your skills to help us in our collective mission. There are constant innovations and improvements happening in the field and working with electromobility allows you to be at the forefront of these technological developments.  

  

If this sounds interesting to you then please apply! And do not hesitate to reach out to us if you have any questions.

  

Last application date is 9th of February 2025.  

Marco Lind, Manager HIL infrastructure, Marco.lind@volvo.com

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join Volvo Group.

  

Group Trucks Technology are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Senior Imaging Engineer
description:
Job Title
Senior Imaging Engineer
Job Description*Do you want to be where creativity and new ideas are appreciated? Now you have the opportunity to work as Senior Imaging Engineer in Product Platforms Imaging team and lead the development of the base for the world's best surveillance cameras.*
Your future team – Product Platforms Imaging
We are a Product Platform Imaging team that is responsible for the imaging and video algorithms as well as frameworks used in all Axis products based on externally developed chipsets. The work takes place in close collaboration with our partners, Axis product development teams as well as other core technology teams.
Your role as Senior Imaging Engineer
You will work in key areas related to image and video processing with focus on algorithms, image sensors and quality enhancement features. Majority of your time will be spent on design and development of algorithms and frameworks needed to take imaging quality to the next level and make the development process more efficient.
You will be driving high-level strategical direction for the area both in terms of technical roadmap and competence need. This includes monitoring development and new technologies within the imaging area in general, competition offerings as well as having tight collaboration and dialog with other teams in Axis working with relevant technical areas.
You will also be working long term by identifying and ordering development of new technologies, initiatives and projects needed to retain Axis’s leading position within image quality for surveillance in a very competitive worldwide market.
In this position, you will occasionally travel to Axis vendors in US and Asia to evaluate, set requirements, improve, and make sure that we get the best possible quality in Axis products.
Who are you?
You are an energetic and dedicated person with a personal drive and ability to work both unsupervised and as a part of a team. You have a genuine interest in image processing algorithms, image quality evaluation, troubleshooting and software development.
You enjoy sharing your vision and progress with others and by doing so you align with your co-workers towards a common goal. The ability to break down complex issues, organize and structure the work is another important skill needed to be successful in this role.
You have M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in computer science, physics, mathematics, electrical engineering or similar.
Experience in the following domains is valuable:* Expertise and experience of developing image and video algorithms: auto-exposure, auto-white balance, auto-focus, video stabilization, noise reduction algorithms, HDR algorithms, color mapping/tuning methodologies
* Experience with key building blocks: imaging algorithms, programming of image pipelines, image sensors, optics (solid knowledge from SW to HW)
* Strong understanding of Image Science & Image Quality concepts
* Strong programming skills, e.g. on Linux, C/C++, MATLAB
* Experience from working with technology and platform vendors


The position is office-based, and you will be working at Axis headquarters in Lund, Sweden.
Ready to act?
If you have any questions, please contact recruiting manager, Sabina Ahlberg at +46 46 272 3736.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-02-14*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

description:

* Harmonize and approve incoming requirements.
* Break down and allocate harmonized requirements.
